1.content:
Alice Carlyle and Zack Tyler.

Two young lovers, brought together by random chance one Summer's day in Daven's Port, were now taking the biggest step had ever taken in their young lives.

Bigger than dating. Bigger than being exclusive. Bigger than living in the same city together. Bigger than living with Zack's Mom.

Alice Carlyle and Zack Tyler, two young but ambitious lovers, were about to move in together.

They were about to move in together, and they were ready to cross the country to do it.

East Coast natives at heart, neither Zack nor Alice had ever dreamt of going so far west. Settling squarely in the middle of the country, the titular couple had managed to make a decent start at carving out a little life for themselves.

Zack's hard work at the Hammond chain of hotels had netted him a cozy promotion into a covetous management position. He had been working there ever since he had gotten out of high school, impressing coworkers and superiors alike with his surprising work ethic. While he certainly isn't the sharpest knife in the drawer, Zack's ability to buckle down and deliver results is impressive enough to merit sending him to help develop the Abercrombie branch of the Hammond Hotel chain.

Meanwhile, Alice has landed a promising scholarship at Abercrombie State University. After spending two years in a Community college back in Daven's Port, Alice has earned herself a very rare opportunity to make it big in the fashion world. She was the one most hesitant about the move, but knowing that Zack will be making enough for them to live off-campus together while she devotes herself full-time to studies certainly makes it easier. Plus, getting out from under her mother's thumb is certainly a plus!

Thanks to the perks of being (and being involved with) a company man, Zack and Alice were afforded one week all-expenses paid at the luxurious (but somewhat lacking!) Hammond Hotel while the finer things with their apartment were ironed out. It was a show of good faith, and one that they were both very happy to recieve, but it was definitely nice to have finally settled in the place they'd be calling home for the forseeable future.

It wasn't a big apartment by any means, but it was certainly nice. Nicer than either of them had been used to. Alice had spent every year since she was fifteen crammed into a dorm room, and Zack had been sharing his brownstone apartment with his mother and four other siblings since... well, birth. All this extra elbow room was definitely something that would take some getting used to!

In fact, there was a kitchen suite, a back porch that overlooked the city, there was even a spare bedroom to do with what they saw fit!

So nice, especially for being so young.

They just had to be careful. Living alone, by themselves, without either of their respectively shrewish mothers to constantly impose themselves on their lives... it was scary!

But they could do it, right?

Living together, here in Abercrombie... it might be easier than they thought!

***


Warm steam filled the bathroom as the shower hissed loudly overhead.

Alice brought her head underneath the nozzle, letting the shampoo rinse out of her long blonde hair. She ran her fingers through it, scrubbing and scratching until the residual soap had bubbled and died underneath the constant current of steaming water. Extending a hand blindly, her bright blue eyes closed just in case, Alice turned off the water to the shower and felt for her towel.

Extending one long ivory leg, Alice stepped out of the shower.

"Hey babe."

Without the shower to drown it out, the sound of the sink echoed off the tiles of their new bathroom walls. Zack stood leaned over the sink, still dressed in his pajamas. He was shaving, clearing away the poofy white beard of cream he had spread over his neck and chin. He smiled beneath the opening he had left for his mouth, cutting his eyes at her reflection in the foggy mirror.

"Hey." Alice said with a smile of her own.

They had been living together for two weeks now, and the novelty of seeing each other in various states of undress had yet to wear off. This hadn't been the first time that they had inadvertantly intruded on one another's morning routine, but it was beginning to become a welcome installment to their day to day lives.

Of course they had been seeing each other naked for quite a while now—it must have had something to do with the fact that they were living together that made it so special, they both thought as Alice wrapped her arms around his waist.

They were the picture-perfect couple; and the mirror agreed, as it framed the two together.

"Scooch over, I need the mirror." Alice said with a playful bump of her hip

"Almost done, almost done..."
1.title: Small Beginnings

Semi-formal—Zack was going out to meet a friend for lunch...
Casual wear—Zack had heard about this new store opening up at the mall...

11.content:
As Zack scraped off the last of his stubble, he gave the man in the mirror a confident smile.

Damn, he was handsome.

Wrapping one arm around his girl, Zack came in for a quick kiss before letting her to her own devices.

Things had been going great for Zack so far. His sweet new promotion meant that he finally had enough money (and a good enough reason) to move out of his mom's house back home. The move had been a big step for him, not to mention a big step for his relationship with Alice, but after two weeks in his new life, Zack was finally beginning to feel like his old self again... maybe even better!

Zack shed his baggy white t-shirt and flannel pajama pants, exposing the lithe figure beneath. He wasn't exactly athletic, but he had a natural muscle tone and firmness to his figure. Most guys, after being in a relationship for so long, might have let their guard down. Started to bulk up a little, and not in a good way. But not him—at least, not yet anyway. And not if he had anything to say about it!

Zack stretched appreciatively, his lean figure silhouetted by the morning sun as it flittered through the drapes.

Laid out on top of the comforter, Zack had selected his clothes for the day...
11.title: A Day in the Life of Zack

choices: Rick "Rooker" Fuller, a friend from an old job I used to have.
Piper Black, a close friend from my hometown.
Dakota Johnson, a friend from my hometown.
112.content:
Blue button up shirt? Check. Blacker than black jeans? Check. Long slim belt with a big ass buckle? Triple check. Two black shoes that have just recently been shined? Check, check, checkity, check!

"Is it weird that this is now what I call my 'everyday' outfit?" Zack asked, holding the shirt carefully.

"Not really." Alice answered truthfully as she started dressing up as well, "And honestly, I consider that a good thing."

"Why?"

"Because it shows that we're getting enough money to where we afford fancier choices for our 'peasant' clothes." She joked before walking towards him.

"Yeah well, I'm glad you're getting a kick out of it." He replied as the outfit became one with his body, "Still though, you have to admit that my old hoodie and blue jeans combo had a certain charm to it."

"Oh, it did. It was called the 'I'm still a young kid straight out of Highschool with nothing grand in life' charm."

"Damn, girl! When you'd get all savage?" Zack asked, slightly taken aback.

"I'm just teasin' ya, ya big dork." She said with a smile.

Soon the two love birds had embraced each other once more and shared a brief yet passionate kiss.

"So, you excited for today?"Alice asked once she released Zack from her arms.

"Hell yeah." He replied as his hair was being combed, "I haven't had time to eat out with an old friend recently. Figured that had to change."

"Who're you hangin' out with again?"
112.title: Nothing like a get together with a friend right?

choices: "Alright, I'm in."
"Sorry, Rooker. I made a promise and I can't break it."
"Let me think about it."
1121.content:
Zack's mouth became tighter than a zip lock bag. He'd hoped and prayed that Alice wouldn't care who he was meeting up with. But then again, this was inevitable.

"Ri-" Zack started before trailing off.

"Who?"

"Rick Fuller." Zack said before looking away.

He didn't see her face but man he could feel it contorting into a face of disappointment.

"Really?" Alice asked, "You have a lot of great and wonderful friends to choose from and you chose to hang out with Rooker?"

"Well, we haven't talked in a while."

"Yeah, for a very good reason!" Alice snapped, "Don't tell me you actually sought him out."

"He called me, alright?!"

"How much does he need this time?"

"A whopping zero dollars and zero cents!" Zack sarcastically replied, "News flash, he just wants to hang out at some pizza place."

"Then he wants you to do something illegal." Alice said furiously, "He probably wants you to help him rob that very pizza place."

"Will you stop it with the judging shit?!" Zack shouted, his voice nearly cracking. "Why do you keep insisting that he's some Seth Gecko wannabe that's trying to get me into robbing?!"

"Because he already tried roping you in." Alice's tone was filled to the brim with tranquil fury. Calm and collected, but stilled stuffed with rage.

"Yeah and I rejected him flat." Zack said, much calmer than he initially was.

Soon they were both calm enough to lay on the bed, holding hands as they did so.

"You're a wonderful man, Zack." Alice said as she finally broke the ice, "Your heart is huge, and I'm scared Rooker's gonna try and take advantage of that."

"Don't worry about me." He said warmly, "I can take care of myself. I know you don't understand but, but he's been in my life too much for me to just ignore him."

"But was he involved in a good way?"

"Yeah, he actually was, back when we both worked in that shit job at Spencer's."

Alice couldn't help but widen her eyes in shock and turn her head towards him.

"You worked at a Spencer's?"

"Yup. I'm sure you'll understand when I say I don't like talking about it." Zack replied darkly, "But of all the bad things I've dealt with at that job, Rick was not one of them. He was one of the main reasons I stayed at that place for more than a month. I mean Piper and Dakota were great friends, but I couldn't hang out with them while I was working and, well, Rick filled in that void."

Alice then put a tender onto Zack's softened face.

"I get that he means a lot to you. But please, don't let that cloud your judgment. I know you don't want to hear it but he might be playing you."

"I"ll be fine." He assured her, "Besides, even if he did want to rob something, I don't think even he'd do something like rob the very store we're eating at."

///

"See this place we're in right now?" Rooker whispered as he sat down at a booth, "I'm planning on hitting it next weekend."

Rooker didn't even wait for Zack to sit down in his fucking seat and he was already talking about pulling a score. Zack gave him a nice plain stare before taking his hand off the booth chair and immediately heading for the exit. Just before he opened the doors, Rooker grabbed his shoulder, only for Zack to violently turn to face him, feeling tempted to push him to the ground. Rooker took a little step backwards, straightening his red suit a little.

"No." Zack replied calmly, "Not interested."

"You haven't ev-"

"No."

"No one's going to get-"

"No, no, no, no, no, SHUT UP!" Zack yelled, causing almost everyone to look.

Zack blushed heavily before glaring back.

"I really thought you just wanted to have a chat." Zack said, mentally kicking himself in the head for being so naive.

"I do! It's called a conversation!" Rooker explained.

"No, this is called a recruitment." Zack hissed quitely, "You lost one of your crew and now you're looking for a replacement at the last minute."

"Actually uh," Rooker replied sheepishly, "I don't have a full crew ye-"

"What? You don't have a full crew for a job you plan on pulling next week..." Zack said before audibly gasping like a fish out of water, "Well now I definitely want nothing to do with this!"

Rooker then grabbed Zack's shoulder again and almost slammed him against one of the walls.

"Ten minutes. All I'm asking for is ten minutes of your time." Rooker panted before glancing towards the buffet line, "Besides, they got some killer food here."

Zack gently shoved Rooker off before contemplating. What he was offering was nothing short of trouble. Trouble with a prize that he no longer needed at this point. But then again, Rooker was more fair than people gave him credit for. If you didn't want in on something shady, he'd pretty much leave you alone for a while. Granted, as soon as he had another scheme cooked up he'd pester you again, but then, you only had to firmly reject him in order to get him off your back.

"...Alright, you got ten minutes." Zack said before walking back to the booth.

As he sat down, Zack finally started taking note of his surroundings. It was a rather nice looking establishment called "Pepper's Pizza", sort of a family get together type of all you can eat buffet. From what he could see, they certainly had a lot of variety when it came to the Pizza department. The place also had a good selection of drinks, granted they were all Coke products but hey, that meant they had Mellow Yellow in the mix and that was always a plus.

Zack then looked at the booth he was in and observed that there was already quite a number of finished plates on the table. Not that there was any left over crust or anything, oh no, but there was a lot of sauce stains that indicated there was once food on them. Just then Rooker came back with two plates. Both with only a slice of Cheese Pizza.

"Ok, here's the setup." Rooker began once he chomped a bit off his slice, "Every Saturday, rich man John Jacobi comes here with his literal large family for a weekly get together. And I mean big ass large family! Mostly made of females, with a few men in there as well. They all gorge themselves, mom tries to make the daughters act more like her, the little kids go off to play in the arcade over there, the older kids stay behind and inhale cheese bread, and the Jacobi parents passionately embrace each other like it's a lifetime romance of the week. Essentially, what a modern family does."

"Except for the lifetime movie part." Zack quipped.

"Well yeah but, anyway, here's where it gets interesting. Jacobi's oldest daughter Melanie recently got hospitalized and no, it wasn't due to a heart attack. She was apparently driving from her home to her parent's mansion before accidentally swerving into a tree. She's not dead, but the whole thing's still fresh in Jacobi's mind like an open wound. He's the kind of person who sort of becomes soft when reminded of past tragedies. Meaning he probably wouldn't resist if say, a robber were to threaten to put lead into a hostage's stomach if he doesn't give away his money right then and there."

Zack then glared.

"No one'll get hurt huh?"

Just then, a twinkle was in Rooker's eyes as his mouth formed into a grin.

"That's right. Not a single person will get hurt."

Just then, Zack saw a woman approaching their table. A woman of the...expansive kind. Hell even that was somewhat too soft a term to describe just how large she was. She was definitely reaching 400 lbs. It was a shock to absolutely no one that she came over here with two full plates of pizza, pasta, and cheese bread, though interestingly she also a cup of ranch dressing as well. Once the plates were down, the massive gal squeezed right in next to Rooker who was probably regretting the fact that he entered the booth first. And then, it finally in Zack's mind. No one'll get hurt...

"You must be Rooker's 'hostage'." Zack said, stretching out his hand.

The woman gave a devilish grin as she shook his hand with a pretty strong grip. Once the handshake was done with, Zack had to flex his hand a little just to see if it was ok.

"Meet Martha, Zack." Rooker said, "She's an old friend of mine and she's the one who alerted me of Jacobi's family tradition. She also happens to bear just the slightest resemblance to Jacobi's recently hospitalized daughter but that must be a coincidence."

"Hard to imagine I know but I eat here very often." Martha snarked, "One day Rooker came to me, trying to find quick money to make and I suddenly remembered that there was a loaded family man who'd never put his money before his children."

"So," Zack said, "We just walk in disguised and 'kidnap' Martha over here, then we guilt Jacobi and possibly his whole family into loading our pockets?"

"Well, not exactly." Rooker admitted, "I mean, we wouldn't want to miss out on all the other wallets in this fine establishment now and we certainly wouldn't dare ignore the cash register that'll no doubt extremely loaded that night, would we?"

"How many more guys are you gonna get, assuming I join that is?"

"Two more." Rooker said, "That'll be enough to have this place under control."

Zack looked down at his now empty plate before being nudged by Rooker.

"I'm telling you Zack." Rooker said reassuringly, "The only pain that'll be delivered here is a few bruises that'll easily heal. Not to mention how much you'll make off of this."

Zack just quietly stared as his plate in thought. He promised Alice he wouldn't get into this. Zack then finally looked up at Rooker. He made his choice.
1121.title: Rooker AKA: Discount Danny Ocean

choices: A week later, Zack is visited by Rooker and an injured Martha.
A week later, Zack is visited by some shady men looking for Rooker.
11212.content:
At first, Rooker had a look of excitement plastered over his face. But that excitement was quickly crushed to bits when he looked Zack in the eyes. With a face like his, Zack didn't have to say a thing.

"I think I know what your answer is." He said, nibbling on his pizza.

"Look, Alice means a lot to me, more than any other person I've dated." Zack said, "I told her I wouldn't get roped into your shit. I haven't gone back on my word up to this point, and I don't intend on making this the first."

"You'll get money." Martha reminded Zack in a singsong voice, though the effect was somewhat lessened by the fact that her mouth was still full.

"I already have money." Zack said proudly, "I don't have a lot of it, but I have enough to live comfortably. I certainly don't need to steal it from others."

Rooker picked at his slice for a while, carefully avoiding Zack's eyes. He was so sure he had Zack hooked.

"Well," He finally said, "At the very least, you got a decent slice of pizza out of this, right?"

Upon finishing the cheese pizza, Zack couldn't help but agree.

"S'pretty good." He admitted.

"You should try the super meat pizza." Martha said, adding that with a downright lustful "Mhhm".

"I bet. Well, I better get going." Zack said, "I don't want Alice to worry about me."

"Of course." Rooker said, "And uh, you'll keep this between us, right?"

"Absolutely. I hope you do well, Rooker." He said, exiting the booth, "Hell, maybe we can meet up again sometime...Without you trying to recruit me into anything."

Rooker laughed but it was obviously forced. Even Martha looked concerned for him at this point. Zack gave Rooker a final glance before saying:

"See ya later Rooker."

And with that, Zack had left the restaurant, triumphant as hell. He had faced temptation upfront and never even thought of yielding. And people said he had no self control. Walking to the parking lot, Zack couldn't have made a bigger grin than the one he wore right then.

///

"So...How was it?" Alice asked hesitantly.

While Zack was gone, Alice did nothing but worry. She worried about Rooker trying to weasel Zack into a scheme, she worried about Zack saying yes, worst of all she worried about him declining and Rooker not taking no for an answer. Thankfully, Zack entering their home meant the third possibility was out (...Well, it made it less likely at least).

"You were right." Zack said solemnly, "He wanted me to rob a joint."

Alice stared into the distance. Of course he did, she thought.

"What did you say?"

"I turned him down flat." Zack said, giving her a big grin.

Alice glared at him for a while, trying to look for any clues that he lied. When she couldn't find any, she smiled as well before giving Zack a great big hug.

"I'm proud of you, hon." Alice said.

"You fucking should be." Zack snarked, before getting a pillow to the face.
11212.title: Keeping your word.

choices: Ah, the XBox—has a reunion between man and machine ever been so sweet?
Why move?—there was a pretty interesting interview coming on the news anyway...
So hungry—maybe there's a good delivery place nearby...?
115.content:
Ah, clean jammies—has the concept of the lazy day ever been so perfectly symbolized by anything else?

Since this whole move started, Zack had been running himself ragged trying to get everything ready. Packing everything up, securing the apartment, having to deal with their respectively overbearing mothers voicing their constant disapproval of the idea, sometimes it all got to be a little much!

And sure he and Alice had been having fun these past few weeks, just sort of settling in and getting to know the city together. While that was all well and good, he had been looking forward to this day for what seemed like a really long time by now. Alice would be out all day, and he wouldn't be starting at the hotel for another few nights. That meant he had all day to do whatever he wanted—and all an overworked guy like Zack wanted was a day to lay around the apartment like a lazy bum!

"Alright sweetie, I'm heading out." Alice leaned over the couch and gave Zack a quick peck on the lips, "You're sure you don't want to come with me?"

"Yeah babe, I'll be alright." Zack put up a tough front, smiling boyishly as his girlfriend straightened up

"Okay... if you need me, you know you can—”

“Text you. Got it.” Zack pulled out his phone for emphasis, “Al, baby, I’ll be fine.”

“Okay but—"

"I'll be alright, Al." Zack said with a little laugh, "Trust me, I'm a big boy. I can feed and take care of myself."

"Mostly."

"Mostly."

"I don't know, it just... it'll be so weird being apart." Alice said sentimentally, "I mean, we've spent the past few weeks together every minute and it's been so great."

And it had been! Don't misunderstand, Zack was more than happy to spend every minute he could with Alice! But when given the option, it was important that he get some time to... y'know, be himself. By himself!

"I know." Zack sat up and gave his girlfriend a longer, more intimate kiss, "But I'll be alright."

The two lovebirds gave their final, wet, open-mouthed goodbyes for another minute or so before Alice checked the time. Smiling awkwardly, she shuffled out the door. And while he wasn't particularly proud to admit it, Zack eagerly shut the door behind her.

Finally—a chance to be free!

***


"I'm Cass Morgan, and this is your Morning News."

Okay, so... maybe he'd forgotten how to be free.

It had been so long since Zack actually had some time alone that he'd... well, forgotten, exactly, how to be alone.

Which was funny because, as the youngest in a family of five in a crowded apartment, he'd always wished that he could be alone for just one second. And then, when he started dating Alice, she moved in not long after. And with his work and his friends, Zack had slowly just let it pile up! And now that he was alone, all by himself...

What exactly did people who didn't have a full-time job and a girlfriend do?

There was always XBox—he had fought so hard to keep that damn thing, and it was one of the first things he'd plugged up to the TV.

Maybe his friends were on? It was pretty early, and most of them were bums. He could go for a round of Call of Duty.

Of course, he was pretty hungry. Maybe he could grab a bite?

Then again, both of those involved moving. And on a lazy day, moving was pretty much the last thing he wanted to do.

There was always TV. He missed TV.
115.title: Zack's Bumming It Today!

promises low calorie, high quality taste with a family recipe put to good use!"
might just have us all reevaluating what we think of when we say BIG!"
1152.content:
Okay, so maybe watching the news wasn't the best way for Zack to unwind.

He had honestly pictured something a little different. He wasn't quite sure what, but the news wasn't exactly on his queue.

But it was better than nothing, and honestly, as long as he could kick his feet up on the coffeetable and let himself unwind, there wasn't much that he could complain about. Alice wouldn't be home for hours; he might as well enjoy his alone time as much as possible. Why rush into things? He could always play video games later. And he supposed that the delivery place would still exist in an hour or two, when his gut really started to grumble.

Why not watch a little TV, right?

It was some local station, not like CNN or anything.

Channel 14 News with Cass Morgan and Miguel Hernandez, bringing the News... to you.

What a riot, right? How was the news still a thing?

But he supposed that the hardbody anchorwoman wasn't too hard to look at. She was pretty hot, with long brown hair and a big rack. Zack supposed, idly, that she looked a little taller than his usual taste in women. But still, she was pretty hot.

Was it weird for him to still be having those thoughts?

Should he... not think she was hot just because he was in a relationship? (How could he not?!)

Zack's distracted mind was brought back on track as the commercials finally ended, bringing the oh-so-delicious Cass Morgan back onto the screen. She was hot—definitely enough for Zack to stop wondering whether or not it was okay for him to be thinking about this so hard. The way she looked at the camera, cocked her eyebrow, and smiled... suffice it to say, it got more than Zack's attention.

"Welcome back. I'm Cass Morgan with the news at eleven." she said as the camera shifted, "You know a lot of us, especially us ladies, have a tendency to worry about our weights..."

Zack had a hard time believing that Miss Cass Morgan worried about anything.

"And, you know, they say that the camera adds ten pounds so... forgive me if I get a little nervous with all these cameras around me." she laughed, "But recently, we here at Channel 14 have uncovered something truly remarkable; I was put on a story that covers someone right here in the upstate who..."
1152.title: So the News is still a Thing, right?
