12.content:
As Alice washed her face, she gave the mirror a little kiss.

She felt pretty... well, pretty today!

Leaning in to give her boyfriend a little peck on the cheek, Alice left him to his own devices as she exited the bathroom.

She didn't want to jinx it, but things had been going great for her so far! She was due to start her fashion design courses at Abercrombie U soon. While she wasn't exactly excited about going back to school after such a nice Summer vacation (especially in a new city where she barely knew anybody!) Alice felt the tell-tale flutter of butterflies in her stomach. Two weeks into her new life in a new town, and things were already looking up!

Alice drew the curtains before she unwrapped the towel from her figure. She was a curvy woman, a long overdue advantage to having been a blimp in high school. As she had deflated during her time away from Buttercombe, Alice found that her body had matured into a shapely physique, with round hips and a pert set of C-cup breasts. She wasn't quite as slender as she would have liked to have been, but Zack didn't seem to mind...

Alice put her hands on her hips, taking one last look in the mirror.

Pretty good, Carlyle!

Smiling in satisfaction, Alice whipped around to see her clothes that she had painstakingly laid out in anticipation for the day...
12.title: A Day in the Life of Alice

choices: The pants fit perfectly! Success!
The pants are a little snug. Close enough!
The pants don't fit at all! Uh oh...
121.content:
Alice looked down at the clothes she had laid on the bed; dark blue pinstripe pants, a formal vest that matched said pants, a white dress shirt, a red tie, and loafers. Once upon a time, the ensemble had been the uniform that Zack had worn while he was rising up the ranks in the Hammond Hotel Chain. After several weeks of careful tailoring and refitting, however, they were now Alice's classiest clothes. Making the adjustments to menswear to make them fit her hadn't been easy (though it did help that the uniform had been made for Zack when he'd been fatter than he was now). However, it was effort that Alice thought would be worth it, considering today's interview.

She had already gotten into Abercrombie University, one of the most prestigious universities around. At the head of Abercrombie's Fashion Studies Program was one Professor Sheila Taylor. Professor Taylor was regarded as a perfectionist, someone who would fail any student she didn't feel was putting in the kind of effort that a truly modern designer needed. But those students who managed to pass her courses tended to have a leg up in the cutthroat fashion industry. Many dresses and suits that the rich and famous wore to award ceremonies, parties, and other events had been designed by students of Professor Taylor. That wasn't even mentioning that Sheila Taylor's clothing had been worn by two different first ladies and the Prime Minister of another country!

Hence, these days one had to interview Professor Taylor before she would admit a potential student into her classes. Alice hoped that showing off some clothing that she had already worked on would earn her some respect in the Professor's eyes. Not a lot, maybe, but enough to make it into the class. And that was something that Alice desperately wanted. Thinking about it now was already starting to cause her anxiety to flare up again, though she did her best to quash the nervous thoughts. She'd been working on these clothes for three weeks now! She'd taken accurate measurements of herself, she'd been precise in the alterations she had made, she had done everything perfectly!

Her anxiety wasn't entirely gone, though. Sure, she could tell herself that she was an expert tailor, but there was only one way to know for sure. Taking a few minutes to build up her courage, she donned her underwear and then picked up the pants that, until a moment ago, she was sure would fit her. Now, she wasn't so sure. Had she done everything right? Had her measurements really been accurate? Her alterations precise enough? Alice took a deep breath to calm herself and slowly began to put the pants on.
121.title: Alice and the Pants of Destiny

choices: Her interview isn't for another few hours. Now what to do to fill the time...
Her interview is going to start soon. Better get going!
Her interview is supposed to be starting now! She's going to be late!
1211.content:
It probably shouldn't have taken Alice this long to put on a pair of pants, but eventually they were on. She then buttoned them up, finding it hard to believe what had just happened. Not quite believing what had just happened (but desperately hoping that she wasn't dreaming), Alice then put on and buttoned up her dress shirt and vest, tied up her red tie, and slipped on the loafers. Then, she went and stood in front of the full-length mirror she'd had installed in the room (a housewarming gift that had been the collective purchase of several of her friends from her old school).

Everything fit perfectly. The pants hugged her legs without being too tight, her shirt and vest were neither hanging loosely off of her nor were they uncomfortably tight, and she'd even managed to get that double-Windsor knot that Zack had shown her just right. The shocked look on Alice's face gave way to a smile as she began to strike a few poses in front of the mirror. Her outfit fit her perfectly, and she looked damn good in it!

Alice blushed a little as that thought struck her. It wasn't wrong of her to think that, was it? After all, she hadn't quite managed to slim herself down back to her pre-Buttercombe body. A part of her mind said that the butt in the mirror was still too big. A different part said that it looked good. It was okay to think that about herself, right? After a moment, Alice decided that it was the pants that really made it look great. The pants that she'd managed to alter perfectly! There was no way that Professor Taylor could turn her down!

Her ego successfully boosted, Alice turned and looked at the clock sitting on the bedside table.
1211.title: A Perfect Fit

choices: Her interview isn't for another few hours. Enough time to fix the pants, maybe?
Her interview is going to start soon. She'll just have to endure the pain.
Her interview is supposed to start now! As if today wasn't bad enough already!
1212.content:
Everything went well at first. Alice managed to get her pants up her legs no problem. Then she tried to button them. No matter how hard she tugged at the waistband of her pants, they just seemed to refuse to work with her. Finally, she took in a deep breath and sucked in her gut. The button went into the button hole with no problem. As soon as she let her breath out, though, she felt a tightness in her waistline that she hadn't felt since her Buttercombe days. How had this happened? She'd been doing everything right! She'd been regularly exercising and eating healthy! Hadn't she?

She then remembered how she had been spending the last three weeks. She'd been so engrossed in working on the clothes that she'd neglected her regular morning run on some days. A bowl still half-full of candy caught her eye too. But she'd needed that candy! Snacking while tailoring at Buttercombe had been part of her creative process, had led to some of her best work! She'd spent the first week of this project just staring at the clothes, unsure of what to do, until she'd bought some generic chocolates at a store as an impulse purchase. Getting back to the tailoring process that had worked for her in Buttercombe was what had led to her finishing this project. What else had she been supposed to do?

With a sigh, Alice shook her head. It was too late to take back what she'd done in the past. What was done was done. The nervous teenage Alice Carlyle might have spent the rest of the day a nervous sobbing wreck, but she was mature adult Alice Carlyle! She dealt with her problems head on! And so she picked up her dress shirt and vest and tried them on with only a little nervous hesitation. And surprise of surprises, they fit just fine! Which meant that any weight she might have inadvertently gained while working on her project had probably been added to her hips and butt. Figures.

She tied the red tie into a Double-Windsor knot that Zack had shown her the night before, and slipped on the loafers. Alice then looked at herself in the mirror. The young woman who was staring back at her was slightly grimacing due to being stuffed into a pair of pants just a little too small for her. Other than that, she did look presentable. Alice then glanced at a clock sitting on the bedside table.
1212.title: An Almost-Perfect Fit

choices: Her interview isn't for another few hours. Enough time to buy something fancy.
Her interview is going to start soon. She'll have to settle for casual clothes.
Her interview is supposed to start now! Worst. Day. Ever.
1213.content:
Alice tried. She truly did. But the pants seemed to stop midway up her thighs and wouldn't go any higher no matter how much she shimmied, tugged, and pulled at them. What had happened? How did everything go so wrong? Had she taken the wrong measurements? Used the wrong materials? Gained some weight? She had snacked an awful lot while tailoring the clothes during the past few weeks, weeks that she now saw had been completely wasted. Why had she chosen so difficult a task? Why had she devoted so much time to a failed endeavor that she'd neglected the exercise and diet that she'd been on?

Hot tears ran down Alice's face. This just wasn't fair! She'd put everything she had into making this outfit work! All that effort for nothing! She dropped the pants to the ground, and flopped onto the bed, ignoring the fact that she'd be wrinkling the rest of the outfit. What did it matter? They probably didn't fit too! Alice spent the next few minutes just lying on the bed, feeling sorry for herself.

With great effort, she wrenched her mind out of the mental freefall she had found herself in. So the suit that she had been tailoring was a bust. Yes, it was a shame, but she couldn't just lie down here and give up! That's what the old Alice, the nervous wreck she'd been before going to Buttercombe would have done. Sure, the boarding school had done a number on her waistline, but she'd also met a lot of friends there who had helped teach her how to become a stronger and better person. If she wanted to continue to be the kind of woman that they'd helped shape her into, she was going to have to move on!

There were still some perfectly good clothes in her wardrobe, after all, that she knew would fit her. None of them were as classy as the vest-and-dress pants combination that she'd been planning on wearing, but she'd still look professional-ish enough if she picked the right top and bottom. And if she had enough time, she might even be able to swing by a store on the way to the interview and snag some formal wear (if it was in her price range, that is).

Alice tilted her head and looked at the clock sitting on the bedside table.
1213.title: A Catastrophic Fit

choices: Samantha Wisely, her punk best friend
Arisa Spencer, the biggest girl she knew at school, and total genius
Someone else
122.content:
Alice looked down at her clothes; pant-suit? Way to formal, gotta go; this was just a simple meet-up with an old friend that was all.

Slipping the skirt over her hips Alice reminisced about her days back at Buttercombe and all the people she had met there; some for the best, others for the worst, like any traditional high-school upbringing really.

Buttoning up her top Alice then thought back to her friends; Samantha her punk bestie, Mel her “big sister” as long as Alice’s real big sister was not around, Ronnie the R.A. with a heart of gold and a whiz in the kitchen, Arisa the genius she had got to know well in her second year; good times.

Well if they were meeting her at a simple coffee shop in town, perhaps they lived in Abercrombie? She might be able to keep closer in touch with them.

Alice excited her apartment, locked the door and headed out; the sun was beating down brightly, but not enough to make her uncomfortably hot, and the plants were still in full bloom; not a bad day for a meet-up.

As Alice began her walk to the boulevard though, she could not help but notice the town’s rather high obese population. It was extraordinary, like she was back at Buttercombe or something. Everywhere she looked there was a boulder-like belly, a hug gelatinous backside or a huge bustline supported by a large potbelly. Alice hoped it wasn’t something to do with the food around here; after all that dieting down from her formally pudgy build it would be awful to slide back simply because she was going to a college in a town with a high chance of its occupants getting fat.

Arriving at the small coffee shop, Alice took a moment to look around; no sign of her old friend, the blonde woman must have been early. Deciding not to look like she was simply loitering about Alice went inside and decided to order a simple drink while she waited.

“Hi!” came the cheery greeting from the barrister behind the counter, waving an arm joyously as Alice approached.

“Oh! Hi” Alice replied with a bit of a jump, not expecting such an overenthusiastic server. The barrister looked like she really shouldn’t have been behind the counter; she was practically squeezed into it! She had long thin braided hair rolling over one shoulder, a round face with a sweet smile, big fluffy cheeks and a massive belly that was so large that the topmost roll was actually sitting on the counter while the woman’s backside jutted out so far back it HAD to be touching the back of the serving station.

“I’m Clara, your barrister today. What can I get you?” the woman cheerily asked, taking up a pen and notepad while snapping Alice out of her daze.

“Just a coffee” Alice replied, trying not to look too startled.

“Would you like a small, a medium or a large?” Clara asked, bouncing almost at the word large; as if making a cheeky joke about her own girth.

“Just a sm...actually a medium” Alice changed her mind, she shouldn’t get a large that was for sure, but a medium wouldn’t hurt.

“Awsome! One medium coming up!” the dark skinned barrister squeaked as she tried to manoeuvre her way over to the dispensers a little further down. This took several attempts, mostly as her belly and butt seemed to have jammed her in place and it took several grunts and squishy wiggles to unstick herself. Pouring the coffee with a seemingly well practiced hand, Clara handed the piping hot drink to Alice who presented the overfed woman with the payment. “Sorry about the delay, I swear they moved the counter recently, I keep getting stuck” Clara tried to hand-wave with a smile, the free hand trying to slosh her belly back into place as she resumed her previous position behind the front of the counter.

Alice raised an eyebrow, firstly at the clueless barrister, who did not seem to know just how big she was, and secondly at her drink; she did order a medium, it said on the cup, but it really looked like a large. God was this what a medium gets you around here? Alice mentally jotted down to make sure she always got smalls of everything in this town.

Returning to the outside chairs, Alice settled herself down and began to sip her coffee; it may have been way too much for her to finish, but it sure tasted good. As Alice began to lose herself in her drink and absentmindedly scanning her surroundings a voice snapped her back to the original reason she came all the way out to the coffee shop anyway.

“Hey! Alice!”

Looking up, Alice saw...
122.title: Catching up with an old friend

choices: Alcie and Arisa chat, but Arisa's eating has Alice forget about her own
The bubbly barrister leaves early, but Arisa invites her over to chat
Arisa is adamant Alice comes over right after coffee
1222.content:
Arisa Spencer and Alice had been in the same year, but neither had talked to each other until their second year. Back then Alice was chubbing up pretty fast and her mother as always on her case about it (worrying both her daughters were becoming obese blobs); it was during that time that Arisa had to be put on a special service due to her own vast weight and could no longer perform Physical Education classes and was reduced to note-taker. This had brought them into conflict as Alice could not bear her mother haggling her anymore and wanted Arisa to fudge her weight on the notes; but Arisa was far too much of a goody-goody and couldn’t morally agree to do it.

This had led to Alice and a second girl, Molly Harrington, to attempt to distract Arisa with food, hoping her note-taking skill would deteriorate and both girls would get off scot free. Alice however eventually caved and told Arisa the whole thing, which she took surprisingly well and the pair remained firm but odd friends ever since.

The pair were actually quite similar. Both wanted to ace all their grades, were about the same height and had been originally quite poor at socializing; so they got along like two peas in a pod.

As Alice saw though as her old friend approached, while Alice had managed to drop her high-school pounds, Arisa had done anything but that.

Arisa had arrived to Buttercombe academy already weighing in at a very hefty 280 pounds, so she certainly had a leg up on other girls as everyone began to put on weight at the pampering academy. So when girls in Arisa and Alice’s year were approaching Arisa’s entry level weight, the big dark-haired girl was miles ahead of them, leading the pack in how to be very very fat.

Arisa was actually rolling up to Alice on a mobility scooter, something she very evidently needed. The massive woman was dressed in a flowing skirt and an obviously tailor-made but very stylish pink top that exposed one shoulder. Her legs were spread wide not only because of the machine she was riding, but because her obstructively large belly was drooping between them, forcing her bronze-colored legs apart. Speaking of which, Arisa legs were huge, each thigh looked like a massive bronze barrel attached to a slightly smaller one below it. Even Arisa’s feet were incredibly fat; easily visible in sandals due to the warm weather, her plump digits looked swollen her toes barely wriggling they had fattened up so much. High above Arisa’s breasts sat ontop of her belly like a pair of mountains rising from a planet, kept perky by what must have been an industrial strength bra. Arisa arms, fully exposed by her cool top, looked like they were being engulfed; her upper arm-fat slowly swallowing her lower arm. Her sausage-like fingers wrapped diligently around the handlebars of her scooter. Lastly was Arisa’s face; she had always had a very fat face, but now it was almost a parody of one. Arisa’s cheeks dominated her visage so much that her lips looked a bit puckered; while her chin had a pair of friends, each trying to edge further down her chest.

“It’s so great to see you! Come over her and give us a hug!” Arisa beamed, her voice, despite the many engulfing layers of lard, still squeaky and high-pitched. Getting up and giving her gigantic friend an extremely squishy hug, Alice was quite taken aback; she probably shouldn’t have been, Arisa was so very large last time they saw each other during graduation that this really was the only logical step, she couldn’t have suddenly dropped 500 pounds in just a few months after all.

“*Mmmph*It’s great to see you again, how have you been?” Alice asked, trying to ignore the almost literal elephant in the room.

“Great! I am actually studying business further; mom said I need just a few more qualifications before I become her understudy and then eventually take over Boonliang Corp” Arisa demonstrated this by making a demonstration of small between her fat thumb and forefinger.

“Oh wow! Sounds like you are moving up in the world” Alice congratulated, “where are you studying?”

“Right here!” Arisa beamed, throwing (as best she could) her arms up, “Surprise!”

“Oh my god, are you serious!” Alice cheered back rhetorically.

“Totally, I got an apartment close to the college and everything, in fact I managed to stay with another Buttercombe girl, remember Marissa?” Arisa seemed absolutely ecstatic, although, most things did that to her. Marissa though, Alice did not know her personally, but had known her twin sister Anna.

“Uh, Marissa Dupont? I knew her sister...” Alice explained, hoping to not put a damper on Arisa’s story by not knowing one of the massive Thai woman’s friends.

“Ok, well she is like Anna but more party and less study” Arisa laughed before continuing, “we both got an apartment together; she is already settling in really well, hell she is already dating a local football player”. Alice was not surprised by this, from what she had heard of Marissa, she was a stereotypical blonde party-girl slash cheerleader type, so dating a big hunky football player seemed par for the course. “She is so cute though, it’s adorable seeing them together...” Arisa continued as Alice almost choked on her coffee, she?

“Wait, Marissa was...?” Alice began.

“I know right? Well, I didn’t know until I caught them making out on my coffee table” Arisa laughed, “anyway her name is Kennedy, she is like She-Hulk’s less green sister but girlier than you can imagine; she is so adorable, took me clothes shopping even, not that they make anything in my size on the high street but bless her for trying” Arisa emphasized this by patting the monstrous sea of fat in front of her.

“Uh....huh” Alice confirmed as the obese barrister suddenly appeared, seemingly out of nowhere.

“Hi! Can I get you anything?” she asked, her smile beaming out of her face like a ray of light.

“Can I get fifteen muffins Clara? Five blueberry, five chocolate and five raspberry?” Arisa asked, holing out her credit card and scanning it to pay for her treats. “I just need a snack for the road” Arisa joked to the bubbly barrister.

“Haha, oh how I wish I could snack like that” Clara replied with a giggle before turning her massive butt around to head back inside, “B-r-b guys!”

“See, I am already getting to know people around here! I am settling; this is so exciting!” Arisa squealed, wiggling her dark-brown arms around. “You totally should come around ours so time for a house-warming; are you rooming alone?”

“No I am living with Zack, my...boyfriend” Alice sheepishly explained as Arisa put her hands to her mouth.

“Boyfriend! You gotta tell me everything! What does he do? Where did you meet? Is he cute? Does he have a brother?” Arisa shot all this out very quickly leaving Alice laughing.

“Haha! This is just like old times, I missed this” Alice remarked with a smile.

“I know me to; now, I have been rambling on about myself for ages, you spill everything.now.” Arisa stated, pointing a flabby finger down at the table, hoping to hear everything that had gone on with her friend since they graduated.
1222.title: Reunited with a massive friend

choices: "We ARE offering a free month of personal training for new members. Interested?"
"You might want to steer clear of the blonde woman over there. She's intense."
"Yeah, here's a coupon for a free smoothie from our smoothie bar. Enjoy!"
124.content:
So Alice had never exactly been the "active" type.

That wasn't to say that Alice was exactly "lazy", she just wasn't really the type to go out to the gym. When she lived in Daven's Port, she had made it a habit to go for jogs around the neighborhood in the mornings in addition to being much more careful about what she ate. She had come a long way from the big-bellied blimp that she had felt like (and in all honesty, had been) in high school, but she couldn't help but feel a little antsy about her weight.

Moving with Zack had been wonderful, and even the less than stellar parts had been at least fun. But living in the Hammond for a few weeks while things settled out with their apartment hadn't exactly lent her any favors. She had felt herself slipping back into that Buttercombe mentality—lay back, enjoy yourself, who cares if that food's a little fatty?

Well she wasn't having it. That was the old Alice. The one that she had left back at Buttercombe.

Even still, she hadn't exactly done herself any favors. While Zack promised it wasn't noticeable, she'd put on about ten pounds since this whole moving business started. The luxurious food that the Hammond had to offer, combined with Zack's lucrative employee discount had made provided quite the temptation; to say nothing of the full spa on the pool floor...

Anyway, it was time to make a change. Start developing some healthy habits. Again. Re-developing healthy habits. Again.

What better place to (re-)develop those habits than the gym?

Fit Life was a nice enough place, after all. It was only one of, like, three gyms in town and the other two were on the east side, closer to downtown where Zack worked. Their website said that they tried to cater to a friendly atmosphere, and Alice figured that gymtimidation was the last thing someone trying to keep her figure needed. It was relatively close, close to campus, and seemed pretty approachable, so why not give it a shot?

Dressed in her tank top, one loose enough to more or less hide her prominent bust and long enough to dangle behind her heart-shaped hips, Alice put on her trainers and made the drive over. It was a smaller place than she expected, taking up two spots in what Alice assumed was a strip mall. It was nestled next to a nail salon and a frozen yogurt shop.

"Hey, welcome to Fit Life!" came the sweet slight drawl of the receptionist behind the counter, "Do you have your membership card with you?"

"I, uh..."

Alice shrunk into herself habitually, twiddling her fingers over her gym bag. She steeled herself. New Alice, remember?

"I don't, actually. My boyfriend and I just moved here, and..."

"Oh well that's no problem!"

The receptionist, her name tag said Marianne, held up her hands in a vague sense of welcoming excitement. She was a bit taller than Alice, and had her long dark hair up in a cute little 'do. Marianne had prominent features, maybe she was Italian? But judging by her perfect nails, her plush figure and wide hips, Alice didn't exactly see her as the "active" type. Not that she had much room to talk, mind you...

"We'll get you all set up with our free 30-day trial period. After that it's ten dollars a month for our basic package."

Ten dollars a month for a gym membership? That didn't sound too bad. Not that Alice was exactly the expert on how much she should be paying to come to a place and use their equipment. But ten dollars—that wasn't bad at all. She might even be able to convince Zack to let her use his debit card...

"That doesn't sound too bad." Alice smiled, feeling at ease, "Just ten dollars a month?"

"Just ten dollars a month." Marianne affirmed with a smile as she slid Alice some paperwork, "We try not to be too... I guess you'd call it clingy? Don't want to scare anyone off, y'know!"

Alice laughed, albeit somewhat weakly (as she was quite scare-offable!) and signed her life away. The contract wasn't anything too intense, and there was no commitment. If Alice canceled, she'd have to pay for the next month, but there were no other cancellation fees. A low pressure environment was just what someone like Alice needed, especially since these little trips to the gym would be coming between (what she expected to be) very stressful courses at ASU.

"Alright, well you're all set up!" Marianne said with a smile as she slid the paperwork back behind the counter, "The ladies' locker room is down that hall, to the left. The weight room is to the right of this room, and any of the machines are up for personal use."

"Thanks." Alice offered a smile as she grabbed her gym bag off the ground, "Is there anything else I should know?"

"Well..." Marianne bit her bottom lip as she rifled through stray flyers and sheets of paper on her end of the desk...
124.title: Alice Carlyle—Gym Rat!

choices: To the Internet—there were worse ways to spend a morning than on Youtube!
Turn the channel—the Marni Blake show was coming on; Alice's secret vice!
Have a snack—breakfast was the most important meal of the day, right?
125.content:
If she was being honest—completely honest with herself...

Alice had been looking forward to this day for quite a while.

Ever since they had agreed to move halfway across the country, Alice had slowly become more than a little exhausted. All the packing, the unpacking, hauling everything in a uhaul, spending hours crammed in a tiny vehicle; that didn't even begin to describe all their running around once they got here. No matter how much she moved around in her young life, Alice would still never get over how exhausting it all was!

It had been a lot of fun spending so much time with Zack, but she was more than a little grateful that she would be having this day for herself!

"Hey babe, I'm heading out." Zack said as he grabbed his keys, leaning over to give Alice a quick smooch, "You gonna be alright while I'm gone?"

Alice, in her too-big t-shirt and floppy pajama bottoms, her long blonde hair pulled back and her little feet bare, looked pretty much the picture of comfort. She stood with her hands behind her back, seeing Zack off at the door.

"Ooooh..." Alice said with an innocent rocking on the balls of her feet, a small spreading across her face, "I think I'll manage."

"Well don't manage too well without me." Zack said with a little hug, "We moved across the country together—the last thing I want is for you to realize you're perfectly capable of taking care of yourself."

"I promise to perform at or near expectations." Alice said with a giggle, "But not exceed them."

"Aww, just to make me feel better?"

"Just to make you feel better."

The two lovebirds shared a more intimate kiss than before, with Alice wrapping her arms around Zack's waist. As they stood there in the door, Zack allowed it to close slightly before they parted, a smile on his face.

"It's gonna be weird being apart for the first time in..." his blue eyes looked to the side, "God, feels like forever."

"It will..." Alice answered, her smile more girlish. He wasn't usually this clingy! It was kinda cute! "But you're gonna be late for work, sweetie."

"Yeah yeah." he checked his phone, "Have fun while I'm gone, babe."

Alice waited until the door was shut. She counted the footsteps with a growing excitement, waiting until Zack was just out of earshot to practically launch herself onto the couch! She landed with such force that she bounced on the springs, her feet kicked up as she lay splayed out on the couch—

Finally, a little She-time!

***


"Uuuugh...."

Alice lulled her head back on the couch. She-time was hard.

What exactly was there to do that she couldn't do from the comfort of her own bed? She didn't want to do school stuff, even if she kinda needed to. Alice had spent alternating hours cooped up in moving trucks or crammed in a tiny hotel room for the past few weeks. Now that she and Zack finally had her own place, and this would be one of her last chances to get in some time as a lazy millenial before school started, it was important... no, it was damn near necessary for her to find something that she would enjoy doing!

But what?

Zack had his XBox plugged up and running. But Alice wasn't really one of those... gamer girls. Video games were confusing. And besides, Zack might get mad if she accidentally messed something up...

There was always the internet. That was a sure-fire way to waste the day away, even if it didn't sound particularly productive.

Alice had the TV on, but it was just on the news. Maybe she could find something that she wanted to watch?

Ooh, maybe breakfast? It was a little late, but surely somewhere had some food to snack on...?

What to do, what to do...?
125.title: Alice the Homebody

choices: Phillip and Tammy Sizemore, who more than live up to the name!"
Dr. Huan, inventor of something pretty useful if you're about MY size..."
well, "bring out"—the fattest man alive, live from right here in Abercrombie!"
1252.content:
Wait, what was the time?

10:59?

Alice was about to miss her show!

After searching madly and blindly around their couch for the remote, Alice finally felt the familiar shape between the couch cushions—only a few days in their new apartment, and the remote already got lost! And at the worst possible time too; Alice had already missed the opening score of her favorite daytime talk show...

"Hi everyone, I'm Marni Blake and thiiiiis—"

"IS THE MARNI BLAKE SHOW!" the crowd roared

Okay, so sue her.

The prissy little white girl who went to a ritzy all-girl's academy and wanted to grow up to do fashion liked to watch the Marni Blake Show. There were worse things in life, y'know.

Nobody, repeat: nobody knew about her secret daytime tv indulgence. Nobody except her sister (who got her hooked on it in the first place!) Zack's brother Darren (a fellow fan and Marni Maniac) and her mother (a more reluctant fan there never had been). She had never had the guts to admit to Zack that she liked to watch the Marni Blake Show, for fear of judgment. They were a couple, yeah, and they'd been together for a long time now...

But how could she ever admit to him that she liked to watch one of the trashiest, dumbest, who's-the-baby-daddy show out there?

It had been so long since she'd seen it, it was a more welcome experience than most to see her hostess on stage, plopped and wedged tightly into her signature seat. Marni Blake was a fat little woman, with a head of curly brown hair and more chins than inches. She was so big, and so short, that Alice often wondered how it was possible for a woman so round to waddle across stage like she did. Back when Alice was going through her unmentionable chubby phase it did her a lot of good to see Marni constantly staying so upbeat about her size—even now that she was still mostly skinny, Alice appreciated Marni's confidence in her unique figure.

"Alright everyone, we've got a big big BIG show tonight—" Marni held up her hands and spread her chubby fingers out as her eyes went wide, "We've got Tyrone, who doesn't believe that he's the father of Rebecca's baby..."

The crowd booed, with Alice signaling her own disapproval by giving the screen a thumb's-down.

"But first, I promised you guys a BIG show, and intend to deliver!" Marni crinkled her face as the crowd roared, "So without further adieu, ladies and gents, let's bring out my first guest..."
1252.title: Alice the Daytime TV Addict!

choices: Dressed in these weird clothes—introducing Yeng-Huan Suspensor technology!
With a pill in her hand—introducing the Yeng-Huan cure for obesity ailments!
Surrounded by a whole bunch of food—uh, where was this going?
12522.content:
Alice's eyes widened as Marni's guest slowly came into view. They switched to the camera that led off-stage to the dressing rooms, choosing to introduce the day's guest from the backside first.

Alice's eyebrows rose involuntarily at the silhouette that eclipsed the lighting. Marni hadn't been kidding when she said that she had a big show in store for her audience today; if only Alice could have known just how big, she might have braced herself. The woman walking onstage may as well have been two or three guests, all wrapped up into one!

"Ladies and Gentlemen, I'd like you to welcome today's guest," the image flipped to camera one, panned out across the stage, "A woman who needs no introduction; Dr. Brittany Huan!"

As the audience roared with applause, the addressed doctor raised an appreciative hand as she lumbered onto the stage. Her arm was thicker around than most women's calves, packed into a white lab coat so tightly that even Alice could make out the definitive crease where her upper arm folded over her elbow—even the slight polite wave she gave the crowd sent it all shaking. This woman was enormous, probably one of the biggest women that Alice had ever seen in her life!

Dr. Huan walked slowly, her pace hampered greatly by her immense bulk. Her great belly bobbed and swayed as it led the way for her, her fat legs spreading wide as she took slow, awkward steps onto the stage. She turned and smiled to the crowd, her fat face creasing with appreciation of the warm welcome that they had given to one of Marni's girthiest guests.

No doubt in anticipation of her arrival, Marni had a loveseat ready for Dr. Huan. Alice doubted that even the heavy hostess' generous seating arrangements would have contained the double-wide doctor's derriere. Dr. Huan sat next to Marni, filling most of her seat with relative ease. Her huge stomach hung forward, causing her legs spread and fill whatever space on the couch she hadn't already, and spread generously towards the floor.

Dr. Huan gave another wave, her great arms wobbling, as Marni clapped her fat little hands excitedly.

Alice recognized her, vaguely, as the scientist whose face had been making rounds lately throughout social media.

Beyond that, this was the first time Alice could recall actually seeing her. That sure was an awfully positive response for a crowd who, Alice doubted, was very versed in her particular field...

"Welcome, welcome, welcome Dr. Huan!" Marni gushed with a particular enthusiasm, "You have no idea how happy we are to have you here today!"

"The pleasure's all mine!" the fat woman chuckled, her vast body wobbling shortly, "Big fan of the show."

"Oh stop..."

Even though her viewing habits had slipped lately, Alice could still tell that this Dr. Huan woman being on the show was a pretty big deal. Their usual fare of "special guests" were reserved for shock value. Men and women with weird piercings, overly tattooed individuals, and those who had undergone severe body modification. While Dr. Huan's weight was shocking enough to have value, Marni seemed to be playing her completely straight. Whatever Dr. Huan had done to get on the Marni Blake Show, it definitely wasn't because of her weight.

Which was saying something.

"For those of you who don't know, Dr. Huan here is one of the most revolutionary minds of our (your? our? I'm gonna say our!) generation." Marni leaned forward into her vast belly, reaching onto her knee and spreading one chubby white hand along its surface, "Dr. Huan has made national news concerning her most recent breakthroughs, and for some reason she agreed to do my show."

Another appreciative round of applause from the audience.

"Please Marni, call me Brittany—"

"Eee! I can call her Brittany!"

"—And you know, I wasn't kidding when I said I was a big fan. I've been watching for... well, since the beginning I guess." Dr. Huan said with a head motion that caused her vast second chin to bunch against her cheek, "But I'll admit, it wasn't just because I wanted an excuse to meet you."

"Oh?"

"The real reason (well, the other reason) I wanted to come on stage with you today was because I needed the perfect venue to give everyone a first-hand look my research!"

The crowd seemed to purr with approval and interest. Even from her living room, the bumming blonde had gone from laying splayed out on the couch to sitting right at it's edge. She hadn't even heard of this woman until a few seconds ago, and she was already on pins and needles!

"Most of you all," Dr. Huan turned to the crowd, "Have probably seen me on Facebook. Buzzfeed, Youtube... on the internet, any part of the internet, for my controversial theories about body mass. Weight—in the sense of fat."

At this, Dr. Huan took a moment to acknowledge the elephant in the room—meaning, her. Or rather, her distractingly high weight. With two meaty hands, she grabbed the forefront of her vast double-belly by the middle roll and gave it a punctuating, if slight, shake. The vast doughy sea of her belly shook accordingly, even as she let go.

"And you know, it gets pretty old, hearing all the negative remarks that people have to say about what I, and by extension my research team at ASU and the Yeng Company, are claiming." Dr. Huan folded her fat hands on top of her still-jiggling stomach, settling its tempo, "We're all working really hard at proving what we've been researching and... you know, it's all just theories and suppositions that we're pretty sure are true, by this point, but it's really hard to make other people believe us—and what we're claiming—without any evidence."

"Well, you know, I'm a big supporter and I'm more than happy to help in any way I can." Marni added quickly, "You know, besides liking all your posts on Facebook."

The crowd gave a collectively appreciative chuckle.

"You know, I'm so happy you said that? I really am." Dr. Huan said with a smile, "Because I brought a sample! A little... sneak peek, as it were, into what the good people at Yeng are paying us to do."

"Really?"

"And I was hopiiiing... you'd be down for a little science project Marni." Dr. Huan punctuated her point with a dazzling smile, her cheeks dimpling twice over as joy overcame her fat face, "Do you... want to try it out?"

Marni turned towards the crowd, clearly caught off-guard by Dr. Huan's odd request. There was a slight pause before someone in the audience urged her from off-screen, and the rest slowly began to chime in. Before long the entire crowd was chanting 'do it, do it!' Even Alice had to admit, she was really curious to see where this was going...

"Well... alright!" Marni chuckled nervously, "What do i have to do?"

Dr. Huan and the audience were delighted—the excitement was palpable!

And then it cut to a commercial break; Alice would have to wait a whole two to five minute before she finally got to see what was so interesting about this Dr. Huan woman! Well, before she got to see whatever cool experiment she was going to have Marni help her with. Alice didn't have much of a head for science. Even if she googled Dr. Huan, she probably wouldn't have followed the summary of her work, let alone the finer details.

But what did she say that she specialized in? The study of... body mass?

Just as Alice worked up the energy to whip out her phone, the commercial break ended. Tossing her phone back onto the couch (even ignoring a text from Zack!) Alice reglued her eyes to the screen. As soon as the opening cinematic ended, the camera was focused back on stage.

There was Dr. Huan, and then there was Marni...
12522.title: Paging Dr. Huan, Doctor Brittany Huan

choices: That hideous attire! If only Alice lend her fashion to Yeng-Huan's R&D Team!
The prospect of floating like a butterfly! Alice wants to try that suit herself!
125221.content:
...wearing the most curious contraption. It took a few moments to even process that what Marni had adorned over the commercial break was some kind of jumpsuit. Quickly, Alice's clothing keen eyes noticed the main material was some sort of polyester that hug close to the show host's large standing frame. A bit too closely for the young fashionista's tastes. In fact, the more Alice observed the cut of the outfit the more she found wrong with it! The neck line ran high enough to emphasize's Marni's bulging double chin, and the full length legs and sleeves were bunched up at the ankles and wrists as if tailored for someone quite a few inches taller.

The studio audience was certainly captivated, but the relatively quiet reaction betrayed that they were awaiting further explanation.

"Welcome back folks! Normally I'd have some sort of smooth segue for you, but I'm just as lost as my fans here. Dr Hu... Britney, care to give us all some details as to my attire?"

"Well Marni, I'll let the dress speak for itself for just a moment longer... let the suspense build up. Mind giving us a full tour of what you've donned for us today?" The still seat bound doctor signaled the host to give the crowd a quick spin. Despite Marni's confusion and curiosity, she kept her professionalism and quickly obeyed Britney's request.

Despite being a good deal smaller than her giant guest, Marni's slow rotation was not just showmanship. It took some time and effort for her to complete a full 360 degree spin. The camera crew took advantage of this to show a close up of several angles to both the television broadcast and the large display monitors to either side of the stage. Still confused coos of excited starting emanating from the crowd, and Alice was soon joining in with them. As Marni started turning everyone could see there was much more to this garb than met the eye. It only took a bit of motion for Alice to pick up on what was fundamentally different that she had missed before. Marni looked... blocky somehow! On the host's chest, stomach, biceps, and outer legs were angular lines that betrayed something lying beneath the fabric. Most conspicuous of all, there was a large pack strapped to her back with two large cylinders conjoined by a computer with a fancy looking display.

"While I've always fancied about modeling, this isn't exactly what I had in mind doctor! Obviously there's more to this get up than your average jogging suit smuggling some plastic plates and what appears to be a very expensive science experiment. Tell us a bit about all of this?"

"Absolutely Marni! Make your way over here and we'll get started." The rotund researcher patted the arm of the love seat and continued. "As you all are certainly aware my research deals with facing the challenges associated with obesity. Now unlike other doctors featured on daytime television programs, I'm not going to try to sell some fad diet or sketchy pill and then walk away with my cut. I'm a real doctor working with real science looking for real solutions."

Britney yielded to the brief applause from the crowd as Marni waited patiently next to her. Alice leaned forward, even more captivated by the doctor's words. As an alumnist of the prestigious Buttercombe Academy, she was quite familiar with women of (much!) larger size. In fact for a few years Alice herself had succumbed to the temptations and wore her fair share of extra pounds before shedding them in favor of more trendy and fashion forward clothes. They just weren't available in the sizes she had reached by the end of her sophomore year! Some of her classmates didn't quite share the same priorities though. By the time they walked for graduation, the majority of her friends and acquaintances had sailed north of the 300 pound mark.

Present day Alice slipped out of her mental sidetrack as Dr. Huan continued talking. "Well Marni, everyone in the crowd, and everyone watching at home; today I'd like to share with you one of my latest and greatest breakthroughs! I'd like to first mention that this was only made possible by the generous funding from the lovely people at Yeng Inc.I truly can't thank this company enough and I am so glad they share my vision. Marni, what you're wear today is an early prototype of Yeng-Huan Suspensor technology!" The crowd let out a wild reaction, led by those in the crowd that could guess at what the name hinted at.

"Britney, with a big sponsor and a big name like that, you have my full attention. Now, what have I signed myself up for here, exactly?"

"I'll show you, turn your back to me." Marni promptly did. The massive doctor leaned forward and deftly tapped at the screen on Marni's back a couple times, causing the backpack to begin lowly humming."Well Marni, tell me what how you... feel."

The crowd held it's breath. Alice was practically biting her nails in anticipation. Marni looked confused for a moment, then took a step forward and froze.

"Folks, I want to give you a full disclaimer here. I promise there is no gimmick here, no strings holding me from above, just this... suit." She took a few more amazingly long steps forward. A few gasps came from the crowd as they started to piece what this amazing suit could do. Alice cocked eyebrows on the brink of realization. Suddenly, the host smirked and exclaimed in her best hot-shot voice "Watch this!"

Suddenly, she jumped straight up. And not just a small hop you'd expect from a woman of her girth. She reached a clear two feet off the ground, possibly higher. She landed in a small stutter, not quite used to handling her newfound mobility, and crowd burst out in amazement. Marni gracefully spun around, putting to shame the first rotation she had made to display the attire. Going an extra half revolution, Marni stopped to face one Dr. Britney Huan, who was grinning like a mother watching her daughter walk for the first time. Marni spoke up, "Dr. Britney Huan, I am absolutely astounded that you gave me the privilege to wear and show such an amazing technology. I mean this in the best way possible; just what have you done here!"

"Thank you for your kind words Marni, it means a lot. As you can no doubt tell, and as most of the crowd seems to have figured out, the Yeng-Huan Suspensor technology in this suit does just that! It suspends the mass of the wearer to essentially counter-act gravity. Of course, this is a very early version of the tech, so I can't quite share all of its secrets. But as you can see it's stable enough for its public debut. Right now I have it calibrated to effectively halve your weight. Now I know a woman doesn't simply give her weight away, but I'm guessing at your size you're feeling quite the difference right now."

During Britney's speech Marni was busy playing around with her new freedom. She tried bouncing on the balls of her feet, swinging from side to side, and even a few more small hops. Every movement she made seemed so much easier than just five minutes ago. "Oh Britney, this is just beyond description! I haven't felt this light in years! Even before my days on the radio I don't think I could move around this easily! But tell me, there's got to be a catch. Is my bone structure gonna disappear if I do this too long?"

"Nothing that we know of yet. The main problem right now... " Marni was busy going for another high jump when an indicator light on the top of the pack flashed red and Marni's jump only cleared the few inches one would normally expect "...is that the power consumption is extremely high and thus one full charge will only last a few minutes."

"Well if that's all there is to worry about for now, then sign me up! As someone of significant size, I definitely understand how much easier this Yeng-Huan Suspensor tech would make life easier, and much more fun! Not to mention the kinds of applications this technology could have across all areas of industry and entertainment. Just wow. Again, Dr. Huan, I'm humbled and grateful that you chose to showcase your world changing technology here exclusively on the Marni Blake show. I can't wait to see where you take this one, and what other surprises you'll have in store for us in the years to come!"

"Thanks for having me Marni, it was my pleasure and I'll definitely let you know if I cook up anything else in the future!"

The crowd went wild as Marni struggled to do her transition over them, "We'll be right back after these short messages!

Alice blinked. Knowing she wouldn't find anything else at 11:30am to top a spectacle like that, she clicked the TV off. Amazing. Anti-gravity clothes... what a time to be alive. The curvy young gal sat back on the couch and pondered the clip she had just seen. She briefly questioned if it was real, but quickly dismissed the notion. The Marni Blake show was known for wild, wacky, and sometimes trashy segments, but that previous segment seemed impossible to have faked. The light-footed performance from Marni, the genuine reactions from the crowd, and of course the real deal Dr. Huan. Something about this technology had Alice very excited. She couldn't stop thinking about that outfit and what it did. In fact, she found herself fixating again and again on...
125221.title: A Science Miracle is a Fashion Disaster!

choices: Alice can't let it go! That morning, she googles directions to Dr. Huan's lab!
The next morning, the Marni Blake footage is all over the internet!
Alice manages to be normal, and goes to classes a few days later...
1252211.content:
Just how ugly that outfit was!

Admittedly, that was a silly thing to be so concerned with when the outfit in question was capable of allowing huge leaps and bounds in the air, effectively "halving" (to use Dr. Huan's phrasing) Marni's weight. With just a single jump, the roly-poly hostess was sent nearly two feet off the ground, and her slow and awkward gait was replaced with the pep of a stepper more than half her size.

Surely it had to have been staged. There was no way that an ugly, blocky sweat suit allowed for a woman of Marni's size to jump and spin and twirl like that. It just couldn't be done—Marni had to have weighed almost three hundred pounds on a pretty teensy-weensy frame. As much as Alice loved the show, she had an awful hard time believing that this was a thing.

But as she played it back and forth, back and forth, Alice wasn't becoming so sure.

Dr. Huan tapped on the computer display and slowly, ever so slowly, Marni just seemed to... rise slightly! It was most noticeable in her belly, which slowly rose from resting heavily on her meaty thighs to swelling outwards; completely supported by the suit! Alice watched it over and over again, looking for wires or... or something but there was nothing!

It was incredible!

Where was stuff like this when I was fat? Alice thought bitterly, if only for a moment.

She couldn't begin to count the time she'd gotten winded just walking to and from her various classes at Buttercombe. She had been such a blimp back then, with none of the bouyancy. Big belly, big hips, big ass, all weighing her down; getting her caught in things and popping all of her painstakingly tailored clothes. Alice thought, if just for a moment, what her high school life might have been like if she had one of those Yeng-Huan thingies during her peak weights...

"Ugh, but I would never have been caught dead wearing that thing." Alice dismissed the idea with a distasteful curl of her nostril, "It would have been fashion suicide!"

It was true. Even if she had been a total cow back then (and she was!) Alice could never have brought herself to wearing something so ugly. Those blocky sleeves, that gross chest-piece, and those horribly flaring frumpy pants... ugh! She'd have looked twenty pounds heavier in that thing if she put it on right now! And not to mention that godawful drab gray color; there had to be something more stylish or sleek that doctor could have made them. At least a cuter color.

If Alice had designed that suit, it would have been...

Hmm...

If she had designed that suit...

***


"Hey babe, I'm home!"

Zack called out into the apartment, loosening his Hammond-red tie and unbuttoning his sport coat. They had given him an awfully warm welcoming dinner at the hotel; he couldn't possibly have said no, especially when so many of them brought their own dishes from home. He might have made a bit of a pig of himself, but who could say no to a good old fashioned apple pie?

"Al?" Zack looked around, only to find the apartment empty, "You home?"

Ignoring the sensation of fullness in his stomach, Zack ventured deeper into the apartment. The living room TV was still on, so Alice wasn't gone gone. Maybe she'd stepped out for a bite to eat or something? It wasn't like he could blame her after all—he was pretty late.

But that was when he noticed that the light in the spare bedroom was on, and the unmistakable sound of Hillary Heart was crackling through the tell-tale sound of that old speaker that Alice liked to listen to when she worked.

"Hey babe?" Zack knocked on the door with his finger, "You in there?"

The sound of Alice's little office chair rolling against the hardwood floors, along with a muting of the stereo, signaled that he had been heard. Within seconds Alice whipped open the bedroom door, her long blonde hair a frizzled mess. She was still dressed in her pajamas from that morning, so he knew she hadn't been anywhere; she couldn't have been. Zack recognized that look in Alice's eyes—he only saw it when...

"Hi sweetie!" she said with a big, scarily energetic grin on her face, "You will never guess what I saw on TV today."

"Wait...what?"

And so she told him! She ushered him inside the spare bedroom that was currently Alice's de facto studio for all her latest projects. He sat down on the futon that they kept in the sofa position while she rolled around in her office chair, from her desk to the easel papers that she'd tacked on the wall. And she told him everything—that she was watching Marni, that there was this weird doctor, that this weird doctor was really really fat, how she had this suit, this thing that made Marni float! Then she went back and explained that Marni was kinda heavy and then she went back and reiterated that, yes, she watched that Marni Blake Show. And then she reminded Zack that holy crap, this Dr. Huan chick had a suit that made people float!

"But it was sooooo ugly!" Alice ran her hand through her long hair as she whipped out her sketches, the loose papers crackling as she handed them over, "So I thought... you know, why should it have to be ugly? Who's gonna wanna wear it if it makes them look like a floating slab of concrete, right?"

"So yoou..."

Zack flipped through the sketches. His girlfriend wasn't a bad artist—she couldn't be, if she wanted to conceptualize her work. Alice had drawn a myriad of different designs originated from her rough sketch of what (he guessed) was her memory of Marni's outfit. On the right there was the original, with a rather accurate portrayal of the heavyset hostess if her advertisements were any indication of her current weight, and with every progressive design Alice took the outfit and made it... different. Better! Much, much better.

"So what are these weird... things?" Zack pointed to the model's arm, "These things all on her body?"

"I don't know!" Alice snatched the paper back and started circling with her finger, "But Dr. Huan made it seem like they were pretty important. I think they're whatever makes the suit do the... the floaty thing."

"Right." Zack said with a smile, "The floaty thing."

"I've got it recorded, Zack!" Alice huffed, "I swear, I'm not making this up!"

"I know, I believe you." Zack said with a hint of condescension, "But it's really late babe. Remember? I've gotta start going to work early in the mornings now."

"Ugh! You don't believe me." Alice swiveled around in her chair, "You think I'm dumb."

"I don't think you're dumb." Zack rolled his eyes and turned his girlfriend around on the chair, "I think you're probably pretty hungry though. And then you're gonna be sleepy and..."

There was a telltale grumbling from Alice's stomach. It was true—she hadn't eaten anything since Zack left that morning. She had just been so absorbed in her work that... she had forgotten to eat again. As the realization hit her, Alice's face grew a bright shade of red. Zack gave her a knowing glance, which caused her to shrink slightly as her newfound candor disappeared in favor of embarrassment.

"O-Okay, okay... you win..." Alice said sheepishly, "You're right. I am a little hungry."

"I figured."

"But... do you like them?" Alice looked up at her boyfriend pleadingly, "I mean... they look good, right? You'd wear them?"

There was a moment of silence as Zack allowed Alice to process just what she had asked of him.

"I-I mean, i-if you were a girl!" Alice backpedaled, "A-And you were, um... and you were kinda big..."

"I would totally wear them if I were a girl and I were big." Zack gave Alice an appreciative kiss on the forehead, "Now come on, before you work yourself back up again. We'll talk about it more in the morning."

"Right..." Alice took one last look at her designs, "In the morning..."
1252211.title: An Alice Obsessed with Alterations!

choices: "Mrs. Huan? Do we have an... err, a designer?"
"Lexi? Lexi, there's someone to see you. Yes, I'm serious."
12522111.content:
Zack rubbed his bleary eyes, limping wearily into the kitchen on sleep-stoned legs.

"Al?" He muttered, wincing as the florescence hit his tired eyes. "What're you doing up? It's... six-thirty."

Alice jumped. "Oh! Hey, sleepyhead! I'm just... making some eggs!"

Zach blinked his tired eyes, trying not to look too skeptical. His girlfriend was many things, but a cook she was not. Time and again Alice had insisted - and proven, on occasion - that she was not to be trusted in front of the microwave, never mind a stove. Yet here she was, blond hair waving wildly as she turned back to the oven, her entire focus concentrated on the slowly burning eggs.

"Thought you'd be asleep," Zack muttered, picking at his boxers as he sat down at the old faux-wood table. Alice seemed anything but asleep - in fact, she was already dressed, her sky-blue blouse paired with a well-pressed white skirt. "Isn't it your day off?"

"Yea, but you know what they say... second day is always the hardest! Thought I'd help you out," she chuckled unconvincingly. "Uh, do... do you think these are done?" Alice used four hot pads to grip the handle of the pan, biting her lip as she revealed the stringy eggs inside.

"Perfect," Zack insisted, grimacing as merrily as he could as Alice presented him with a plate of eggs and a glass of milk. He forked a clump, sticking them in his mouth - like eating rubber seasoned with sooty onion. He took an immediate swig of milk. "Definitely better than last time."

Alice beamed, watching nervously as Zack shoveled down the brownish-yellow eggs. He didn't gag once. Giving her a quick thumbs-up, he excused himself to get dressed.

Hearing the soft hiss of the shower from the bedroom, Alice hastily pulled her newest design out of a currently-empty kitchen drawer. It was rough - real rough. Like, drawn-while-she-was-cooking-eggs rough. But it would have to do. She pulled out a pencil for a few last-minute touch ups until she heard the shower stop.

Zack walked into the kitchen, looking snazzy in his white button-up and slacks. "Cya later Al," Zack said, smoothing his white button-up nervously.

"Later, hun," Alice replied, pulling him in for a quick kiss. Zack left the house with a smile.

A quick fifteen-minute make-up check later, Alice climbed into her old silver impala. Setting the manila folder in the passenger seat, she took a deep breath. It was her day off, right? And a two-hour drive wasn't that far away. And who knew? This could be life-changing! She could meet Marni Blake!

Alice took a deep breath, clutching the steering wheel tightly. This was the type of move that had broken her out of her young, shy shell - the moves that had gotten her into ASU, the moves that had landed her Zack. She'd learned that a bit of mania could pay off in the end.

+++

"Hello? Uh... Mr"

Alice smiled as the young woman behind the counter glanced lazily over her computer screen.

"Yes, hello, and welcome to Huan Innovators, leaders in health science technology," she deadpanned. "I'm sorry, but Mrs. Huan is not available for comment today. If you have any questions for her, please email us at-"

"Hey! Uh, sorry, but I'm not actually looking for Mrs. Huan right now." Alice smiled winningly. "Uh... I'd actually like to speak to your lead designer, if they had a moment."

"... Designer?" The girl said, surprised. She bit her lip. "Uh yea, just hold on a moment."

Alice kept her smile wide, clutching her manila folder as she watched the woman press a few buttons on her dated desk phone.

"Hello, yea, uh..."
12522111.title: A Go-get'er

choices: "Sorry hun, not interested." with a judgemental eye-roll at Alice's waistline
"Well you certainly are fashionable." with a smile, eager to see Alice's work
"Do I know you from somwhere...?" she asked, cupping her chins thoughtfully
125221111.content:
"Hello, yea, uh... Ms. Huan?" the thickset blonde said in a nasal sort of voice, "Do we have an, uh... a designer?"

There was a pause, the blonde woman behind the counter curling her nose distastefully as (presumably) Dr. Huan gave her answer.

"Yeah, I didn't think so." the secretary said, her face twisted in confusion, "W- There's a lady here who asked... uh-huh... No, I don't know her name."

Another pause; Alice took this moment to stretch up on her tippy-toes anxiously. She clutched the manila folder that much tighter against her waist, as a tiny twitch of sleep deprivation upset her vision. It wasn't like she had stayed up all night or anything to draw all these so she could just stand in the office...

"What's your name, sweetie?" the woman turned suddenly to Alice

"Alice, Alice Carlyle." the addressed woman spat out reflexively

"Alice Alice Carlyle." the other woman repeated back into the receiver, "Well I don't know why she'd -! Yes ma'am. Uh-huh. Okay." here the woman turned back once more...

"Yeah, okay hun, Dr. Huan will see you shortly."

***


As Alice walked down the halls of Huan labs, she was not focused on its size.

Though it was intimidatingly large and decidedly foreign, with its sleek white technology and seemingly random placement of machines and readers, Alice couldn't have been bothered less by the sterility of it all. The aspiring designer was walking on Cloud 9, her head filled with puffy thoughts about her accomplishment here today.

Here she was, just coming off of an obsessive all-nighter, about to meet one of the most prolific scientific minds of her time.

Because fashion.

She could hardly believe it; she may as well have still been dreaming! This was a huge opportunity for her, and the head scientist - this Dr. Huan woman - had agreed to see her and look at her designs! No one had ever taken her dreams seriously when she was little, barring perhaps her sister, and look at her now! About to talk to one of the smartest people on the planet and criticize her fashion skills.

Life goals!

Alice was so entranced by all the possibilities that were in play, she barely noticed when she bumped into an intern or scientist here and there; letting out half-thought excuse-mes or too-little-too-late sorrys. Alice stumbled and fumbled her way until she reached the office that the secretary had described; the one at the end of the hall on her left.

DR. BRITTANY HUAN
HEAD OF DEPARTMENT


She supposed this was the place.

Taking a deep breath to steel herself, Alice hugged the manila folder of her sketches tight against her body. She paused, closed her eyes, and attempted to center herself. Her heart was pounding in her chest; she could feel it against her drawings.

Taking one last look at the nameplate on the door, Alice extended an arm, and twisted the handle.

Inside the office was messy. Papers strewn about, pieces of lab equipment placed haphazardly on this surface or that table. But it was a big room, justifiably so given the size of its sole occupant.

At the desk against the back wall, Alice quickly recognized Dr. Huan. The immense Asian woman stood out like a sore thumb, Alice would have been able to pick her out of a crowd even if she hadn't just seen her on Marni Blake. Dr. Huan was so corpulent, so big in her belly especially, that she required a C-shaped desk to wrap around her vastness, rather than be forced to reach past her own girth in order to be productive. Her vast gut poured outwards readily, resting on the surface in front of her just ever so slightly, while the rest of her filled the remaining space accordingly.

Apparently, judging by all the takeout boxes, Alice had interrupted her lunch.

Putting on her best game face, Alice smiled eagerly and headed inside.

Dr. Huan needed only to hear the door shut, instantly recognizing Alice as her potential client.

She looked the blonde bombshell up and down, her swaddling chins flexing as they swelled against her neck, and said...
125221111.title: Alice's Appointment Goes Unabated

choices: Alice picks up courage to explain the purpose of her visit
Before she can find words, she is smothered with Huan hospitality
1252211113.content:
“Do I know you from somewhere…?“ Brittany Huan asked, cupping her chins thoughtfully. She frowned, “Alice Carlyle. Carlyle. Wait a minute, aren't you Mel's little sister?“

Alice nodded reluctantly, not happy to be “Mel's little sister“ again. Here she wanted to make a name for herself and she was again reduced to a footnote in her older sister's life.

“Gosh, it is you! Yes, I see the family resemblance.“ And Brittany gave her a piercing stare.

“Um, yeah...“

“I think I remember you from Buttercombe, too. But why are you so thin, girl? You used to look much healthier… What happened? Have you fallen on hard times?“

“Oh, uh, no...“

“Well, never mind. Come in, sit down, join me. You must be starving. Let's have a bite and talk about Buttercombe.“ And Brittany pointed to the other, much smaller chair opposite her throne.

“Well, Dr. Huan, I just dropped in to...“ Alice was looking for a way to politely refuse.

“Oh, no, no, no, don't call me that, you make me feel old. For my old friends, I'm just Brittany, OK?“

“Thanks, but I am here on business, you see, Brittany...“ Alice sat down on the edge of the visitors' chair, ready to spring up again, and placed her folder on a rare empty space on the table.

"Yes, yes, but that can wait. Or are you in a hurry?“

Alice truthfully admitted that no, she wasn't.

“So let's have lunch first, business can wait, right?“ Brittany looked around the empty boxes. “Well, there's not much left, but have a bite of this china,“ and a family-sized container landed in front of Alice. “And then we can split the cheesecake. You like cheesecake, right? Everyone likes cheesecake. So, how's Mel doing these days?“

“Umm, she moved to her aunt Rhonda and last I heard from her, she had a grand time there, much better than while she stayed with our mother...“ Alice took a breath to continue but Brittany butted in.

“Right, I recall when I first met Mel – back then she was a skinny freshman, almost as scrawny as you – she mentioned your mother being a total b...“ and Brittany reminisced about the good old times, bringing up one funny episode, then another…

She talked and talked, Alice tried to put in a word or two but soon she resigned herself to nods and grunts of agreement. To cover her unease, she dug in. As much as she tried to limit her consumption these days, fond memories of Buttercombe (and the exquisite taste of her lunch) made her forget diets and restraint. She could afford it to eat like this for once, right? Sooner than she expected, her fork scraped the bottom.

“… and then me and Mel and Lexi... Ah, see? I knew you'd be hungry. I'll order us some pizzas, too,” and Brittany reached for the landline.

“No, no, I've had enough, that's all right...” Alice's hand slid over her stuffed tummy. She knew this pleasant feeling all too well and tried hard to avoid any more overeating nowadays.

“No need to thank me. Hi, Suzy, yeah, could you order me a couple pizzas? … Yeah, with all the works, as always. Thank you, dear.” hanging up, she turned to Alice. “But I keep talking about

“Umm, I moved here with my… my boyfriend...” it was still a novelty for Alice, “because I won a scholarship at Abercrombie. And...” and again she didn't get any further.

“I see. It must be hard to make ends meet,“ Brittany smiled sympathetically. “I've been there too. But don't worry, I can help you...“

“Umm, actually that's not why I am here...” Alice struggled with her words.
1252211113.title: An Unexpected Lunch

choices: likes them! Not only that, she offers to pay Alice for her work!
doesn't... hate them. Alice DID just call her work ugly after all!
is so impressed, she offers Alice a job at the Yeng-Huan complex!
12522111132.content:
As much as Alice liked to think that she had come out of her shell… old habits tended to die hard.

In the sense that she was still somewhat meek at times, yes. She had never been a very outgoing person, stemming from her days back at Buttercombe Academy to even now. Despite her forthright in coming, making the drive and staying up all night sketching and even getting into Dr. Huan’s—Brittany’s—office, Alice still felt her knees shake beneath her. Her legs quivered with trepidation, and her entire body seemed to tremble at the mountain of a woman before her. What if she didn’t like her ideas? What if she thought they were dumb? What if this whole visit which, for the most part, had been very nice so far, turned sour as soon as she opened her stupid mouth? Oh, Alice could barely bear the thought…

But also in the sense that, as much as Alice liked to think that she could control her appetite around food, she was still very much the squishy little girl from back in high school. Dietary duties could still easily slip onto her back burner if she didn’t watch herself. And around old friends, surrounded by food and knocking at the knees in anticipation of showing this enormous alum a “better” version of the thing she’d spent her career on? It made her feel better to have something to snack on!

So she let Brittany talk. And talk. And talk.

And then when the pizza got there, they talked. And talked. And ate. And talked.

The woman was like an expanding feedback, somehow managing to stuff more and more into her mouth without ever skipping a beat! How she became such a size was clearly no mystery, given the amount of food she was comfortable handling, but it was so easy for poor Alice to get lost in it all! There had been so many boxes at the start, and Alice had had so much to say! But then the boxes dwindled, and her mind grew foggy. Her distended tummy aching against the waistband of her pants, something that she hadn’t felt in years, was enough to make Alice forget just why she was even there for a second.

“Oof!” Dr. Huan exclaimed with a pat at the top of her belly, “Well… that was nice, catching up, wasn’t it?”

“Y-Yeah…” Alice whimpered, “I, uh… I never knew my sister had such a wild streak…”

“Me either, ‘til then.” Dr. Huan wrinkled her fat, flat face raunchily, “But as much as I’d love to stay here all night and tell you embarassing stories…”

“O-Oh!” Alice jumped up. The notebook, of course! “B-Brittany, I was wondering if you’d… um…”

“Oh come on, I’ve told you lots of stories tonight.” Brittany waved her hand dismissively, “But if you want to come back maybe tomorrow or something? I’ve got plenty more where those came from, and it’s always nice to have someone to eat lunch with.”

Alice stood uneasily on her feet. Whoof, how much had she eaten? Her belly felt like it was filled with rocks…

“I, uh… I actually wanted to talk to you… I came here to talk to you about this, actually…” Alice stuttered nervously, “I saw your appearance on the Marni Blake Show.”

“Oh you did!” Brittany’s face lit up, her sauce-dotted smile stretching across the acreage of her face, “So you caught my little expose with Marni, huh? What did you think?”

“I, uh… I liked it!” Alice struggled to say, “But I couldn’t help but notice…”

“You know, I’m so glad you liked it.” Brittany blathered on, pushing herself away from the desk and allowing her belly to sink that much more forward, “I’ve heard nothing but complaints from some people. I introduce world-changing technology, and they lambast me. What kind of world, right? Figures you’d come around at a time like this! I could really use the ego-boost!”

“R-Right.” Alice smiled awkwardly, “It’s, um… I stayed up all night, actually—“

“Thinking about it? Aww shucks. That’s a little much, but I can’t say I blame you. This tech’s pretty amazing. I can’t tell you how many nights I’ve stayed up all night thinking about it myself! And now I’ve got Miss Marni all worked up about it too, so hopefully we’ll all be able to see some results soon.”

“That’s… uh… what I wanted to talk to you about…”

“Oh honey, I don’t think you’re exactly in the right market for suspensors anymore.” Brittany said with a giggle that sent her fat body quaking, “I don’t think you have nearly as much trouble getting around as someone like me or Marni do—“

“Th-They’re really ugly!” Alice spat out, her frustration peaking, “I, uh… I mean, I don’t mean to be rude, but…”

“No, no, you’re right.” Brittany conceded, nodding morosely as her chins caught against her chest, “They’re pretty stupid looking. But, I mean, it’s still in the basic stages of design. It’s not like we’re ready to mass produce these things.”

There was a small moment of silence between the two of them. Alice was really just hoping that Dr. Huan didn’t think she was insulting her. Or insinuating that she could do her job better than her. Or anything remotely like that. Because she wasn’t! Honest!

Unless it was designing clothes.

Then Alice was definitely saying that.

“I actually drew up these sketches for you.” Alice said sheepishly, bringing out the crinkled manila folder and laying them on the desk, “I saw your show and… and I thought it was so cool! But I really wanted… um… to know what you thought I guess? I know it’s all still in development, but I think maybe people might… y’know… actually want to wear them when they’re not gray tracksuits…”


Dr. Huan...
12522111132.title: Lunch Leads to Opportunity
