Alice feels she should discuss it with Zack first
125221111323.content:
“Wow. Just wow.” Brittany Huan was leafing through the sketches, leaving greasy fingerprints on them. “These clothes look much better than what I had in mind. Packaging sells, you're quite right. Huh, I can't believe I haven't thought of that.”

“Well, uh… you have such a wonderful concept here. But I felt it could sell even better when your clothes were… y'know, fashionable.”

“You're absolutely right, Alice. And I like these. Though some of the designs seem rather… complicated.”

“Yes, they are,” Alice admitted sheepishly, “but I know – from personal experience – that, um, larger customers require individual tailoring anyway. It is more expensive but I suppose you suspensor technology won't be exactly cheap either. With that in mind I went a bit overboard with the more advanced designs. If you pay a fortune for it, it should look like it, right?”

“Absolutely!” Brittany barked a short laugh, “A clever idea. There's one thing I still don't get, though,” the giant woman leaned forward heavily to tap at a sketch, “What are all those lines crisscrossing this drawing? And a couple others too?”

“Well, obviously I haven't tried these clothes on yet so I'm just speculating. But I expect it would be best to have some kind of in-built structural support. It would make the clothes more durable and maybe even more comfortable for the wearer than when all that weight is carried just by the cloth itself. You could have the support either overt or hidden, depending on taste. In fact,” Alice was on a roll, “in fact you could have two basic production lines, let's call them 'techno' and 'chic' based on whether they're visible or not.”

“Huh, I see. You've really thought of everything, haven't you?” There was a hint of admiration in Brittany's voice.

“Well, I tried,” Alice blushed. “Obviously it's hard when you don't have those things in hand, when you don't know their properties...”

“And would you like to? Learn more about suspensor technology, I mean?”

Alice nodded eagerly.

“In that case, would you be interested in designing clothes for us, Alice?”

This was what Alice had been hoping for but now she was having second thoughts about it. “Well, that's more of a full-time job...”

“I suppose I haven't made myself quite clear, Carlyle. I am offering you a full-time job with all the bells and whistles. The position of a Yeng-Huan chief designer. You won't need to skimp anymore,” Brittany added with a pointed look at Alice's overstuffed middle.

“Oh. But- but I don't have any qualification for that,” Alice objected, startled, “and I'm still studying, I can't work for you full time...”

“Well, then you can work part time. A part-time job with a full-time salary and all the perks and benefits of a manager, how's that sound?” and Brittany Huan smiled like Mephistopheles offering mortals a deal they can't refuse. “Want to go over the details right now? I'll send for our HR head. And some cupcakes so we won't get hungry.”
125221111323.title: Heavy Temptation

choices: Alice heads to Huan Labs, more determined than ever to land this job!
Alice heads to Huan Labs, filled with new doubts...
1252211113231.content:
Zack huffed, digging for his keys in the pockets of his work slacks. He was tired. All of the excitement of his new job was exhausting.

"Alice?"

The poppy tones of Taylor Swift drifted from the kitchen. Zack grinned, kicking off his stiff leather shoes and peeking through the door.

Alice was standing at the stove, shake-shake-shaking her little tush as she did her best Taylor impression. What she lacked in rhythm she made up for in enthusiasm. Zack snuck up and hugged her from behind, planting a quick kiss on her cheek.

"WHaa!" Alice yelped, nearly knocking over the hamburger helper. She turned down the music, pouting. "You scared me!"

"Sorry babe," Zack smiled, "I couldn't help it. Your dancing was mesmerizing."

Alice blushed, pushing him away playfully. "Uhg, perv! How long were you standing there?"

"Long enough"

"Perv," she said with a kiss. "So hey. You will never guess what happened today."

Zack looked suspiciously at her toothy grin. "Netflix is getting Disney movies?"

"Mm, nope," Alice giggled. "I wish though."

"Let's see. They announced the new bachelor, and he's way hotter than me."

Alice bit her lip playfully. "Impossible."

"Well, what then?"

Alice struck a pose. "I got..... a job!"

Zack blinked. "A job?"

"A designing job!" Alice squealed. It was a fashion designing job, for a leading applied health science lab headed by Alice's sister's old classmate which produced amazing, yet ugly, gravity-defying overalls. Zack listened carefully as Alice told a haphazard account of what had gone on that day.

"That's amazing, Al," he said, kissing her on the forehead. "Holy crap. That's just - y'know, wow. Out of nowhere."

"Right?" Alice clasped his hands and bounced. "I can't believe it. It's like a dream come true."

Zack chuckled a little. "Yea, wow. So like, what are the hours? Your classes are just about to start up. You scheduled a lot of classes, I thought you wanted to focus on school."

"That's the great thing! Brittney even said I could work around my classes and still get full-time pay. And benefits!"

"Are you sure you want to take all of that on? I told you, my job makes enough for both of us right now. You really don't need to work."

"No," Alice retorted defensively. "But I want to. This is the chance of a lifetime. I-if I play this right, it could turn into a career!

"And that's amazing," Zack crooned. He wrapped her up in a big hug. "Sorry, this is just so sudden. What are the details? What are your responsibilities? What's the pay? You didn't sign anything, did you?"

W-well, yea, I did actually," Alice crossed her arms. "We went over the whole thing, and I agreed. I'll be making more money than you!"

"What?" Zack blinked. "Alice, really? This is a big decision that's going to effect both of us. You didn't even call me first?"

Alice huffed. "I-I'm sorry, I just was so excited. This is my dream!" Alice was becoming teary. "I-I just thought you'd bee m-more excited for me."

"I am! I am," Zack assured her. "It's just... not what I was expecting when I came home from work today. It'll be alright." Zack sniffed the air. "By the way, I think your hamburger helper is burning."

"Gah!" Alice snapped to the stove. "D-damn! Sorry!"

Zack laughed. "It's alright babe. It'll be fine."


The next morning...

12522111132311.content:
“H- Hello? Am I right in… in the Clothing Design and Construction Department?”

Bare walls and especially the bare floor made this a pretty legitimate question. Alice's voice echoed in a huge empty room devoid of any features. Only the far wall had its monotony broken by another door. A door that just screeched as it partly opened.

“Yes? And who are you?” a disembodied voice asked Alice.

“Uhh, well… t- the receptionist sent me here...” Alice stuttered. “To CDCD?”

“Are you an intern or what?” The door finally opened in full to reveal a large elderly woman, not very pleased by this intrusion into her realm. “What's yer name anyway, girl?”

“A- Alice Carlyle. T- They should have told you...” no matter how many times poor Alice told herself she shouldn't be intimidated by a gruff tone and attitude, she still hadn't gotten over it.

“That they did. So that's you? Such a chit of a girl… Well, better than nothing, I suppose. Anyway, name's Rita. Rita Sawyer, boss.” And she made a welcoming gesture.

“P- Pleased to meet you,” Alice was slowly calming down now that the woman recognised her as her boss… sort of. She made a couple hesitant steps towards the door. “Is there anyone else in here? Are you alone?” Coming closer she saw that the ancient dragoness is actually a good half-head smaller than her, although she more than compensated for that in tonnage.

“Yeah,” Rita barked a laugh. “Home alone. I think they focused so much on their thingamajigs they forgot they would need a seamstress too. They hired me just two weeks ago and nobody told me what exactly I'm supposed to do here. Well, at least the vending machines here are dirt cheap.”

“Oh,” Alice had to admit to herself that she'd imagined something more glamorous to go with the title “chief designer.”

“We were added as an afterthought and this is the result. A big pile of… nothing. I hope you'll change all that, 'specially since I heard you're chums with the big boss. But for now… I'll show you around. This was probably planned as the main workroom. Here's our corridor,” she squeezed to let Alice through, “there's the bathroom on the left and kitchen on the right – I sorta squatted that for myself, hope you don't mind – and a couple offices further on, the door opposite us leads to the farthest and largest of them all. That one should probably be yours now, boss.”

“I see.” Alice looked around. “And where do you sew?”

“Like I told you, in the kitchen, here,” and Rita pulled her to an open door. “See?”

At least here it looked lived-in a little. In fact, Rita made one little corner of a large corporate kitchen into a home away from home, including a flower on the table and a photo of some kids (her grandchildren?) on the wall. The best place, though, was reserved for a big old sewing machine.

“Here, sit down and have a donut. Or three, I oughtta be cutting down on them.” Alice was pushed into a chair and a half-eaten box was thrust in front of her.

“Oh, I really shouldn't,” Alice still felt remorse for the huge lunch she'd consumed with Brittany. But just as soon as she finished the sentence, she took a first bite. “And this is where you do all the sewing?”

“Yeah, boss. And it's been a right pain the… Oh, beg your pardon. Let me just say I hope you'll have some ideas what to do with the material. I'm a pretty good seamstress if I say so myself but these new-fangled inventions leave me stumped.”

“Well, that's what I'm supposed to be doing here. In fact I already made a couple sketches,” Alice licked her fingers clean and reached for her file...
12522111132311.title: Teething Troubles

Dr. Huan is interested in Alice's progress
125221111323111.content:
“...and perhaps you could sew on a bit of lace here...” Alice took another bite of her donut and drew a line on the cloth, “it can hide support lines to the projectors, I mean, suspensors.”

“Sure, that's brilliant,” the old seamstress agreed with enthusiasm and went to work on her old-fashioned sewing machine. “Oh, in the meantime, have a croissant, boss.”

Alice noticed that in mere three hours they spent working together, 'boss' in Rita's mouth turned from an ironic jibe into a genuine expression of respect. Pleased with herself Alice put away the empty donut box and started nibbling on a croissant while she watched her creation taking shape.

Truth be told, it was a first for her and it felt great. She'd always had to bring her ideas to fruition on her own, never before did she have people carrying out her instructions while she could just watch and relax… and criticise. “Uh, you slipped a little here.”

“I know, sorry. But you said this is just an experimental version to catch all the bugs, right?”

“Yeah, that's right,” Alice relented, though she still wasn't very happy about it. When it came to sewing she was a perfectionist. “Tell you what, finish this part, then I'l test the dress and we'll head somewhere for lunch. Sounds good?” Alice saw no reason why she couldn't make the prototype fit herself. After all, it wasn't as if she had Brittany's sizes on hand, right?

Besides, she had to admit she was looking forward to testing the radical innovation. When Rita finished, she scooped the white and blue dress and ran away to the bathroom. There she stripped down to her underwear and gingerly pulled on the fabric. She yelped as here and there, cold metallic suspensors touched her sensitive skin.

With trepidation she switched on the wrist display (much more convenient than the cumbersome laptop on the back that Marni had worn in her show!) and dialled her weight back to zero. Then she jumped just as she'd seen Marni do on TV. And she took to the air!
It was a wonderful feeling… until Alice realised she was not coming back. She was floating helplessly in mid-air, even waving her hands frantically didn't do much. She was on the brink of calling for help when she remembered that all she needed to do was increase her weight again. She slid the gauge back to twenty pounds and slowly glided back to earth.

Even at twenty pounds she felt light as a feather. Alice pirouetted a couple times just because she could and then her professionalism returned – she ran her fingers over the dress to make sure she hadn't popped any stitches, straightened the cloth, had a look into the mirror and was about to open the door when the sudden roar of an engine nearby stopped her in her tracks.

“All right, who're you supposed to be, lad?” she heard Rita shout at someone in the front room. This gave Alice a bit more confidence and she tiptoed down the corridor. Peering over Rita's shoulder she could see a forklift carrying several cardboard boxes.

The driver looked around doubtfully. “Is this the, uh, Construction Department?”

“Y-yeah,” stuttered Alice.

“Clothing Design and Construction Department,” Rita corrected him coldly.

“Good,” he grinned, unfazed. “I'm to deliver and furnish an office for a, uh...” he searched through his pockets. “Ms. Alice Carlyle.”

“That would be me,” Alice nodded.

“Show me the way to your office, please.”

“Uh, straight ahead, I suppose. The last door, straight ahead. It's open,” and Alice stepped aside to let the forklift through. “I'll show you where you can put them...”

“I'm going for lunch, boss,“ the old seamstress gave the forklift a bored look.

„OK, I'll join you later,” for Alice this was utterly new. Not only she had her own office but she could oversee its furnishings! She followed the machine inside and started instructing. “Put the desk next to that window… Uh, no, no, better put it here, opposite the door...”

Two hours later she had a real office, a large desk and a plush swivel chair in the middle, flanked by a couple office cabinets and even her own bar and a fridge – sadly they were empty so far but the worker assured Alice she was signed up for a “full room service,” whatever that meant. “I'm finished in here, Ms. Carlyle. Tomorrow the IT guys will plug in your desktop and you'll be set to go.”

“Ah, I see.”

“Just sign here, please.”

“Thank you,” Alice waited for the forklift to clear the hallway and then closed the door to admire once more a little plaque on the door announcing to everyone coming her way that this was the office of
ALICE CARLYLE
CHIEF DESIGNER
HEAD OF DEPARTMENT


Her little heart fluttered with joy but her tummy had other ideas. It growled, demanding to be filled. Alice quickly ran outside, forgetting she still had the experimental dress on.
125221111323111.title: First Day At Work

choices: “Special Project Huan” is go
Actually Ms. Sawyer has something to say...
1252211113231112.content:
Alice was stopped in her dash to cafeteria by a familiar ringtone. She tried to stop and found out it was much more difficult right now - while weighing next to nothing her inertia hasn't changed. In the end she had to “anchor” herself to a handy doorknob. She wiped some imaginary sweat from her brows and had a look around. Luckily the hallway seemed empty though she thought she'd heard a someone snicker just as she was braking down.

But then another cellphone ring reminded her of her priorities. Alice rummaged in her purse for a bit, finally picking it up. It was Brittany Huan, who else. Though she half expected it, she had to take a deep breath to calm herself first. “Yes?”

“Hi, Alice!” her old schoolmate and new colleague sounded extra chipper, “how's my favorite designer today?”

“Uh, fine, thanks. And you?”

“Good, good. Glad to hear it. Listen, I'd like to have a look at your work again and I need to get something off my chest and… I might have a request as well soooo... Would you be interested in a working lunch with me? Right now?”

“Umm, actually, I was just on the way to eat anyway...”

“Wonderful! Just come to my office, you know the way, right? I'll be waiting for you.”

Alice turned around and sprinted back to the elevator, nearly knocking down some interns. She still couldn't get used to the suspensors. Or rather to the fact that she needed the barest minimum of effort to get going and that a couple normal steps catapulted her forward at breakneck speed.

Another burst of speed took her along the management floor corridor and right through the door. She stopped only at the crescent-shaped table laden with delicacies, making her boss's giant belly quiver. Alice sheepishly smiled, Dr. Huan frowned, her chins wobbling.

“So- so- sorry. I've got the experimental dress on and it's- it is so hard to more properly in it,” Alice hastily apologised.

“Oh, that's nothing,” Brittany's frown quickly disappeared, replaced with a smile wider than ever before. “It took me some time to learn, too. Trust me. The trick is to expend the least amount of energy possible. So this is your first creation? Really? I would've thought it a model from Paris. Or at least New York. Could you turn around for me, please?”

“Sure,” Alice nodded and smoothed her dress, a little ruffled by her recent adventures. As she ran her hands down the middle, she noticed a little discrepancy. Was it showing the tiniest little bulge? Where did it come from? But there was no time to deal with it now. She fluffed the dress around again and with the tiniest push of her toe she made a little pirouette.

“Oh my. It looks so much better than our previous models. You work so fast, Alice.”

“Well, it's not just me, Ms. Sawyer did the actual sewing...”

“Yes, yes, of course. But the actual design is yours? All yours?” Alice nodded. “Wow. I'm officially impressed. Now, please take a seat and dig in. I ordered Italian. You like lasagnas? You do, everyone does, right?”

“Yeah, exactly. Everyone must love lasagnas.” And she eagerly proceeded to prove her statement – and satisfy her growling stomach. It took her several bites to realise that Brittany wasn't eating. Her mouth full of the fatty goodness, Alice quizzically raised her head.

“Uh, see...” Brittany hesitated a little then went on. “Look, Ally, I was going to start with a lengthy introduction, but seeing the dedication with which you've started, I'll cut to the chase right away. I have a special project for you in mind. That is, I'm having an investors' meeting in a couple days and I do need to show some tangible, marketable results. Would you be able to make a dress like this for me as well in, say, two days' time?” Seeing her guest's hesitation, she added, “Don't worry. There'll be a fat bonus for you, if you do. And for, uh, Ms. Soller as well.”

“Uhh, well...” Alice hastily swallowed to give a proper answer. “It could be done. I mean… I do have the preliminary designs I've shown you last time. Those would actually fit you better, much better than what I'm wearing at the moment, since those models are better suited for, eh, your body type.”

“Just say obese, don't be afraid of the word,” and Brittany laughed, making her fat shake, “I'm actually proud of my size. It takes effort, you see? But anyway, I trust you'll make it look good, no need to convince me on this account. The big question is, will you have it in two days?”

Alice withdrew into herself, frantically counting and estimating. She did have some experience and Ms. Sawyer seemed like a competent seamstress… “Yes, it could be done provided we took your measurements right after lunch. However, that is usually not recommended since your stomach would be distended from, eh, lunch. So...”

“Oh, don't worry about that!” as Brittany slapped her gut the whole table rocked a little. “My little tummy is stuffed 24/7 so it's right and proper to measure it after a proper meal. So we've got a deal?”

“Yes,” and Alice shook the offered hand.”

“Excellent! Well, that's settled. And now dig in, Ally, enjoy!”
1252211113231112.title: Special Project Persuasion

Uh oh, someone needs to wake Brittany first
12522111132311122.content:
Alice fought nausea all the way back from Brittany's office to her own. This time she wasn't sure about its exact cause. It could be her dress, that is its suspensors that she tweaked to near zero (to 0,5 lb, to be exact) to help her get up after their lunch and later forgot to dial it back.

Or it could be her lunch. Those lasagnas would normally feed both her and Zack, nowadays. She'd eaten them all and it hadn't ended there. Oh no, Dr. Huan had a hankering for Chinese and Alice hadn't dared say no to her… And then there was cheesecake for dessert, cheesecake! Alice's weakness, how could she refuse?

The truth was Alice had overeaten just like in the bad old Buttercombe days… except in many ways they were good old days. Even this stuffed feeling was actually pleasant, as soon as the worst was over. And as she was getting used to suspensors, it actually felt quite nice not to have to haul her heavy load on her poor feet.

Moreover, not long ago she would have been a lot more worried about putting on pounds again after such a binge. But here in Abercrombie she felt strangely exotic, foreign even with her narrow waist and slim hips (though both may have gotten just a little bit wider lately). So she wouldn't feel out of place if she put on a couple pounds, no need to worry on that account...

She did consider it unfair, though, that now she had to trudge all the way back through the hallways while Brittany just lowered the back of her custom-made armchair to have a nap. Perhaps, just perhaps… Alice peered into her department kitchenette to see it was completely empty. No Rita there. Perhaps there was still time for her nap, too, before they launched into the big project? She skipped to her office, locked the door and plopped into her sinfully comfortable swivel chair...

***


Alice was awakened by a nagging feeling she ought to be doing something. But what was it? Oh, right, the Special Project Huan! She flew out of the chair - literally flying since she forgot about the suspensor setting – and crashed with her door. A look at the clock newly mounted on her wall told her it was already past 3 p.m. She quickly unlocked and rushed down the corridor. “Rita? Uh, Ms. Sawyer?”

“Yes?”

Alice turned into the kitchenette, this time getting exactly the right impulse by touching the floor gently with her little toe. She gently slid onto a chair. “Uh, Ms. Sawyer, we've been assigned a special project to complete. That is, we need to produce another prototype dress, this time for Dr. Huan. From scratch, not just altering a finished dress like the one I'm wearing right now. Will we be able to do it in a couple days?”

“What do you mean by 'couple days?'” The old seamstress didn't seem enthused by the prospect.

“Weeell, it needs to be ready the day after tomorrow, for an evening gala.”

“No way, boss. Can't be done. Not in two days. Never.”

Alice's lower lip trembled. Not long ago she would have burst into tears. In fact, she was close to tears right now too. But this was the new, improved Alice, a go-getting fashionista! She frowned a little, trying to look decisive and determined… and a little threatening, too, which wasn't easy since the target of her 'wrath' outweighed her three times. “Look, it is vital for the future of our company that the dress be ready on time. And since we have no other immediate job on hand, you can hardly claim to be overworked. And… and Dr. Huan promised a fat bonus for both of us if we pull it off.”

“Oh. Well, you should've started with that last bit, boss,” Rita said a bit reproachfully. “In that case… huh. So what's it supposed to be?”

“An evening gown for Dr. Huan. For her meeting with investors.” Alice repeated patiently, “To convince them we mean business and we're worth putting their money in. So you see how important it is...”

“Yes, yes, yes,” Rita waved it away, “the magic word is 'bonus,' boss. Remember it the next time. So a whole new dress – more of a tent, really – in just two days. Huh. We might have to work 'till 7 or 8… It can be done but...”

“Good.” Alice tried to look her subordinate down like a good manager. “That's what I wanted to hear.” She pulled out her phone. “Brittany? Are you ready to have your measurements taken?”
12522111132311122.title: The Rocky Start of Special Project Huan

choices: Brittany is satisfied with her new suit
Brittany is less than happy and makes her displeasure felt
125221111323111222.content:
“Brittany? Are you ready to have your measurements taken?” Alice listened with dismay to the pre-recorded voice, “HI! You've reached Brittany Huan, please leave a message.” Click.

She hesitated but plowed on. “Err… Hello, Brittany? This is Alice, Alice Carlyle. Erm, we need you in CDCD for the fitting? You know, for the project we talked about? Just about, eh, an hour ago? Please let me know ASAP, thanks.” And she hung up the phone, biting her lip. “Listen, I just had an idea. Brittany showed up in Marni Show in a suspensor outfit that had to be made here. So you should have her measurements already, right?”

“Ah, good thinking, boss, but no. That was before my time. They must've produced it in Experimental, all by themselves. In fact I suspect that Clothing Design was a result of that first attempt. But since they didn't have anything better they just showed that fashion disaster on TV. Do you really think I'd ever produce anything so hideous? I'm offended, truly I am.” Rita glowered.

“Sorry,” Alice sighed. “In that case… Perhaps we ought to wake her up since we have so little time and need to start?”

“No, no, no, no, no! I'm not going to be the one waking up the big boss! That's far above my paygrade! That's what you're paid for!”

“Eh, big boss? What actually is Brittany's position in this outfit? She's not the general manager, or is she?”

“Oh, well,” Rita Sawyer grew contrite, “sorry, just some gossip I overheard in the cafeteria. Listen, it's best you forget I said something. I'm just a stupid seamstress, what do I know about big business?”

Naturally all this just piqued Alice's interest. Perhaps it was intended to. “Do go on. I'm interested. Please,” she added as an afterthought.

“Well… you're right that we have other bosses, managers ekcetra. But Dr. Huan – well, the name says it all. She's an heir to the Huan half of our company plus a good friend of people at Yeng and Boonliang-Spencer, our other major investors. And the talk of the cafeteria is, this whole suspensor thingy is her idea, her baby and she cobbled the consortium together herself. But she didn't care for all the tedium of everyday management so she's just a department head just like you, boss.”

“I see,” Alice nodded thoughtfully.

“Anyway, back to our problem. Are you going to wake our biggest boss or should we wait? And lose our bonuses when we don't make it in time?” Rita needled her.

“OK, OK, I'm going. No need to tell me twice,” Alice sighed and glided back along the corridors to Brittany's office. She was a little apprehensive too, though she rationalised she had nothing to fear. After all, Brittany herself said she wanted them to start on her evening dress right away, right? So there was no reason to worry, right?

Despite that Alice knocked on her door with no little trepidation, only to by greeted by: “Yeah? Come in...”

The voice sounded a little sleepy but it meant Brittany was fully awake again. Alice opened the door and peeked inside. “Err, hi? You said you wanted us to take your measurements after lunch?”

“Sure, sure,” the big Chinese American girl stretched, yawned, and pressed several buttons. “Shirly, I'll be in the Clothing Department. If anything urgent turns up, let me know, otherwise I'm gone for the day, all right?” Not waiting for an answer she sprang from her chair, evidently helped by suspensors, and turned to Alice. “Let's get going. No time to waste!”

***


Watching Rita measure Brittany was educational. Sure, Alice used to be big, too, but never this big. Stripped to her underwear, Dr. Huan seemed even bigger than before. She was huge, immense, titanic. In front the vast orb of flesh that made her belly shivered whenever the seamstress touched it, propped by all the food inside to hover just above her knees. At the back the shelf of her backside jiggled in harmony.

But she was equally big elsewhere, too. True, her gut and butt made up most of her weight but fat found its way to other places too. Brittany's breasts were well beyond D-cups, her thighs resembled tree trunks, spread apart to bear all her weight, arms were wider than Alice's thighs. Even her face, with bulging cheeks and a selection of chins, was a study in curves, there wasn't a single straight line on her.

The body of Dr. Brittany Huan was a testament of unbridled gluttony. And laziness too, as soon as Rita finished her work, she collapsed on a chair, making it creak dangerously. “Ugh, that was a workout! Is there anything to eat here?”

And then she munched on Rita's doughnuts while she discussed her future attire with Alice. When they were mostly done, Brittany treated her to a sumptuous dinner in the town's best, or at least most expensive restaurant, gushing all the time how her new dress should look like, airy, light, loose, fluffy and cute, yet serious and conservative.

***


Overstuffed Alice drove home where she absent-mindedly hugged Zack and spent the entire night drawing (and tearing) new drafts. It was by no means easy. At first she was simply too full to come up with anything good and later she was getting sleepy. She drank plenty Coke and coffee by mugs to keep herself awake, ate several bags of chips and plenty of chocolate plus a midnight snack to keep her energy levels up.

In the end, she gave up on high couture and designed a simple flowing business suit in burgundy. Drawing from her own fat girl experience, she added plenty more braces and reinforcements. The dress would be heavy even without suspensors but that's what what they were there for. If they were lifting hundreds of Brittany's pounds, a dozen more for the outfit wouldn't matter.

Alice somehow made it to work in the morning, moving like an automaton she passed her draft on to Rita, took the bus to ASU and then passed out at a lecture, still in her experimental dress that she hadn't taken off all night. Refreshed after several hours of sleep and school lunch, she returned to find her seamstress in full swing and a plump, bespectacled geek impatiently waiting for her arrival.

“Hi, I'm Rene Zerbst, from IT. You could've told me you won't be here in the morning. I've been waiting here two hours already and missed lunch,” he whined, although empty donut boxes around hinted he didn't go hungry.

Alice was getting ready to apologise but then she thought twice about it. If I'm the boss of Clothing Design I should behave like one. I ought to remember I'm no longer a timid little mouse. She gave him an icy glare instead. “I WAS here in the morning, at 9. Where were you?”

“Oh… Well- I- I...”

“Never mind that. Why are you here? What's the problem?”

“Err, I brought and installed your data terminal, Ms. Carlyle. Everything's ready, I just need you to log in and confirm it works. And yeah, to brief you on our security protocols and such,” he shrugged sheepishly. “Everyone has to be.”

“I see. Well then, why don't you start right away?” Alice gestured to her office and walked to the door, searching for her keys. “Will I be able to log on external sites?”

“Oh, yes, you can access Facebook with no problem, don't worry,” Rene rattled out, apparently used to answering this question often. “In fact, browsing the net is much safer here since we use state-of-the-art filters and...” and he launched into a lengthy lecture.

Alice understood every fifth word of it (typically “is,” “the” or “and”) but she let him speak, finding her way around in the meantime. She let him explain the intricacies of company intranet, lounging in her new, comfortable swivel chair, let him help her with finding her Facebook page. When Rene finally left, leaving his number “in case you needed my help with anything,” she kept idly browsing Facebook when her eyes were drawn to a blinking green light that hadn't been there the day before.

Leaning down below her desk she found out her fridge had been plugged in and fully stocked. And when she scooted her chair over to the bar, she discovered it full of snacks, too. “So this is the full room service they mentioned yesterday,” Alice mused, opening a bag of chips.
125221111323111222.title: The Behemoth Wakes Up

choices: Alice's department runs smoothly for now
Actually the flow of demands mounts
1252211113231112221.content:
Brittany twirled in front of a full-length mirror in her brand new burgundy suit. “Not bad. Not bad at all. Actually I expected something a little more… daring, but it'll do.”

“Well, you said you were going to an investors' meeting,” Alice protested meekly.

“Ah, I should've been more specific, sorry,” the humongous scientist smiled to mitigate the impact of her first words. “Yes, it's an investors' meeting but some of those old lechers like a good look down my cleavage. Well, never mind that. This is good and we'll come up with a more revealing version next time, eh? Anyway, gotta run. See ya tomorrow!”

When the up-and-coming fashionista arrived at work the next day Brittany was already waiting for her in the Clothing Department kitchen, munching on Rita's doughnuts. Beaming, she waved away Alice's stuttered apologies. “Oh, nobody says you have to be here every day at nine. That's what part time means, right? Plus you're a department head just like me so no need to apologise. We're buddies, right? And your buddy tells you, enjoy your privileges to the fullest, y'hear?”

“Uh, OK…” As Alice searched for a safer topic she noticed Brittany was again wearing her old baggy suspensor jumpsuit. “Err, how did it go yesterday? Is anything wrong with my- I mean, with the suit?”

“Oh, no, no, no, no! Quite the opposite! It was a huge success. A tremendous success! In fact, we're bankrolled for at least two more years of R&D, thanks to the two of us!” and Brittany high-fived Alice. “Frankly, I wouldn't have hired you if you weren't Mel's little sister. And that would've been a tremendous mistake! You're just a genius! Just as much a genius in your field as I'm in mine,” she swayed a little.

Alice was getting ready to protest but when she looked at her she noticed black bags under Brittany's eyes. Combined with her sway, the unfocused way she spoke, repeating words and whole phrases... “Have you slept at all?”

“Tonight? Nah, who needs sleep?” Brittany yawned, immediately contradicting her words. “The negotia-tie-tions ended late and then we went to celebrate and then I had a snack and a late dinner and another snack and… Anyway, that seamstress of yours needs to let my business suit out a little. And resew the torn-out zipper. And you could pick a stretchier material? And I'm going to hit the bed now...” she yawned again and started pulling herself up.

“Oh, one more thing. Expect first clients some time tomorrow. A couple investors have shown interest in my suit and are willing to pay premium for the chance to have their own. And who am I to refuse their money, eh? Obviously it would have to be scaled down but your genius should have no trouble with that, right?” she winked, getting ready to leave.

Emboldened by Brittany's praise, Alice picked up courage to say: “Wait a minute, how many clients and how soon? We're going to need more workers. Rita can't always do it all alone.”

“Oh sure, sure. Just tell the HR I okayed it. Hire whoever you want, as many underlings as you need. Your contribution is worth it!” Brittany laughed. “The more investors – and their wives – wear your creations, the happier they'll be. In fact, is there anything else I could get you to help you with your work? Anything at all? Just say it.” She added, seeing Alice hesitate.

“Well, perhaps we could subscribe to some fashion magazines? I mean, I try to follow newest trends on the net but that's always a little late and a little… little.”

“Oh, sure! Just list whatever you need in the Company Procurement Form and they'll take care of the rest. Rita can show you how. I suppose she's been using it already, to get cloth and such.”

“Umm, thank you...”

“And I expect you for lunch!”
1252211113231112221.title: Special Project Huan Triumphant

choices: Alice finds out she is putting on weight
Zack notices it first
12522111132311122211.content:
The frantic flurry of activity, typical for her first days at work, was unexpectedly replaced with a much more sedate pace. As a part-timer, Alice came to work in mid-morning three times a week, parked her bottom in her boss chair, browsed fashion magazines and websites, snacking on the neverending supply of goodies from her fridge and bar. When she came across an idea she liked, an outfit she wanted to have, she put it aside for later because at midday she was expected for lunch with Brittany.

After a filling lunch and a power nap she pulled out her drawing pad, looked at her inspiration and spent the afternoon sketching her concepts and adapting clothes to fit well with suspensors inside. When she was satisfied with her design she passed the draft to Rita and her two new hires and a day later she wore the resulting creation to make sure everything fit.

Since it always did, Alice put it on for her next lunch with Brittany and, more often than not, ended up altering the design to fit her behemoth of a friend too. Her minions then sewed it for her and one or two other 'premium customers' as well and everyone was happy.

Brittany was happy to have someone of her age (more or less) to chat with and a steady stream of new, fashionable clothes to wear that made her feel weightless.

Rita was happy that with two underlings she could now spend the whole day with her feet up, bossing them while eating doughnuts. To make sure her job stayed that way the wily old seamstress did everything to make Alice happy, mainly kept altering the basic design to make sure each new outfit fit her boss's figure perfectly.

Alice never noticed. She was happy to get a new dress every week for the first time in her life, sometimes even two dresses a week, to have her hobby as a well-paid job, which she would leave every day early enough to treat Zack to a lavish dinner in a trendy restaurant.

Thus weeks passed by and her wardrobe kept expanding as fast as her bank account. Plus since Alice spent 24/7 levitating on suspensors while eating ever larger snacks, lunches and dinners, other her assets started expanding too.
12522111132311122211.title: Chugging Along

choices: Yes, better warn her
No need, she must know already, right?
No, it would hurt her feelings
125221111323111222112.content:
November brought colder weather, rains and overcast skies. The two young lovebirds often preferred staying at home over going out. Such as today. Zack and Alice snuggled together on a sofa and chatted, a jungle document on TV providing an ambient background.

“Oh, and guess what, Zackie? Brittany promised me another raise from January so I was thinking about getting a car? For myself?” Alice turned to her boyfriend while her hand cast about for more chips in the huge bowl sitting on both their laps. “Oh, we're out?”

“Really?” Zack licked his lips. “OK, I'll bring some more.”

“No, no, no, don't get up! I'll fetch some tortilla chips. You don't know where I put them, right? And besides,” she dialled her weight back to 0, “it's so much easier for me. I'll just glide to the pantry and get them. And maybe some dips too?”

As she did, Zack's eyes followed her receding back. The stretch pants she wore today were a great hit among her VIP clients (“They're nothing special, just stretch pants with suspensors,” Alice shrugged modestly when she showed them off) and now he admired how his girlfriend was filling them. In fact, wasn't she filling them rather more than usual? Nah, must be a trick of light.

Still, Zack was now alert and when Alice came back with her haul, he watched her. He watched as she bent forward to put the dips on the coffee table and her belly bunched up in several thick rolls, he watched her buttocks jiggle as she turned her back to him before sitting down. Somehow she managed to put on two dozen pounds without him noticing.

Zack knew Alice had her plate full – lectures were in full swing, she had plenty of papers to submit that she worked on long into the night. Add to it all her work for Yeng-Huan… No wonder Alice filled her plates full literally as well, she needed all the energy she could get. Now she took a handful of chips, dipped them in chili sauce and stuffed her mouth full.

Should I say something? Truth be told, Zack had quite enjoyed Alice's old body. He met her at her heaviest, barely waddling around, red in face after moving a couple dozen steps. And yet she was a rolling butterball of cuteness and he'd really enjoyed fondling her plush curves.

On the other hand Zack knew she'd been unhappy with her weight and clumsiness, he knew how hard Alice had worked to slim down, he knew how proud she was of her (no longer current) size when all that suffering finally bore fruit. And he knew how disappointed she would be to find out it was all lost again.

On the other other hand, he would be one to talk. Abercrombie was a place strangely welcoming to excess and his snacks with coworkers were getting to be the size of meals and meals at the Hammond Hotel… suffice it to say that while he hadn't weighed himself for ages, his daily struggle to button his pants meant Zack must have put on a dozen pounds minimum too. Wouldn't it be hypocritical to call her out for his own sin?

“Anyway,” she smiled at his absent-minded expression, “about the car…”

He noticed she was getting a hint of a second chin again. “Huh? Oh, right, the car.” Should I tell her or not?
125221111323111222112.title: Weighty Developments

choices: Over several weeks Alice sees the changes in Marni on her show
Alice forgets about Marni as school starts, but word of the wonder drug spreads
125222.content:
There was Dr. Haun, and then there was Marni with a pill in her hand. It was a yellowish gel cap in a small plastic bag.

“Welcome back, friends,” Marni said, all smiles. “We’re here with Dr. Huan-”

“Brittany,” Dr. Huan corrected.

“Brittany, and she’s about to explain to me what this pill is, and what makes it so revolutionary?”

That last bit came out as a question, a rare moment of uncertainty for the experienced TV host. Clearly she hadn’t known what Dr. Huan was planning to spring on her before inviting her guest out on stage. Alice realized Dr. Huan must be a big deal if Marni would rush to bring her out like that so readily.

“Marni, what you are holding in your hand is the next leap forward in human medicine. This is bigger than penicillin or the polio vaccine, possibly bigger than mapping the human genome. Or perhaps I should say it’s on the same level, as this creation came out of the explosion of knowledge that project provided for us.

“So a few months ago you,” she said this to Marni directly, “had agreed to have your genes examined, yes?” When Marni didn’t reply right away Dr. Huan prompted “It was part of your physical earlier this year. Your doctor took a swab of your mouth to get a DNA sample.”

“Oh yeah! I forgot all about that.”

“Yes, well that swab was passed along to Yeng-Huan’s laboratories, where we broke down your DNA to the chromosomal level, finding out all about Ms. Marni Blake and what makes her tick. Not only could we see how your ancestors have influenced your development, but we were also able to look ahead and project the path of health and well-being you were going down.”

She turned to the audience for this next bit.

“We’ve always been told that health is a simple equation of keeping your weight down and getting a little exercise now and then. But human physiology is so much more complicated than that. I wouldn’t be wrong to say that there are as many paths to health as there are people alive. Each person’s body is unique – with the possible exception of twins, triplets, etc. – and to find the best possible system of diet and activity for each person we need to start at the foundation: your genes.

“Or so we thought, when we started this project. Years ago, as I was finishing up in university, I published a paper on the importance of examining every patient at the genetic level, that the next revolution of medicine would not come from the macro level but the micro. But even I didn’t realize the full potential that cracking the genome would open up for us.

“When we mapped your genes,” she turned back to Marni, “we found you have a propensity for gaining weight-”

“I could have told you that,” Marni joked.

“-but that you also have a natural defense against many of the issues that come with obesity. There’s no record of diabetes or heart conditions in your family’s history, and your blood pressure is well within normal range. The only potential red flags we found were high cholesterol and a less-than-healthy gall bladder.”

Marni blushed a little, but Dr. Huan rushed to get to the next point.

“But both of these are easily treatable through modern medicine. There are prescription drugs for those problems, but they are mass-produced and bring with them a host of their own risks and issues. A year ago the best we could do would be to say ‘Take these and hope things don’t go wrong.’”

“That’s comforting!” Marni said, letting out a hoarse laugh.

“But this is today. Now. And Yeng-Huan has an evolutionary leap for medicine: a pill personally tailored to your genetic disposition, to treat your problems – current and future. That pill you are holding is the Marni Blake wonder drug, created for you and you alone.”

“Just one pill?” Marni said, sensing Dr. Huan was getting carried away with her spiel.

“Just one. Your genes will never change over the course of your life – barring any nuclear warfare, I should say – and so your needs won’t either. That one pill will handle every issue you might have or acquire going forward, providing you a healthy future for the rest of your life despite your size now or where it might go in the future.”

“Where it might go...?”

Dr. Huan chuckled, her belly bouncing up and down in her lap.

“Maybe I should attest to the drug’s efficacy before I ask you to take it.” She turned back to the audience, playing directly to the camera. “I have never been a thin woman. You probably won’t be surprised if you’re looking at me right now. But I’ve never been this big. When I first signed on to do research for the Yeng Corporation, I was close to 400 pounds. Morbidly obese by any standards, and months of long nights and take-out food and no time to hit the gym sent my weight climbing up and up. When we made our breakthrough with the project – we’re calling it the GS-217, but I’m sure marketing will come up with a better name – I was closer to 500 pounds than 400.

“After enough testing and trials we determined the drug was safe for human consumption, and though some might question the ethics of the decision I volunteered myself to be the first human test subject. I took my pill over a year ago, close to a year and a half, and in that time my stats have all entered the range of perfect health. Blood pressure, cholesterol, my immune system, musculature, kidneys, liver, everything! All perfect. Even the issues that had been bothering me like the joint pain in my knees and ankles is gone. I can walk up a couple flights of stairs and only get mildly winded.

“Though I’m not exactly racing up the stairs, as you can imagine!”

Laughter from the audience, but it was obvious there was a lot of shock and disbelief among them.

“And since taking the drug my weight had continued to go up. Today I am here before you weighing over 630 pounds. 638 to be precise. And yet when I received a physical for my insurance last month my doctor, despite all logic and preconceptions about health, gave me a clean bill. He said I was the healthiest patient he had examined all week.”

A smattering of applause. The audience was coming around to her side.

“Any problem I might have had down the road has now been taken care of today, now. It’s almost as if my own genes have been rewritten to give me perfect health regardless of how much more I grow.

“So Marni,” she turned back to the host. “I want to ask you a question, just one fat girl to another: when you no longer have to struggle to walk half a mile, when getting yourself out of bed is not the Herculean task it once was, when your doctor isn’t tsk-tsking or lecturing you about your life choices, don’t you think you might expect a few more pounds to find their way to that plump little body of yours?”

Marni smiled mischievously.

“It’s not like I’ve been getting by on salads and rice cakes until now. But I see your point.”

She held up the pill again, looking at it.

“So there have been successful human trials? I’m not going to be some lab monkey who might grow another head or a third arm?”

“The FDA approved it for human testing last year, so if you’re interested,” Dr. Huan reached into her lab coat and pulled out a small stack of papers, “all you have to do is sign on the last page, and you can take the pill right now.”

Unprompted, a few people in the audience cheered and clapped, urging Marni on. At home in her living room, Alice was getting excited herself. She wasn’t fat anymore, but the memories of her mother’s judgment and society’s scorn in general put her on the side of Dr. Huan. How great would it be if fat people didn’t have to tolerate being chided or ridiculed anymore? How great would it be for people like her sister Mel to not have others criticize them for their lifestyle (not that Mel had any sense of shame or remorse for who she was)?

Marni turned to the audience. She didn’t look hesitant, but she looked like she wanted the encouragement of others before taking the plunge.

“Should I do it?”

Audience-wide applause now, with a few cries of ‘Do it!’

“OK!”

Marni took the papers from Dr. Huan, found the last page, and signed it. Then, with a little flourish for the cameras, she took out the yellow gel cap, held it up to her mouth, and swallowed it.

Applause. Even Alice felt like whooping.

“How long until it works?”

“The changes will be gradual at first, and then snowball. Within a month you should feel completely remade head to toe. And we’ll do some check-ups on you at the Yeng-Huan facilities to chart your progress, so you can see how things are going. Congratulations! This is the start of a new life for you!”

“I already feel wonderful. Let’s hope this drug is everything you say it is, doc.”
125222.title: With One Pill in Hand...

choices: Marni Blake wasn't the only celebrity endorsing the Yeng-Huan Wonder Pill...
Alice's own experience with The Pill were (unfortunately) similarly expansive!
All of Abercrombie seemed to be enthralled with Yeng Huan lately...
1252221.content:
Over the course of the next few weeks, Alice found herself watching a lot more television.

She wasn't really a TV sort of girl. She never had been. Growing up with a restrictive mother and being sent off to a private school without cable helped, but it was more of a natural disinterest. Alice would have much rather have been reading or sewing or (coinciding with her mastery of her sister's old laptop) watching much more condensed methods of entertainment on Youtube. Alice had never really been "into" the whole vegging out on the couch and watching TV thing. It just seemed a little lazy.

That being said, there were new episodes of Marni Blake every weeknight at 4, and Alice had tasted blood.

That story she did with Dr. Huan was just so... so fascinating! Much more so than her usual fare of baby daddies and home drama. Despite her secret want for the intellectual wastelanders that usually frequented Marni's show, Alice couldn't help but find herself stimulated by that black sheep of a story. Marni hadn't done anything like it since, but it had been just enough to reinvigorate the part of Alice that used to rush home after classes and plop down on the couch in time to watch like she'd been doing it her whole life.

Her classes ended at three thirty on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, and the Marni Blake Show didn't start until four. That gave her thirty minutes to rush home, find the remote, and barnacle herself to her sofa for the better part of an hour until Zack got home and she could flick the TV off like she hadn't ever used it. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, when Alice's classes weren't over until five but she had a break at four, she'd watch it in the student life center and read the subtitles. Oh, sure, she'd have her laptop in front of her so it looked like she was doing something, but that was just to make sure nobody suspected her of watching...

Alice would have been lying if she said she wasn't scoping out the effects Dr. Huan's wonder drug. The story had been so strange and unique, almost like she'd dreamt it up. Marni had taken this pill and then, poof, it was over!

But over the course of the following weeks, Alice had noticed some distinctive changes in the already heavyset hostess. They were nothing major, at first. After the first few days, Marni's slow waddling on stage became more brisk, her skin looked a little clearer, and she didn't quite seem so out of breath. She was still sitting in her chair most of the time, but she seemed to have a much easier time navigating her self. To the untrained eye, it would have appeared as if those were signs that Marni was losing weight. But to a more seasoned viewer, like Alice, it was actually just the opposite...

Marni was getting fat.

Like, comparatively fat.

It started out really small. Marni's clothes looked tighter at first. That was all. And Alice had been there, been about that size at one point in her life. It was hard to find clothes that didn't look tight when you were a real butterball! But soon it became obvious that Marni was actually outgrowing her wardrobe. As early as a week after the Yeng Huan interview, Marni's outfits were showing much more skin than normal around the belly. Her gut was causing the hems of her shirts and blouses to ride up ever so slightly...

And then not ever so slightly.

After just a week, Marni was debuting new clothes. She also seemed stronger. She didn't pant as heavily whenever she rose from her chair (which, even then, wasn't often) and her voice was clearer. Not only that, her complexion had cleared up. Not that it was bad before, but she wasn't sweating as much. Her cheeks didn't get quite so blotchy with exertion.

The positive response of having Dr. Huan on the show must have prompted Marni to open up her guests beyond the typical baby daddy drama, because there was a lot more variety of talent making appearances. Sitting beside her, talking about various products or goods they provided. Most of them, surprisingly enough for Marni purists, were chefs looking to catch a break.

It had all started when Marni interviewed this couple--it was part of her "what's weird in bed?" week, if Alice remembered correctly--that talked about mixing food with sex.

"I tell him all the time that he needs to stop. That I can't control myself anymore." said the four hundred pound housewife, sitting comfortably in the Marni-sized seat beside her "I'm gaining so much weight just being with him, but I can't stop myself from eating his amazing cooking!"

"Is your cooking that good?" Marni had asked with a mischevious little twinkle in her hoggish eyes

"It is." said the man, no older than thirty, with a slight shrug, "I mean, I could show you if you don't believe me... I brought a sample plate. You know, to help make my case..."

And he had brought out this whole chocolate cake, just for Marni. She began hesitantly at first but after finding that, apparently, his cooking really was that good, she steamed through the entire cake for a full minute, and was nearing completion by the time the commercial break was over. All while his girlfriend watched, helplessly, as another woman devoured her cake. Her mouth watered, her lips smacking as she panted wantingly as Marni ate, ate, ate herself into contentedness.

By the end of the segment, Marni's belly was full enough to show a sliver of skin between her pants and her blouse.

"Okay girl, you need to loosen up." Marni burped into her hand, "Cause if I had a man who could cook like this, and wanted to feed me this delicious food, I wouldn't have a thing to complain about."

After that, it was just a snowball effect. Audiences liked seeing Marni eat. Marni liked to eat. And once the studio said that it was okay for her to do it on stage (there was never any rule against it, apparently) Marni just took to her new gimmick like a fish to water.

"Mmphm... today we have... mmm..." Marni announced not long after, snacking on some off-brand cookies, "Jim and Lyla who....mm! These are good... who think that... mm... what... what do they think again?"

"Ladies and gentlemen please welcome Marcia Mathers, a very esteemed guest you may recognize from Munching with Marcia, which aired just a few hours ago on this station."

And the results of all this eating, which slowly grew more and more unencumbered, were that Marni was expanding at a phenomenal rate.

No longer hindered by her failing health and unwilling to stand up to her expanding appetite, Marni soon found herself eating every moment she was on the air. From what Alice would see over the coming weeks, there was soon never an episode following the Yeng Huan interview where Marni didn't have something to snack on. Cookies, brownies, sandwiches, chips, anything and (seemingly) everything was fair game for Marni's mouth.

Predictably she started to grow...

and grow...

and grow.

Right before Alice's eyes, Marni seemed to be expanding almost by the day. With her constantly increasing intake, her fat hands nearly always shoveling something into her greedy mouth, everyone's favorite plus-sized tv personality started getting plumper and plumper with every airing. Her belly hung lower, her ass sat wider, and more and more each day her breasts formed a more adequate shelf that sloped in front of her.

To Alice's untrained eye, Marni must have gained eighty pounds after the first month and a half. It was unreal! Even with how much Marni was eating, nobody should have been able to get that fat, that fast.

And it would have been easy enough to ignore the Yeng-Huan wonder pill if it hadn't been bleeding into other areas of Alice's pop media-enveloped life. One woman, however influential she may be, was still just one voice on one talk show. But then there Emily Vaughn, or Evie to her fans. And Alice was a diehard fan.

Everyone who knew Evie knew the story: a promising gorgeous young, blonde Italian actress had been told to gain weight for a role only to find that, afterward, she couldn't get the weight off. In fact, having gained even more weight after the movie had premiered (and flopped), she found herself being ostracized by hiring agencies because she didn't fit the typical "Hollywood look" anymore. It had only taken just her first few "funny fat friend" roles before Evie was sick of the typecasting and had publicly taken arms against Hollywood's misconceptions about beauty standards.

For an overweight and insecure young girl like Alice, it was a powerful message indeed. Alice would silently root for Evie in the news whenever she tackled a beauty industry ideal that had to do with weight. She would listen to Evie's sassy retorts to criticisms about her still-ever-increasing weight and practice saying them later to the mirror, of course never actually to another person. That would be.. super confrontational.

Of course, this was all a few years ago and Emily Vaughn had faded somewhat into obscurity, taking less roles in acting and putting more time into weight acceptance and activism. Alice had grown out of her dreaded "chubby phase" and had slowly begun following Evie's movements less and less. Sure, Alice still remembered Chubbiness and Chastity, a cult-classic chick flick if there ever was one, and had been disappointed to find out the movie hadn't done well enough for a sequel, but Alice's Evie obsession had, over time, faded away. It was like two worlds colliding. About three months in total had passed since Dr. Huan's first appearance on the Marni Blake show and here she was, scheduled to appear again. Alice sat in anticipation, glued to the screen as usual. Especially seeing as there was a lot more to umm, take in this time around.

Marni was big. Like, BIG big. A casual observer might have noticed that the rate she was increasing at was bigger as well. If the first month and a half had yielded around 80 pounds then the second had looked to have added another 120. And the setup of her show had changed. Marni was almost always eating now, camera or no, and to either side of her sat two large tables groaning with the kind of spread that likely could have fed the entire audience. Marni would frequently hop up during the show from her extra-wide seat, seemingly more buoyant than ever, and fill up a plate or two before sitting right back down and continuing with an interview. Even at the start of her own show, Marni was busy tucking in while the overhead announcer went through the usual introductions.

Alice couldn't have been more immersed anyway. There was something about seeing a woman... enjoying herself like that that was so engaging in its own way. Alice hadn't always snacked when she watched The Marni Blake Show, but as of late, she hadn't been able to help herself. It was just another guilty pleasure to enhance the one she was already hooked on, no big life change or anything, she reasoned. And, other than the near-constant eating by the show host and, very frequently, her guests, the format hadn't changed too drastically.

"You guys remember just three months ago we had a very important scientist on our show with a huge, and I mean huge, medical breakthrough just waiting to hit the markets," Marni began. Or rather, the pre-recorded Marni on the large screen behind her did. It was another change Marni had made to the show: prerecorded guest introductions would play for the audience and the viewers at home while Marni used the precious few extra minutes to keep on filling her face. "Well, friends," the recorded Marni continued after quickly chewing and swallowing another bite of a muffin she had been eating even as her team had done the recording that morning, "she's back and with better news than ever- can we-gulp-please welcome everyone's favorite doctor, Dr Brittany Huan!" More whooping and clapping as Dr Huan slowly made her way out onto the stage. As the video Marni faded to black, Real Marni was lightly dabbing excess crumbs from her cheeks and stood up, finally ready to actually talk on umm, her own talk show. Not that she needed to hurry herself at all, wonder pill or no, the good doctor still needed a good amount of time to waddle her way over to the center of the stage.

Alice whistled in amazement. Dr Huan certainly hadn't been doing any slacking since her last show appearance. On the contrary, she looked to have put on even more weight than Marni had. And considering just how big Dr Huan had already been compared to Marni to begin with...

Brittany had gotten truly massive. Her belly, as always, led the way for her as she waddled, ever so ponderously, to an extra, extra-wide divan to Marni's left. It was a spectacle, truly, the size of that thing. It somehow stuck down and out at the same time, drooping far past her knees and jiggling in time with her heavy, quaking footsteps. It still split into two mighty rolls, the upper of the two already larger than a truck tire. Her legs- the sheer width of them- were so bulky that they were almost impossible to move over each other; Dr. Huan was forced into a very wide stance as she inched one foot awkwardly in front of the other, her flabby, jiggling arms held out slightly for balance as she lumbered towards her destination in an awkwardly slow shuffle that left the audience with nothing else to do but drag out the applause while they waited.

And still... Dr Huan somehow seemed just as content as ever. She was still not the slightest bit out of breath, she wasn't sweating, Hell, just that fact that she could even walk so casually at her size... Clearly, walking for Dr Huan was taxing, but still not necessarily tiring.

She still smiled and waved to the audience as normal before setting herself down heavily in her seat. Even sitting, Alice could tell she was much, much fatter. Her legs were parted wide at what was practically a 55 degree angle in order to allow that surging, slumping belly enough space to occupy the entirety of her lap, and quite a bit more space on top of that. Dr. Huan's absurdly fat stomach stuck out a few inches past her knees and sagged heavily in between them. She folded her hands curtly atop her massive tummy and, once the applause had died down, began speaking.

"It's fantastic to be sitting here back on my favorite show, Marni!" she started.

"Ooh it's official, people!" Marni squealed, mouth not preoccupied with chewing for once, "we're Brittany Huan's favorite show!"

Light applause and a smattering of laughter from the audience.

"When I came here last, I was understandably met with quite a bit of skepticism about whether or not my "miracle pill" could really counteract the negative health effects of extreme obesity in the human body." Dr Huan continued. "A lot of people just couldn't believe it when I claimed that my physician gave me a clean bill of health, or that there was simply no way the human body could maintain extended mobility at 638 pounds. Well," she added, arduously getting to her feet, but still standing under her own power nonetheless, "I'm here to tell you that I'm almost 240 pounds heavier and still moving entirely under my own power!" she beamed, giving the top of her mighty midsection a firm pat.

At this, the audience let out a thunderous applause. Brittany smiled again before sitting back down with a WHUMP that was loud enough to be picked up on the mic.

"Do you hear that?" Marni turned, addressing the audience now. "We have a scientist so sure of her product that she intentionally gained almost 240 pounds just to silence the haters!"

"Umm... yes, well, it wasn't exactly intentional," Brittany admitted with a bit of an embarrassed smile, "but your point still stands, I'm fitter and stronger than ever- trust me, I'd have to be to carry around all of this," she said, patting her huge belly again.

More hearty laughter from the audience. They were hooked at this point.

"But, to be fair, maybe the word of just one woman isn't quite enough." she continued.

"Well, you certainly have my support," Marni chimed in. More audience applause. "But I know what you're saying."

"And that's why I'm proud to announce our new public spokesperson! She's not only a strong advocate for GS-216 research but a personal client as well!"

"Yes!" Marni stood up, ready to make yet another introduction. "Plenty of you guys know her for films such as Tight Squeezes, No Space Between Us and, my personal favorite, Chubbiness and Chastity!" Alice's ears perked up. "Please have a warm welcome for our next guest: actress, former model and current activist, Emily Vaughn!

Now Alice was engaged. She hadn't seen Evie in years. She certainly hadn't kept up with what Emily had been doing... or how much she had been growing.

The former star-studded actress known as Emily Vaughn walked, or rather waddled on stage much in the same fashion Brittany had moments earlier. Alice could hardly believe hers eyes. Sitting now adjacent to a near-880 pound Brittany was...

As amazing and wonderful and awe-inspiring as a miracle cure like the Yeng-Huan pill promised to be, it paled in comparison to the demands of actual college.

Not to knock Daven’s Port Community College or anything, but ASU was a real step up. Alice had never had to work so hard to stay caught up with her classes, and she went to one of the most prestigious schools in America. The professors here were crazy, and they all expected her to treat their class like it was her number one priority! What’s that? She wanted to go out and do something with Zack? Nope—she had the History of American Fashion to brush up on. Want to go hang with some classmates? Better be a study session, ‘cuz she had a Fashion Design course that required her to know why everything looked the way it did. Grab a bite to eat? Nope—Biology!

So, forgive her if she fell a little slack on the press. Buzzfeed was atwitter about Dr. Huan’s miracle cure, and it had been making rounds in social media, but who had the time to glance through Facebook when there were papers to write?

In fact, if it hadn’t come up in Mrs. Wallace’s English course (why did she even need English? She was a Fashion Design major!) Alice would have forgotten all about it.

Dr. Haun’s miracle pill had become something of a controversy, on campus and in the rest of the country it seemed. Most were skeptical of her claims, citing the fact that it made its debut on daytime television of all things and Dr. Huan’s controversial theories regarding body mass and excess weight in general. However there was (apparently) a rather vocal and growing faction that took the opposite stance; one that saw the Yeng-Huan pill as a scientific breakthrough and hailed Dr. Huan as a medical messiah. Not only had she managed to map the human genome, she was planning on curing any ailments through her research, and making it available to the general public! If her hypothesis were correct (and so far, they were purportedly so) Dr. Huan’s research could very well change the world!

And then there was Alice, just struggling to keep up in Biology.

College was so friggin’ hard, she didn’t have time for any of this other extraneous stuff! Sure there were miracle pills and lots of speculation/accusations getting thrown around, but Alice needed to focus on surviving her first semester at ASU before she could worry about any hot-button political-slash-scientific issues…

Maybe this would all be resolved by Winter Break? Then she could catch up…



Because, as she stood right now, Alice had much more pressing matters to worry about. She was doing splendidly in her GenEd courses. She’d covered most of the material during her days at Buttercombe, and filled in the gaps at DPCC. But, for all her fervor for fashion, she was floundering in the higher leveled courses pertaining to her field of interest. There was a difference between being able to sew and being able to tell the professor why it should be sewed a certain way and who made the technique and what kind of material should be used… it was exhausting!

Which was why Alice had asked for a little help.

It wasn’t like Zack could help her study—Alice needed to pass these classes! So she’d been asking around campus for a tutor that could help her pass these stupid design courses, or at least help put her on the right track. She’d already flunked an exam (luckily her professor dropped the lowest test grade, but still!) and that meant she needed an A on this midterm.

Luckily for her, she’d found someone in her class who was willing to help her—free of charge!

As she sat in the cafeteria, her notebooks open, Alice awaited the arrival of her tutor.

While she had maintained a neutral standing in this whole Yeng-Huan debacle, her tutor certainly hadn’t. Alice really hoped that they could actually study and not have literature or facts or statistics shoved down her throat… the non-academic sort of those things, anyway.

Because her tutor was…

“Let’s give a big Marni Blake welcome to Ken Glen, the fattest man alive, coming to us live from Abercrombie!”

Alice almost choked on the soda she was drinking. Abercrombie? The world’s fattest man lived in her own city? What were the odds of that?

On a giant screen set up to the side of Marni’s stage a man fatter than anyone Alice had ever seen – and she had experience being in the realm of fat people – came on. During the interview the feed cut between two camera angles; one a close-up of the man’s face, his chins running all the way down to the bottom of the screen and below it, and the other a diagonal angle from the front, taking in all of the man’s ginormous belly and giving a good idea of how big his sides and butt were.

Alice couldn’t tell if he was sitting on a bench or resting on a bed, his own fat filled so much of the screen even with the camera pulled back. And it wasn’t even a complete picture. Alice was certain his belly must have hit the floor and piled up on top of it, but she couldn’t see because the screen cut off at where his knees must have been. She could see the reason for two cameras; the one further back was too far back to make out his head properly. It looked like a small ball of flesh and hair atop the mountain of fat that was his body.

“Mr. Glen, thank you for joining us.”

“Call me Ken, Marni, and let me say it’s a pleasure to be here. Yours is the only show I’ll do.”

“Oh, stop,” Marni waved him off.

“I mean it. It’s so rare to find a woman with the strength of character to own who she is, not apologizing for not fitting into the supposed ideal body type.”

He wasn’t panting with exhaustion just from speaking, he didn’t look tired or struggling to breathe. Contrary to all of Alice’s ideas about how how fat was too fat, Ken looked as comfortable and at ease as anyone. Dressed in a sail-sized polo shirt and khakis, he looked no different than a suburban father enjoying a lazy Saturday; aside from the excessive fat, that is.

He was certainly leagues above the usual trailer trash Marni had on her show. Put him on radio, where people could only hear his voice and not see the elephant of a man he was, and he could probably host a talk show of his own.

“Since you put it that way, why don’t we get right to the big question (pun intended): what’s it like being the fattest man alive?”

“Well, to be frank I never thought about myself as the bigGEST until Guinness weighed me and announced it to the world. Until a month ago I was just Ken. Software programmer, loving boyfriend, a pretty good trivia player at the local pub. There was never a point in my life where I wasn’t skinny, but aside from a lot of jokes at my expense growing up – and what can you do about kids, really – I’ve always been comfortable with my size.

“Though my size has never leveled off, so perhaps I should say I’ve always been comfortable being fat and then fatter. People who know me for at least a few months get used to my size, and they might be surprised when I mention reaching another hundred pound milestone but by that point they already know I’m a big guy and a big eater, so they’re used to it.”

“Nobody gets on your case about your size? Not your doctor or your boss?”

“My boss, never. He knows what a dedicated worker I am, and since I started working from home he says my productivity has only gone up. So if constant eating and being the size of a Volkswagen means I’m finishing projects a week before deadline and under cost, it’s a wonder he hasn’t given me a bonus just to cover grocery expenses.”

He laughed at this, his entire body quaking and shaking.

“But my doctor... not so much. He stopped his finger-wagging a few years ago, but I think it’s just him giving up on getting through to me. My physicals are always good, no medical issues because of my size, so he doesn’t have any cards to play besides general fearmongering.”

“You said you’re still growing. Is there a medical cause behind your size, or...?”

“Unless overeating is a medical condition, no. This is all me. When I was young my mother always gave me treats, maybe too many, and as I got older I got in the habit of filling my belly whenever I was hungry. I just enjoy eating, and being fat doesn’t bother me so I never felt the need to diet and drop all this.”

“How does it feel, being so huge?”

“Honestly? Pretty damn good. My body is constantly rubbing against itself in a thousand different places, the physical stimuli flaring up every time I move or just shift my weight. Plus there’s something about having so much... presence. Standing out anywhere I go, the attention people give me. I’ve never felt embarrassed about this; if anything I thrive on the looks other people give me.”

He looked so confident, almost proud. Alice was reminded of her sister, Mel, an almost aggressive fatty. She was probably watching this right now; what did she think of Ken?

“Maybe this is the question everyone wants the answer to more than any: exactly how much do you weigh?”

“Now that I can’t give a solid answer to. When Guinness weighed me it was 3,258 pounds,” he paused as he was interrupted by spontaneous applause from the audience, “but to celebrate the announcement that I held a world record Babs – that’s my girlfriend, Barbara – and I took a trip to Las Vegas and, well, there are a few buffets where I can’t show my face anymore.”

Laughs from the audience and a few chuckles from Marni. This guy wasn’t a professional comedian, but he knew a little about working a crowd.

“Then how about this: any plans for the future? I don’t know if anyone is going to challenge you for your title anytime soon, but what are you doing to hold onto it?”

“I’m just being me. It’s what got me here in the first place, and as long as I keep stuffing my belly and gaining more I should be the champion for a good long while. Plus, I’m getting a lot of help from the neighborhood.”

“Oh, really?”

“Yeah, there’s quite a few people here in Abercrombie that are taking pride in my title. Mostly restaurants and eateries. They might not be thrilled with how much work I drop on their kitchen staff, but they love the publicity and media attention I’ve brought them. But there’s also some fashion designers in town that cater to the plus-sized crowd, and again, I’m bringing them great publicity. I’m not the only biggun here in Abercrombie!”

Alice’s ears perked up. Plus-sized fashion designers, here in Abercrombie?

“It sounds like you’re going to be king of the hill – or should I say mountain – for a good long while, Ken. Enjoy your reign.”

“Thanks, Marni. Love the show.”

As Marni directed the show to commercial, Alice’s thoughts were drifting away from the TV. Memories of frustration with finding fashionable outfits when she had been bigger were coming back to her. Thoughts of Mel or her friends from Buttercombe who hadn’t dropped their own fat, making due with what meager offerings in plus-sized fashion there were.

She didn’t need a better diversity of choices, but Alice hadn’t forgotten what it was like being a big girl and the needs (and frustrations) that came with it. So hearing that there were designers in her own town focused on that piqued Alice’s curiosity.

It wasn’t exactly heralded by angels with trumpets coming down from on high, but Alice felt she had found her mission in life.
