It had been two weeks since they had moved to Abercrombie, and most of it had been spent exploring the new town that they found themselves in. Eating out, seeing the sights, going on little romantic excursions to this place or that, it had been nice! And today was going to be no exception. Zack still had a few vacation days to play around with, and Alice wouldn't start school for another week or so, and that meant that they had at least a few more days of puppy-love before reality tore them in their respective directions.

Zack was the first to undress, kicking off his pajama pants and tearing off the baggy white t-shirt he had slept in, revealing his nudity for all to see. He was a solidly built boy, with a naturally athletic figure that, though underdeveloped due to his desk job, still afforded him a lean figure and slight tone. His soft blonde hair was tussled and tossed, even as he poked his head through the neckhole of the t-shirt he had laid out before his shower.

Alice stole some appreciative glances, but was more or less slow to unravel herself from her towel. Before she undid her makeshift garment, Alice made sure to step into her panties and pull them up around her waist. Then she stepped into their closet, grabbed a bra, and fastened it before quickly hurrying herself into a flowy white top. Letting her long, mostly-dry hair fall down to her shoulders in fluffy blonde locks, Alice practically jumped into a pair of jeans.

They were quite comfortable with one another--they'd been dating for over three years now. And they'd seen each other through their respective "chubby phases", so it wasn't like they weren't comfortable with one another.

It was just... weird.

Maybe because they lived together?

Neither of them knew quite sure why.

Hopefully it would wear off, Zack told himself as he turned to sneak a glance at his girlfriend's pert round butt filling out the seat of her jeans.

As soon as Zack buttoned his pants, Alice opened the bedroom door.

Today was the day, after all...

132.content:
So the hardest part about moving was probably going to be getting to know everybody.

And that was to be expected. Zack had come from a big family, and was raised in a big city where he knew almost everyone. Even when someone new moved to town, he was always the one showing them around, never the other way around. And Alice had come fresh out of an Academy where she knew almost everyone within a two-year radius. By the time she had become a senior, Freshmen were actively looking to her for advice on what to do and where to go—neither of them had been fish out of water for a very long time.

Which was why Alice felt, and Zack agreed, that it was important that they get to know people in this new town. Not only as individuals, but as a couple.

Before either of them really got started with this whole "life in Abercrombie" thing, it would be a pretty good idea for them to get a fresh start. Make some new friends, build some familiarity with the people around them.

As a businessman now, it would be important for Zack to need to network anyway (was that the right word, network?) and Alice would need to know everything there is to know about Abercrombie if she ever wanted to find good venues to debut her designs. It seemed only natural that they would start exploring on a more social level than they had been in the past week or so.

And they were going to start right here, in their apartment complex.

"I don't know babe, aren't we a little... old to have a playdate?"

"Shut up." Alice giggled as she gave him a little punch in the arm, "They invited us over like, last week. We said we wanted to make friends... well, this is how you make friends!"

The couple in 21C, right down the hall from them, had actually been the first people besides the movers to speak to them in Abercombie. They had been moving their stuff down the hall, and they poked their heads out to offer a hand. Even though they said they were fine, they were still nice enough to offer Zack and Alice over one day, to help them get situated.

That had been a week ago, and it wasn't like they were doing anything else before their respective responsibilities kicked in. Alice had made sure their offer was still open last night as she passed one of them in the hallway, and they said to come on over...

"What were their names again?"

"I think the guy's name was Seth." Alice whispered, "And... Tess? I want to say his girlfriend's name is Tess."

"Last name?"

"I don't know!" Alice couldn't hold back a giggle as Zack cracked a smile, "Stop being dumb."

"You're dumb."

Seth and Tess were two self-described "sorta-kinda-okay neighbors". They were about Zack and Alice's age, and were in a pretty similar situation. They were young, a couple, and taking the steps towards moving towards bigger and better things... why shouldn't they hang out together?

Alice gave the door a little knock.

"It's open!" came a voice from inside, "Come on in guys, we were just getting started on lunch!"

Zack and Alice looked at one another, steeling themselves.

"You got this?" Alice asked her at-times-awkward boyfriend

"Got it." Zack nodded with a playful intensity, "You good?"

"I'm good." Alice smiled, "Let's go."

"Let's go make some friends!"

They high-fived each other and opened the door.

Seth and Tess were...

1321.content:
"Hiya! Welcome to the neighborhood!" cheered the couple at the door. Alice and Zach were a little surprised by who was there, with their neighbors not looking like what they thought they would. Tess was very short, probably standing at about 5'2 at the tallest with flaming red curly hair and very pale skin. Seth towered over his girlfriend (which wasn't hard to do) with dark hair and almond eyes. They looked so mismatched yet paired perfectly at the same time, but there was something about their appearances that seemed off and it wasn't until they came inside and sat down on the couch that it became evident what it was.

Tess and Seth were quite the conversationalists, talking enough that they didn't notice when Alice and Zach barely said anything and just kind of stared at them. They may not have were it not for the fact that evidence of Seth and Tess having gained the freshman 15 just became clear. When standing up you couldn't really tell, but when the pair sat down the pounds showed up. Seth's stomach surged forward upon sitting down, almost flopping out into his lap, like the beer belly of someone who had been drinking for many years (had he been sucking it in before Zach wondered). Tess's sides seemed to pool over the waistband of her pants, giving her a large muffin top while seated. Alice and Zach were shocked that this came off of the people who when they stepped in the door seemed so thin and trim.

"... and we just finally got the pictures from our friends who's a photographer in town from the day we moved in a couple weeks ago. We didn't even know he had been taking any, it was such a nice housewarming gift to get! Here, don't we look precious?!" Tess flashed her phone to the couple sitting opposite of them, which surprised them more because it was a seated picture of the students across from them (in almost the exact same pose) but with no extra weight showing on any of them.

"Aw, you two look great there! This friend must be a great photographer, especially since they say the camera adds ten pounds to a person," Alice commented, trying to subtlety find out how they could look so thin there but so much bigger here in person.

"Well you could still say that, I swear since those photos were taken two weeks ago I've gained at least 15 pounds! I mean there's no way that's actually possible but it sure looks it, not that I'm about to do anything about it. I hate working out, so it was only a matter of time before this happened" Seth replied, shaking his small yet prominent gut to add emphasis.

"I swear, there must be something in the water here! I've always been thin as a rail but since moving here I just keep feeling more padded than before. But at least we're not nearly the size of most of the locals here, those people are HUGE," Tess added in agreement. "I don't know what you two are planning to do here or how long you plan to be here, but I recommend getting pictures together now before you wind up... well, before you wind up like the locals," she laughed as she mocked the townie's sizes.

"Oh, we've both put in a lot of work to get to this point, we're not going to let ourselves turn out like them," Zach replied, reminding himself of all the work he and Alice had put in to lose the weight they had gained during their high school years. Alice nodded in agreement.

"Good for you two! Now, let's get us some dinner, I'm starving!" Seth exclaimed. The two couples then got up and went to the dining room, where Tess and Seth had covered the table in all kinds of takeout food from around the city.

They want to lecture us about not becoming like the locals, they had better watch themselves, thought the new couple as they sat down to eat with their new neighbors.

13211.content:
"Alice, hurry up! We don't want to be late to Seth and Tess's party, especially since we're so close."


"Zach, can you help me zip up the rest of this dress? I can't seem to reach the zipper," Alice called out from the bathroom. Zach did a short jog from their living room to their bedroom to go help his girlfriend finish getting ready, wheezing a little bit as he made the short jog (something felt really off, but he couldn't figure out what). While the party at Seth and Tess's wasn't a fancy party, Alice being the fashionista she is decided to wear a casual dress she had been working on for one of her classes at the college. However, as Zach observed when he tried to get the zipper to meet and go up, she may not have done her measurements correctly.

"Honey, I don't think you got your measurements correct, I can't even get the zipper to meet in the back," he told her. He could see her scrunch up her nose in the mirror, the look she always gets when she's trying to solve a problem.

"No, I did it right. It was fine when I tried it on last week," Alice replied. "Maybe if I suck it in it'll work?" Zach tried the zipper again and still got nothing.

"Nope, still the same result." Alice sighed and stopped trying to suck in her stomach... wait, when did that get there, Zach said in his head. He hadn't noticed until now the bulge that was at present keeping Alice's dress tightly on her body despite it not being zipped up. He could even see the indent from her naval through the dress it was tight enough on her. It looked as if, much like their neighbors, she had gained some college weight, and by the look on her face she hadn't realized that until now either.

"Zach, I think we've both gotten a bit lazy with our diets, I think we need to try to eat healthier more now. I mean look at us, we've both gained weight in just 2 weeks of being here!" Alice exclaimed. Zach looked at her confused. "Don't tell me you haven't noticed this development in your gut," she scolded as she stuck a finger into his stomach, which shocked him with how far in it sunk. He hadn't noticed his stomach until then, and then noticed too how his shirt clung tightly to his body (and not in a good way).

"You're right, we need to stop this. I swear, I've just been too tired lately to go to the gym after work! I don't know why all the sudden that's how I've been, I've never had that problem before," Zach said with a slightly despondent tone.

"Me too, I have no idea why I just haven't been able to get motivated enough to go," Alice replied. "But there's nothing we can do about that now, let me go change so we can get to the party." She quickly walked away, and as she walked Zach noticed a slight jiggle in her body that he hadn't seen in a while from her. She changed into a pair of leggings and a cute tunic instead of the dress (though this new outfit still clung more tightly to her new curve than it used to) and they walked down the hall to go to the party, with Zach finally realizing what had felt off when he was jogging to the bathroom earlier: his stomach bounced now too, and the wheezing was because he had gotten so out of shape so quickly.

They walked right into Seth and Tess's place, not needing to knock since the door was wide open and people were bustling about in their apartment. They started looking around for their hosts, not seeing them anywhere but noticing a lot of large bodies in the apartment. There wasn't a single person who didn't look at least chubby, most of them bordering on overweight or downright fat. As Zach and Alice made their way to the kitchen they continued to bump into wide hips and round bellies, all of whom seemed unaccustomed to the sensation. They finally spotted the couple in the kitchen talking to another couple, but their hosts blended in better than anticipated.

It seemed that in the two weeks Zach and Alice had lived in Abercrombie their neighbors had practically ballooned, with the beer gut Seth once had now looking more like a 25 week pregnant belly. His whole body really looked softer, with his arms being tightly packed into his t-shirt and his softened chest noticeable through the shirt as well. And Tess, whose short stature showed her weight more in the first place, looked even bigger, with her hips flaring out significantly and her thighs touching all the way down to her knees, looking fairly chaffed from rubbing together in areas not covered by her shorts. Her face was even rounding out with her cheeks now constantly looking as if she had something in her mouth (which, in all fairness, she usually did). The couple standing next to them were even larger, probably outweighing their friends by at least 100 pounds.

"Hi, so glad you two could make it! Let me introduce you to Maria and Darren, they were the first ones to welcome us to town just like we were the first to welcome you! Darren's also at the college while Maria runs a restaurant downtown!" Tess excitedly babbled. Maria and Darren conversed for a couple minutes with Zach and Alice then left the party. Zach and Alice stayed in the kitchen for the time being, not super comfortable socializing with so many people they didn't know. After a little while Tess came and dragged Alice away to join a group of the women chatting in a corner, leaving Zach with Seth and a group of guys.

"Alice, I see you and Zach have really taken to the town," one of the women said to her. She nodded.

"I mean I really like the college and there are definitely some cute shops downtown, but I'm still getting to know the place," she replied. The women all laughed.

"No, when I say 'taken to the town' I mean you're starting to be shaped like the rest of us! I didn't think I ever would when I moved here a year ago but the weight started piling on immediately and I just couldn't bring myself to do anything about it. Everyone else seemed unbothered by it so why should I have let it bother me, am I right?" said one of the women. The rest nodded.

"I swear, it must be something in the water! Seth and I have only been here a month and we've both already put on 40 pounds and neither of us seems to be able to do anything about it, not that we've really tried..." Tess trailed off. Alice raised her eyebrow, concerned about what would happen to her and Zach after too long here.

Zach was having a similar discussion with the guys. When he and Seth walked over to the group of men they didn't do a traditional greeting, they belly bumped him instead, something he found quite odd. One of the biggest guys noticed the quizzical look on his face.

"Dude, some people here are so large they can barely lift their arms or their arms can't reach past their stomach, belly bumping is a much easier greeting! Plus, it's way more fun, although your belly isn't quite yet large enough to appreciate it, but give it another month or so and then you'll see," the man said. Zach dropped his jaw, that seemed absurd! Not just the whole concept of the belly bump, but also that he'll soon be large enough to understand it.

"Trust me, it takes no time to put on weight in this town. I moved here a year and a half ago a super slim 150, now I'm bordering 400 on a good day!" the gut laughed and the rest of the guys chuckled too.

"Yeah man, I mean you met me two weeks ago and I was not nearly this big! I put on 40 pounds this past month, and it looks like you're on track to do the same. It takes some adjusting and learning how to move at the larger size, but it's actually pretty freeing to not worry about what you put into your body and just let nature do what it does. Now, you have to join our fantasy football league…" Seth continued going on about fantasy football with the guys, eventually roping Zach into their league. But Zach couldn't get past the idea of everyone seeming to gain so much weight upon arrival... it all seemed too odd, yet he didn't know what to do about it.

13222.content:
Seth and Tess looked to have 600 pounds apiece, over half a ton of young flab sharing an apartment no bigger than Alice and Zack’s. Over the course of the lunch and chit-chat afterwards they would see that the two were well-versed in navigating the ‘economic’ apartment (‘We like to think of it as ‘intimate,’’ Tess said later, prompting a Gomez Addams-type leer from Seth) without colliding into something. Zack noticed there weren’t any end tables or bookshelves or whatever else could be casually knocked over. Everything was put up on shelves running along all the walls, kept at shoulder-height at a minimum.

Obviously the two had not been transformed overnight. Not that Zack thought the Freshman 15 ever went so overboard as to be a Freshman 450.

As comforting, in an odd way, as meeting with two out-and-out fatties was, there was still an awkward period of getting past that initial shock and seeing Seth and Tess as Seth and Tess and not two blimps of blubber. It was hard to look at their face or follow their hands as they gesticulated when said face or hands were lost behind bellies bigger than a beanbag or when Tess, sitting across from Seth at the table and thus around the corner of both Alice and Zack, was resting on a butt big enough to double as a loveseat.

Tess, a natural brunette, was a pear. That was the first thing Alice and Zack noticed. They couldn’t help it. When they had walked into the apartment’s tiny foyer and turned towards the kitchen, they had seen her bent over in front of the stove, her rear rising so high and so far back it was brushing against the fridge on the opposite side of the room. Her hips expanded so wide they masked the oven and part of the cabinets on either side.

Not that the rest of her was given the shaft. Her breasts – great gelatinous mounds that jiggled at the slightest provocation – exceeded any department store’s underwear section. Bras had to be specially made for her, and today it looked like she was going without. And her belly, tiny as it was compared to the rest of her, still bulged out like a gravid womb, rolling over the waist band of her skirt.

Seth was mostly belly, but he had so much middle that after a couple attempts Zack and Alice realized they couldn’t just walk around him in the hallways of the apartment, or outside the apartment either. His belly was too big for him to wrap his arms around, falling past the middle of thighs and looking perpetually stuffed (which, Zack later mused, it might be). Every part of him was a collection of rolls and bulges, but his belly was like a solid sphere for fat leading him around everywhere.

Probably in search of more food, if his performance at lunch was any indication of his appetite. The spread laid out on the table was a feast, the kind of meal that made Alice and Zack flashback to the heftier part of their life. And not necessarily in a bad way.

There was a giant bowl of lobster bisque, a single crab cake the size of a cake, cheddar biscuits overflowing a basket, lobster rolls, fried calamari strips, mashed potatoes with sour cream and chives, steamed carrots drowning in butter, French fries seasoned in garlic salt and for dessert pieces of tiramisu as big as bricks.

Alice and Zack spent all of five seconds fighting the urge to pig out, an effort that fell away as Seth and Tess dove in. Filling their plates until they almost spilled onto the table, the two Abercrombie natives greedily claimed massive portions of every dish for themselves and began chowing down. They went at it with such gusto that you could see their bodies shaking and quivering as they scooped food to their mouths and they chewed furiously.

They weren’t out and out pigs, but it was clear from their excitement that these two didn’t come by their size by happenstance. They had done this to themselves, and they felt no regret about it.

Well, Alice said silently as she looked across the table to Zack and shrugged, when in Rome.

Taking the lead of their hosts, the two newcomers filled their own plates, taking as much as they thought they wanted. One bite was all it took to get them hooked; for Alice it was the crab cake (she had cut off a sizable piece) and for Zack it was the lobster rolls. Both were so delicious it was almost surprising. They both knew how good food could taste, but they hadn’t expected anything like this from a simple get-together. This was almost gourmet-level cuisine.

If this was what Seth and Tess ate normally, no wonder they were so large.

The first course went into seconds, Seth and Tess leading the way as they refilled their plates to the threat of spillage and Alice and Zack following suit later. They didn’t eat as fast or as much as their hosts, but the two had both decided to let loose this one time and enjoy the food to the fullest. So they went into seconds, thirds, and then fourths.

The final course was a dish-cleaning exercise, as everyone took the final portions of whatever dish they fancied and cleaned it out. Zack grabbed the last two lobster rolls and the last few cheddar biscuits, while Alice finished off the mashed potatoes and calamari. Seth pulled the remainder of the crab cake (a full third of it was left) onto his plate, and Tess picked up the bowl of lobster bisque and drank straight from it to finish it off.

At the end Alice and Zack were almost in pain, their bellies swollen uncomfortably, but Seth and Tess looked like they were thinking about ordering a pizza.

“Oof,” Alice moaned. Her duties as a guest pushed through her food-hazed mind. “Thank you for the food. That was...” she trailed off.

“It was outstanding,” Zack finished. “Are either of you guys a cook?”

“Not professionally,” Seth said. “But I’ve taken a few culinary courses at school, and Tess has always known her way around the kitchen.”

“Well I’m impressed,” Alice said. “I couldn’t help myself, that was all too good.”

“Yeah,” Zack added. “I thought this was just a normal get-together. I wasn’t expecting you guys to go all out.”

Seth chuckled, his eyes meeting Tess’ as she smiled coyly.

132221.content:
"Go all out?" Seth said again, as if they'd told a funny joke, "Clearly you're new to Abercrombie!"

"That was normal for us!" Tess added lightheartedly, her great chest and meaty stomach wobbling as she laughed.

As the two Abercrombians chuckled to themselves, the transplanted couple in the room felt themselves grow faint. This was normal for them? Sure that explained their size, Alice thought to herself, but how could eating that much be an everyday occurrence for them? Surely, Zack paled at the thought, they were exaggerating. They definitely ate well, judging by their respective and collective rotundity, but eating all that more than once a week? Once a month? There was no way!

Seemingly oblivious, even as Alice's heart dropped and Zack's stomach turned, the other couple continued on in conversation without much of a second thought. There hadn't been much of it while everyone had been stuffing their faces, so perhaps they felt obligated to make small-talk while Alice and Zack picked themselves off the floor.

"I'm glad you liked it." Tess said finally, her three chins flexing and rolling as she spoke, "Seth and I eat in all the time."

"You kind've have to when you're in college, am I right?" Seth seemed to miss the irony in a man of his size preaching about moderation, even as he stroked the great swell of his beanbag-sized belly "It's just so expensive when we go out; y'know?"

"But we always make plenty." Tess quickly added, taking a sip from her glass, "You guys are more than welcome to join us any time you'd like!"

There was no question as to whether or not Tess meant it, and it was sweet to offer. But all Zack and Alice could do was look at each other like Tess had just stomped on all of their toes with her every one of her hippy pounds. They were both so full, neither was honestly comfortable even thinking about eating, ever again! But here these two were, chatting it up politely and talking about dinner down the road!

"Th-Thank you." Alice's cordiality won out over her initial shock as she cradled her swollen stomach, "I, um... We appreciate the offer."

"But we're both usually super busy." Zack burped, "I mean with work—"

"—A-And with school!" Alice nodded appreciatively of Zack's quick thinking, "Sometimes we both just forget to eat!"

At this, their host couple made a collective face. Not anything ugly, or that they had said something that offended them somehow. It was more like Alice had just suddenly started speaking Chinese halfway through her sentence. "Forgetting to eat" was clearly a foreign concept in this household, as evidenced by Seth and Tess' floor-bending figures.

"Well you better get rid of that attitude real quick!" Seth said with a belly-laugh, his jowls quivering jovially, "There's all kinds of awesome places to eat—especially around campus! You're at ASU, right?"

Alice gulped as she envisioned all the awful temptations that she was going to have to face if she ever wanted to maintain her figure.

"Oh there's this neat little sub shop that opened up right off the exit!" Tess interjected excitedly, gesticulating with her calf-sized arms behind her pumpkin-sized melons, "We should totally take you guys!"

"N-Now?" Zack asked nervously

"Easy there guy, I was talking about when school starts up!" Seth snorted, leaning over ever so slightly to resituate himself in his seat, the curve of his belly dipping against Zack's knee, "But hey, if you're up for it, there's a great pizza place that we haven't scared off yet."

Now it was Zack's turn to pale, rather green, as he imagined eating just one slice of pizza, and piling it on top of what he'd already shoveled down.

"Thank you... a lot... buuuuut I really think we should get going." Alice rocked herself to a standing position with a grunt, "It's getting late and, uh... Zack's got work in the morning."

"I do." Zack nodded eagerly as his girlfriend helped heave him up, "Y'know, early bird. Worms."

And it was late, or at least getting there. Zack and Alice had almost quite literally eaten the time away dining with Seth and Tess. For what it was worth, Zack really did have to get to work in the morning. Sure Alice didn't exactly have an excuse, but it was just easier to piggyback on her boyfriend. They were a couple, right? It was okay to leave together. Especially when they were feeling more full than they had in months... maybe years, and their hosts were talking very casually about finding even more food to eat!

"Well maybe we'll see you around!" Seth said with a friendly smile, "You work for that hotel in town, right?"

"Uh... yeah!" Zack stalled, smiling in a way that he hoped was friendly, "The Hammond. Why?"

"There's an awesome little bookshop in downtown. Great coffee." His smile was much more genuine, "If you're not busy tomorrow, you want to grab lunch?"

Oh god, there he went again talking about more food. Zack had to practically button his mouth shut. Any more talk about anything gastronomical was bound to make him either toss his cookies or pop like an overstuffed tick.

"We'll, uh... we'll see." Zack said with a nod, "Thanks again for dinner guys."

"It was great." Alice wasn't lying, but she may as well have been. All this food... it was just too much!

They found more success as they slowly inched themselves towards the door. Seth and Tess content to wave them out, rather than rise from their clearly comfortable positions. Alice and Zack wondered, for a moment, if they even could. Being so full and fat like that... there was no way they were going to be able to follow them out, was there?

"Buh-bye!" Tess announced as she picked up the phone, probably to make good on that offer of pizza Seth laid out earlier, "Don't be strangers!"

"Later guys!" Seth raised a hand in farewell, "Let's do this again sometime!"

1322211.content:
As interesting as their encounter with Seth and Tess was, Alice and Zack would soon find that they weren’t privy to a particularly unique mindset around Abercrombie.

Over the course of the next few days, as they settled into their new lives in their new hometown, Alice and Zack would be exposed to the same sort of outlook that very much reminded them of their neighbors. While Seth and Tess were still by far the largest people that they had come in contact with over the course of their stay, their outlooks regarding food, weight, and overall friendliness were seemingly pretty common! After dinner with their neighbors, it was almost like a veil had been lifted, and they could see Abercrombie in all its actuality for the first time since they made the move.

Zack noticed it first; and on his first day, no less.

Dean Hammond, his senior manager, had been a very large man. Not quite as large as Seth from the night before, but still quite big. If Zack had to take a guess, he would have placed Dean somewhere around four hundred pounds—mostly belly.

He was a bit taller than Zack, as most other men were, but also much wider around than he had ever been. Dean’s gut was a very prominent, a single roll of fat that swelled out and drooped over his beltline to a ludicrous degree. His face was just as plump, a brown stubble beard peppered his many chins and his round face quite handsomely. And from what he could see beneath the red blazer, his arms were just as big. His fingers were stubby and thick and, as Zack was given the opportunity to check many times as he kept a steady pace behind him on the tour, Dean’s derriere was just as doughy.

But that belly of his was unreal. It was just… there. Present in every conversation. Zack couldn’t help but stare!

Much of the hotel staff, too, was a bit bigger than Zack would have expected. Marianne, the concierge, was a wide-hipped little redhead with a round face and a doughy belly that spilled over into her soft lap. The bellhop that he’d been introduced to, Deanne, was just as round in the waist as she was in the chest. Even Dan, the valet who had taken his car, was sporting a meaty little belly!

Meanwhile, on what seemed like the other side of the world, Alice had taken a bit longer to come around to seeing this side of things.

It mostly stemmed from her not having to start school until the week ended; she had enjoyed many days in the comfort of her own home since the move; she’d been too busy facebooking her friends, sketching up new designs, and catching up with the Marni Blake Show to notice anything too strange about their new town. But once she started attending classes regularly, Alice’s eyes had been opened.

Alice had literally walked onto campus and ran into Tess. She had been trying to avoid it after such an eventful first coupling, but being as big as she was, Alice supposed it was inevitable. She had shown her to her class building and waddled off in kind, leaving Alice all by her lonesome in the strange new world of ASU. So imagine her surprise when she entered her History of Fashion course, and had to stop herself from staring.

Half of her class was huge!

It was like going back to Buttercombe all over again, except this time Alice took the time to recognize that half of her class was easily obese. It was a largely female class, lead by an instructor just as heavyset as the rest of them. Dr. Braun had distractingly large breasts, that seemed to stare at her as the older woman turned to face her tardy student. Alice shrunk into herself as best she could, and wriggled her way through the shrinking aisles between her classmates.

There were girls bigger than some of the seniors back at Buttercombe, crammed into desks specifically designed to carry their bulk. And spilling out of them. Between all of the desks she passed, Alice must have brushed against at least fifty pounds of excess chub just hanging over the surface of desks. Bellies, arms, hips, one girl’s breast. Alice eventually settled down next to one of the only skinny girls in the class, and tried to pay attention to her professor’s lecture, rather than the sheer scope of her class’ size.

But it wasn’t hard to see why.

Zack and Alice were still getting used to living in Abercrombie, just as they were still getting used to all the Abercrombians in it. But even they had to admit that there were an awful lot of restaurants. And not just fast food, either; sit-down places with menus and booths, with real chefs in their very real kitchens. As Alice was more or less hopeless in the kitchen, they’d found themselves eating out quite a lot over the years. But never had there been so much variety.

What’s more, none of it had ever tasted this good.

Their meal with Seth and Tess had been a precursor for many meals to come, apparently, as the quality of food very much matched the quantity. Every other place was city-wide famous for this thing or that. The best pizza in Abercrombie. The best Mexican food in Abercrombie. The only place you can get a pizza-dog.

What the hell even was a pizza dog?

Zack and Alice were sure to find out. Because, as the days flew by and their lives settled into some semblance of normalcy…

13222111.content:
Because, as the days flew by and their lives settled into some semblance of normalcy, they could see that it was going to be a 24/7 job to avoid slipping back into their chubbier days. Memories of doughier bodies clad in outfits pulled from the racks at Lane Bryant or the Big 'n Tall shop were too fresh in the young couple's minds to be written off as paranoia. Even without any genetic predisposition to porking up, old habits had revealed how easily they each could go overboard with constant snacking and generous portions at mealtime.

And Abercrombie wasn't going to help them, they realized this quickly. The obvious issue was that despite the unexpected density of food-hawkers, from food carts on up to ritzy restaurants, this did not guarantee as deep a selection of low-calorie fare as they might have liked. When being confronted with dishes that tantalized the tongue and satisfied the belly's craving – food that elicited such descriptors as 'savory,' 'rich,' 'indulgent' or 'decadent' – the best defense would have been an equally diverse offering that tended towards fruits, vegetables or lean meats.

But as if there were some conspiracy targeting the weight-conscious, like our young couple, even those dishes that had the illusion of healthy were undermined by the inclusion of garnishings that added at least a couple hundred calories. Fruit bowls came laden with heavy cream, salads a similarly rich dressing. Chicken wasn't always fried, but baked dishes were practically drowned in sauces or accompanied by hearty sides.

And the portions. Given their financial situation Alice and Zack were happy to get their money's worth, don't doubt that. But this didn't mean they wanted every meal they ate out to be a stomach-busting feast.

The first time they hit a trendy restaurant – not a quickie burger joint, but a real restaurant – they made the mistake of ordering appetizers with their meal. When the plates of fried calamari and loaded potato wedges were set in front of them, it looked like they had accidentally been given entrees instead. Then their actual entrees arrived, the servings so big they each got multiple plates: one for the main dish and another for the sides.

It wasn’t quite like a repeat of their first lunch with Seth and Tess, but the end result wasn’t much different. Alice and Zack were left cradling groaning bellies by the end, the waitress’ perky query if they wanted to see the dessert menu almost making them heave.

It was representative of how every place practically threw food at its customers, but the new arrivals had nowhere to turn to voice their astonishment at this except one another. Because there was a second front in their war against expanding waistlines: the population of Abercrombie. The question of why the restaurants offered such massive portions was answered by the simplest of facts; it was because there was a demand for it.

Was every person in Abercrombie an unrepentant, food-obsessed glutton? Not hardly. But were constant snacking, overeating and the occasional gorging commonplace? Absolutely. Between classes, at study sessions, during breaks at work, hanging out with friends, going shopping; at almost every time, during almost any activity, the average Abercrombian was more likely to have something to nosh on than not. It wasn’t that food was dominant in their thoughts so much as chomping on something casually was a predominant habit. And when they sat down to a real meal, few would get up before they had had all they could eat.

Through those early weeks Zack and Alice avoided being drawn into old, undesirable habits by dint of not eating out too often, but even that couldn’t shield them entirely through the time it took to learn just how pervasive the indulgent habits were in this city. The couple didn’t want to withdraw entirely from their neighbors, coworkers and classmates, becoming hermits or shut-ins; but Alice politely begging off a third round of pub food during a study session at a bar near campus or Zack mentioning his plans to hit the gym after work didn’t get through to the fat and happy Abercrombians.

And if someone did notice them turning down more food too forcefully or too often, there was a distinct coolness to their future interactions.

“Are they self-conscious about eating when we’re not?” Alice asked once, as the two shared notes about their respective days and they discovered the similar patterns.

“Maybe they think we’re refusing their hospitality or something,” Zack offered. “Or we’re ruining the mood, being stuck up.”

“We can’t rock the boat. Not this early on.”

“It probably would be easier to just go with the flow. We don’t have to gorge, just nibble on something.”

“Yeah.”

Discussions of the plan stopped there, but both were grappling with other thoughts about the situation. Namely, the temptation to indulge just as their new acquaintances did. They had to eat, that wasn’t up for debate, but allowing themselves to reach satisfying fullness without going for ‘just one more’ serving or dish or whatever was a constant struggle. The people around them and the city itself passively encouraged them to go beyond mere satiation, but they both knew just how easily they could be swayed (or even just to let themselves) overdo it. It was devilishly simple to say to themselves ‘Everyone else is eating, so I can have another slice of pizza’ or ‘Compared to what most of the others have eaten another plate won’t compare.’

Finally, there was the fact that as the days passed into weeks and the novelty of moving to a new city gave way to routine, their perspective changed. Seeing so many large-bodied people eating so much, it was hard to keep in mind what constituted a normal diet. Yes, limiting the fattiest or greasiest dishes was still possible, but when you’ve gone several weeks eating what constituted a ‘full’ meal in Abercrombie you would take it for granted that a half-pound burger, side of fries, side of onion rings, extra-large soda and a jumbo slice of cheesecake for dessert was normal.

There was one area where the changes to their diet couldn’t be ignored: wardrobe. The extra pounds and inches could be ignored if they crept up slowly enough to not be noticed, when when one struggled to pull up a pair of jeans or threw on a favorite shirt and found it didn’t quite cover one’s belly, the full scope of what was happening came into view.

Such is what happened one morning a month and a half into their new life in Abercrombie, as

132221112.content:
Suck it in, Zack thought to himself, Hoooold it.

He got another button through the hole of his dress shirt. That was more than half of them now, all downhill from here...

Exhaling slowly, Zack let his middle inflate to its usual rounded size. He couldn't deny that it was bigger than he recalled, but as one part of his mind reflected on too many indulgent Abercrombie meals he tried to shift his conscious thoughts to other topics. He wasn't blind to how his eating habits had backslid since moving here, or how his plans to go to the gym regularly hadn't turned out exactly as he hoped. And this wasn't the first time he had noticed a tightness in clothing that had previously fit just fine.

So he'd have to buy some new shirts. That wasn't the end of the world.

He inhaled again, sucking in his belly. Then he was slipping another button into its hole.

Exhaling, slowly...

The sound of the buttons popping off was like popcorn kernels erupting in the microwave. Bang! Bang! Bang! Three buttons shot off his shirt, rebounding off the wall and falling to the floor as Zack's belly spread the two parts of his shirt and hung free. The undershirt he had on rolled up an inch or so from the outer contour of his belly, exposing his navel.

"Damn it," he said, thinking too late to keep his voice low.

"What's up?" Alice asked, poking out from the bathroom.

"Oh, it's... This shirt's too small."

He considered turning away and hiding the damage to his shirt, but decided on honesty. If anyone could understand the frustration and guilt he was feeling, it was her.

Alice stepped into the bedroom, clutching her towel tight despite the many times they had seen each other naked, and inspected his sundered shirt.

"The shirt's too small?" she said, giving him a look that said 'Are you being honest?'

"And maybe I'm too big," he admitted.

"You have gotten softer," her tone wasn't judgmental at all. "And you're not the only one. Look."

She opened up the towel to reveal a body that looked like a curvy exaggeration of her pre-Abercrombie physique. She clearly meant to allay Zack's self-recrimination by pointing out that both of them were feeling the effects of Abercrombie's culinary temptations, but where he saw how his thicker middle distorted his body all he could think when he looked at his naked girlfriend was

God damn, she's sexy.

He saw how her torso was rounding out into a little pot belly, but that only served to emphasize the widening of her hips, the swelling of her thighs, and the heaving fullness of her breasts. All her added weight was going to exactly the right places.

It wasn't her intent, but Alice's display did help take Zack's mind off his own problems. Taking her by the shoulders, Zack pulled her in close and said

"But do you realize just how damn good you make 'soft' look?"

Alice purred, grinning mischievously...

And then she pushed Zack away.

"Later, lover-boy. I have class, you have work."

"Unf," Zack groaned. "That's not fair!"

"Adult life isn't fair. But I'll make it up to you later. Now go find another shirt that'll fit you."

It wasn't easy, but Zack did find a shirt that, while labeled as the same size as his others, had more give. When he got it buttoned up he could feel it hugging his middle, but there weren't diamonds of flesh between the buttons, nor was he afraid to twist and bend or make sudden movements.

He kissed Alice goodbye, squeezing her plush rear, and headed to work.

At the elevators he met Seth. The supersized dude was dressed casually in a polo shirt, khaki shorts and sandals.

"Hey, man. Headed to work?" he said, all smiles.

"Yep."

"Bringing home the bacon."

Why'd he have to mention food, Zack asked himself. His breakfast of cereal and a couple bananas hadn't filled him up, and the thought that he could eat more made part of him think that he should be hungry enough for more. And if he should be hungry then he wasn't he hungry?

As if to answer his belly grumbled, loud enough that Seth heard it.

"Don't tell me you're headed to work on an empty stomach," he said. "I was headed to get some breakfast. Wanna come?"

"I..." Conflicting thoughts raced around his mind. If he turned him down he might sound rude. If he said he didn't have time that might sound like a lie. If he said yes he'd have to be careful not to eat too much. If he said yes he'd have to eat quickly, because he didn't have all the time in the world.

"Yeah," he decided, "I can get something quick."

'Something quick' turned out to be a stack of pancakes with bacon and a couple fried eggs. It paled in comparison to the one-man feast Seth ordered for himself, but it was still a sizable meal when combined with the cereal and fruit he had already eaten.

But once he was sitting down, chatting with Seth - they had plenty of similar interests when it came to movies and music and video games, and a legitimate friendship had developed beyond the fact that they were neighbors - the earlier issue with his shirt and the matter of his rising weight receded from his thoughts. While he hadn't gone full-on native, Zack had reached the point where the blithe view of indulgence characteristic of Abercrombie was distorting his own view of his eating habits. It was the fact he was eating less than Seth that stuck out in his mind, not how much he was by itself.

He was still conscious of the time, though. He had to excuse himself while Seth was still on his first course to make the bus and get to work on time. But as he shuffled out of the diner the heaviness in his belly was a mere pleasantness, the satisfaction of satiation, rather than the oppressive weight of overeating.

It felt normal to him, and when it came time for his lunch Zack tried to replicate the feeling, ordering a second burger to go with his large combo, and then a couple slices of pie for dessert.

The lone voice, subdued but not entirely absent, that had suggested watching what he ate and maybe being more active, spoke up again later in the day. It couldn't make itself heard around mealtime, but when Zack was getting dressed, undressed or just letting his mind wander during the later afternoon slump at work it had more success.

But there were other voices it had to contend with. Voices advocating pleasure, voices downplaying his weight gain, voices pointing out that he didn't stand out at all in this city.

1322211123.content:
If Zack had needed his girlfriend to point out her own 'ripening' under Abercrombie's influence, it wasn't just because he had been so focused on the changes to his own eating habits as of late. The scene of him struggling to get his pants buttoned had been recreated by Alice with certain variations. The chief one being that while her wardrobe had its share of button-down shirts and pants, it also had enough dresses, blouses, skirts and leggings to allow her to avoid her own battles of sucking in her middle and tugging the waistband or hem to cover herself. She hadn't failed to notice how less flowing certain garments were, or how more snug others felt, but it was easy to ignore it.

Easier, actually, when compared to Zack's internal monologues. Maybe it was because Alice was primed to be less shaken by issues of weight (having dealt with them, in one form or another, more than her beau), or maybe she was more receptive to her self-directed assurances that a few pounds was nothing to fret over/this was only temporary/it looked good on her. Again, this could tie in to her greater experience with fluctuating weight, a positive side-effect to help balance the ledger after years of eyeing the number on the scale for herself or her sister.

A possible third option was that something fundamental inside her had shifted, with the milestone of moving to a new city, moving in with her boyfriend, putting some distance between her and her mother AND finding herself in a city with a far more body-positive culture than she was used to all coming together to liberate her of conventional standards of beauty and the self-recrimination she was used to.

Looking backwards at the reason(s) wasn't on Alice's mind, so let's not devote too much time to it ourselves. Alice herself wasn't even thinking about the change to her behavior too much; school and life with Zack was more than enough to keep her occupied.

She wasn't blind to the changes of her appetite, nor its effects. When she was at a study session or ordering the full combo at lunch she knew she was eating more than she used to. More than she needed, and sometimes more than she actually wanted. It was in social settings that this latter incident happened; being with her study buddies or meeting up with Tess on campus, she fell into the habit of grazing just because everyone around her was.

But even by herself Alice had taken to letting loose with her appetite as a matter of fact. On those increasingly rare moments when she had a moment of guilt or second-guessing she had no trouble justifying herself; she needed to get her money's worth, this place just had large portions, she didn't want to seem like a killjoy.

Halfway through her first semester she wasn't calling up these rationalizations. Zack still grappled with his desire to indulge because on a certain level his coworkers were potential rivals and how he carried himself in the office reflected on him in a very serious way, but Alice didn't have such worries on campus. Her enthusiasm for food and drink endeared her to most people, and the general loosening up she had experienced made her more approachable and open. She still covered her mouth when she had to burp (she was a lady, after all), but she had a relaxed vibe most of the time.

So it wasn't a shocking turn when it was Alice who ended up crossing the 200-pound mark first, despite Zack's lead on her at the start of this impromptu race. Calorie-rich meals at the campus quad and regular study sessions accompanied by rounds of snacks or multiple pizzas had not just softened her frame but were thickening it steadily.

As well as grown her appetite.

"Come on, Zack. We can't keep them waiting."

Alice slapped her boyfriend playfully on the rump (a decidedly more padded rump than a couple months ago) as Zack struggled to pull the hem of his polo shirt over his belly.

"There's no rush," he grunted. "They live next door."

"But I'm already hungry, and I've been craving Mexican all morning." She walked over to the closet and pulled a hockey jersey off a hanger. "Here. Just wear this."

Zack groaned inwardly as he caught the jersey. The article was a remnant from his fat days, one of the few items he hadn't disappeared into a donation to Goodwill because he was a fan of the team and it made a good nightshirt during the warmer months.

But the polo wasn't going to do the job, sohe heeded his girlfriend's command and threw it on. The bottom hung down below his crotch, almost to his knees. He wasn't exactly swimming in it, though; you could easily see the rounding of his potbelly. A bit of insult to injury.

Alice didn't comment on his chunky physique, though. She didn't exactly have a leg to stand on, Zack mused, noticing how full her own rear and middle looked. And her breasts were filling out the top of her shirt nicely.

'Why did women carry their weight so much better than men,' he asked himself as they made their way to Seth and Tess' apartment.

He also asked himself if heading to a Mexican buffet for lunch was the best idea when both of them were putting on weight, but it was too late to break off the lunch with their neighbors. And Zack himself was looking forward to a filling meal; trying to cut back had meant eating a small breakfast, not a satisfying one.

'That was my problem. I should adjust my eating to 'enough' rather than limiting calories.'

Starting tomorrow, he didn't include. But it would have to be so, because by the time the four neighbors got to the buffet thoughts of curbing his intake were drowned out by the rumbling of his stomach, made more intense by the aromatic smells filling the restaurant. If Zack could take any solace in his gorging at lunch it was that he didn't eat near as much as his neighbors (small comfort, given they were each three times as large as him) or even Alice. But that point of pride was undermined by the fact that he went back to the lines of steam trays twice after reaching satiation, as Alice wanted company as she went back and gone more food for herself.

It was four taut bellies that waddled back into the apartment complex, not three. Zack wasn't too hard on himself for giving in to temptation, but when the four of them squeezed into a single elevator, Seth and Tess' ponderous frames taking up most of the space, encroaching on Zack and Alice, he did chide himself that this performance can't be a regular thing.

'If Alice and I were even half as big as those two,' he thought to himself 'We wouldn't all fit in here.'

The tight squeeze was forgotten by dinner, though. As Zack and Alice worked in the kitchen he let himself by talked into preparing more than the two of them really needed. And then once the dining table was filled with spaghetti in alfredo sauce, garlic bread, shrimp fettucine and gelato it was too easy to justify taking seconds, thirds, fourths and before he knew it there were no leftovers to put in the fridge.

'So today was a cheat day,' he told himself later. 'As long as this isn't a habit...'

132221131.content:
Sitting in front of her dresser mirror as she put on some make-up, Alice watched the reflection of Zack struggling to button his shirt. He had gotten the top ones done, but the bottom three had trouble meeting across his pot belly.

The shirt wasn’t new; the belly was. Since starting his new job Zack looked to have put on 15, maybe 20 pounds, most of it finding its way to his middle.

It wasn’t that Zack was suddenly letting himself go now that they had started living together. For breakfast and dinner he kept to his normal routine, small meals with the occasional dessert before bed. Even when they went out and came upon one of the restaurants that offered jumbo portions for every dish – and more and more Alice was convinced that was EVERY restaurant in Abercrombie – he never ordered more than would suit him.

In all respects, he seemed to be showing the same restraint and moderation Alice was.

Except... He had mentioned that the staff break room at the hotel was constantly filled with tempting treats. In-house stuff, made by the hotel’s kitchen staff. Alice knew friends who said office breakrooms usually only had a single box of doughnuts every morning, but the way Zack described it there was a full spread of breakfast or lunch offerings throughout the day. Steam trays of bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs with peppers and onions, hush puppies. Platters of cold cuts and cheeses, bread and various condiments to the side. Potatoes au gratin or baked potatoes with cheddar, sour cream, and bacon on the side. All they needed was a carving station and it would be a small buffet, just for the staff.

Small wonder Zack didn’t ever leave the building for lunch. It was just economic to accept the free food whenever he could, plus he wanted to get on good terms with his new coworkers, not appearing standoffish or rude.

13222113232.content:
It turned out Alice didn’t need Zack’s help gaining weight. Whether it be the influence of her new classmates or old habits coming back or something in the water, the former chubster was reverting back to the butterball Zack had first met. And not just physically. Her diet had grown less restrictive and particular; snacks and desserts were less a special event and more part of her routine, and portion sizes were getting bigger just as she was.

Part of that was Abercrombie’s culture. Restaurants and diners gave more value for your dollar than back in Daven’s Port; even the fast food franchises substituted each combo size with the next one up. Smalls were mediums, mediums were larges, and for the larges they went super-sized, as if that hallmark of indulgence hadn’t been done away with years ago. Zack and Alice ate out fairly regularly, and there was only so much either could do to limit how much they ate.

And then there were Alice’s peers. She was fitting in at the school well enough, and thought she didn’t have a new circle of tight-knit friends there were a couple classmates operating on the same wavelength as her. She would chat with them between classes and often they would go to the campus pub or one of the restaurants around the school afterwards to study or compare notes and sketches. And of course while they studied they snacked. Alice described the two as being like younger sisters of Tess, quarter-ton gluttons born and bred in Abercrombie. Food was never far from reach from either of them.

How was Alice going to count calories when sharing a table with these two? Or when every class of hers was filled to capacity by lard-laden classmates with butts and bellies spreading across wide benches, and most stairs replaced with escalators and freight-sized elevators? Obese was normal in Abercrombie, and Alice seemed to be internalizing that without problem.

Zack himself had grown blasé pretty quickly about seeing titanic neighbors and coworkers everywhere he turned. In general his staring and ‘There but for the grace of god...’ thoughts had fallen away, and now he just saw his boss or the girl behind the counter at Starbucks and not their acres of flesh.

Except in a few cases. Having noticed Alice’s plumping and thinking about what she would look like if bigger, Zack had developed a habit of scoping out other women who had a tendency to gain below the waist. One of the reception girls at the hotel, Rachel; a bakery assistant who lived a floor below him and Alice; one of the teachers at the high school Zack passed on his way to and from work. There was a nice selection of overripe pears in the city, and Zack was picking up on all of them.

He had no thoughts of cheating; his designs were arguably purer, picturing Alice if she got up to 400, 500, 600 pounds. What would she look like if she were twice as big as when they had first met? How big would her butt get?

How fat would she have to be before she couldn’t drive a car anymore, because her butt pushed her belly up against the steering wheel? How long would it take before she was getting stuck in doorways or turnstiles? How much would she weigh when walking became too burdensome, the act of getting one overstuffed thigh around the other too difficult to be worth the trouble?

Zack didn’t want anything bad to happen to Alice; if the citizens of Abercrombie didn’t seem so preternaturally healthy he wouldn’t be entertaining these thoughts at all. But living in a community of obese and yet surprisingly healthy people, Zack couldn’t help but imagine Alice joining their ranks, or even surpassing them. When they had dinner with Seth and Tess Zack would take every opportunity to catch the two women standing side by side or face to face, imagining Alice swelling up and out to rival Tess, then continuing on so she was bigger.

He didn’t feel he was being unfaithful in any way, picturing her being transformed. Zack told himself it was more like predicting where things would go if he just stood back and let it all unfold on its own.

And Alice owned some responsibility for her changing form, after all. With her lighter schedule grocery shopping fell on her shoulders, and she was bringing more junk food than she would have accepted in the house just a couple months ago. And most of it was finding its way into her belly, not Zack’s. That wasn’t Abercrombie, that was all Alice.

And where had all this indulgence and relaxing of her diet gotten Alice? Zack didn’t have a number, but from his perspective the answer was either ‘A very good place’ or ‘A good starting point.’

The actual number on the scale, should Alice step on one, would read 225 pounds. A more than insignificant increase. In fact, it was almost twice as much as what Alice had weighed when the two moved to Abercrombie. Her entire body had softened, definition and tone being lost under a layer of baby fat coming from her face down to her toes. But in certain areas she had gone beyond euphemisms for ‘soft’ and earned any descriptor for ‘fat.’

Her breasts were two gelatin mounds that filled and strained her D-cup bras. At home, alone with Zack, she found it better to just let them breathe, covering them up with a t-shirt or pajama top that did nothing to stop them from quivering and shaking at the slightest jostle.

Her belly, even when empty, was a distinct pot belly that stretched out most of her shirts and left a crescent of bare flesh visible. When stuffed that crescent became a wide strip, her stomach stretching out to full-term pregnant sized after a particularly hearty meal (and there weren’t many non-hearty meals to find in Abercrombie). At the end of any heavy meal Alice would have to lean back or scoot her chair away from the table a bit to give herself room to breathe. And as of late undoing the button of her pants was a necessary step towards comfort.

But it was her lower half that commanded your attention. Zack’s attention, definitely. Alice’s butt and hips and thighs were all packed with blubber, curves exaggerated to the point of parody. If she strolled down the street of any regular city Alice would attract stares, gobsmacked expressions and more than a few catcalls and wolf whistles. Her booty was a ballooning barge that rocked from side to side wherever she went, a hazard to nightstands and end tables and a nightmare to panties and jeans.

Small wonder she had been favoring skirts as of late, but even loose and flowing garments couldn’t hide the plateau on top of her butt cheeks, the shelf that invited you to rest your drink or plate on it. Nothing Alice could wear or design would ever slim down the growing ball of fat she was below the waist.

And yet Zack’s eyes kept returning to Tess or Rachel or bakery girl, his thoughts on Alice reaching those dimensions. He had never thought of himself as greedy, but seeing Alice nearly double her weight only made him want more of her. He less wanted to let things play out on their own and more wanted to help guide and propel it.

Plans came to him, mostly unbidden, about how to encourage Alice’s growth without coming across as too obvious or drawing her attention to it. But he kept hesitating. She was doing so good getting bigger on her own. Maybe he could hold off just a little longer.

But if he helped, he would ask himself, how much bigger would she get? And how much faster?

It was hard to keep playing spectator, but Zack wasn’t 100% sure it was time to step in yet...

Perhaps fittingly, all this came into play over dinner.

Abercrombie was lush with buffets and eateries with self-service stations and various build-your-own bars. Even when they had first moved, Zack and Alice often ate at these types of places. For those more concerned about budgeting than calorie counting (which, granted, at the moment they were) places like Evan's Eats and the Broken Stool Buffet were a godsend. For eleven dollars and fifty cents apiece, Zack and Alice (or, presumably, any diner) could get their fill and take some home for later! However, now that Zack was far more concerned with calories, this place was a godsend for a different sort of reason...

There wasn't a single entrée on the menu that wasn't fattening. Greasy, fried, butter-basted, cheesy, or just fatty in general were optimum terms to describe the fare at these sorts of places. All of them! The buffets in Abercrombie seemed to be no exception to the rule—everything in this whole city was big. The people, the portions, even the damn plates were above-average size. And since the silverware could plop entire serving sizes at a time, it was no wonder Alice hadn't noticed how much she was eating.

Or, at least, Zack hadn't thought she'd noticed how much she was eating.

Because not long into his little plan to tiptoe behind his girlfriend's increasingly softening back, she said the four words that he had hoped to have never heard. Or at least, not until it was too late to do anything about it...

"Zack, I'm getting fat."

His heart practically jumped right out of his chest. It felt like she was calling him out, right then and there at the dinnertable. Like she had known what he was doing. What he'd been fantasizing about behind her back. But she couldn't have! No, that... that wasn't possible!

"W-What?" Zack put on his best managerial smile, "B-Babe, no way—”

“I am Zack, and I think its because we eat out all the time...” Alice’s face fell as she glanced down at her meal accusatorily, “I mean, it’s not your fault, but...”

It wasn’t Zack’s fault—mostly. Really! Aside from the past week or so, he’d been content to lay back and watch Alice fatten herself up. Helping herself to extra portions, snacking on junk food in front of the sofa, going out with her friends from campus all the time, comfort-food to go with her homework; it was all her! Granted, he’d been egging her on for the past week. Buying her chocolate, bringing home Big Burger after work, taking her out to... well, places like this.

But the fact that she was so eager to say “it’s not your fault”, well... it was kind’ve cute how readily she was to cast blame aside for her own burgeoning waistline.

“Alice, baby, I love you no matter what size.” Zack tried to deflect her concerns, to no avail.

“I know you do, but look at me!” Alice held up her hands to emphasize her big belly, her arms were thick and meaty. She’d even regrown her second chin with remarkable speed, “I’m huge!”

No, she wasn’t. Comparatively, anyway.

“And I still love you.” Zack said with an attempt at definitivity, “I promise.”

“That’s not... I mean, I love you too but...” Alice whimpered as she threw her head between her hands, her elbows propped up on the table, “Ugh... I’m sorry...”

Zack knew going in that this wasnt’ going to be an easy sell. And it was stuff like this, that had been popping up the past semester or so, that was giving him second thoughts. A good boyfriend would have helped her lose weight instead of helping her pack it back on. She’d worked so hard for her body. And it was great! But the thought of Alice at three, four, five... dare he think it? The size her butt would be when she weighed six hundred pounds? Her big round ass getting bigger, rounder, meatier by the day? The thought alone made him weak in the knees!

“Hey, it’s okay.” Zack said with a smile, feeling the conversation tip in his favor

“No, it’s not... I shouldn’t yell at you because I can’t control myself.” Alice sighed, looking back up, “It’s just... I’m stressed out, y’know? School’s kicking my butt and my mother’s been calling me and I’m getting fat again and... and... ugh, I’m just sorry...”

Zack reached aross the table and grabbed Alice’s hand. He noted how remarkably soft they were now that she’d crossed the two-fifty mark. It took him back to when they were both young and chubby, that day at the beach in Daven’s Port. Her arms were soft and toneless (not that they’d ever had much tone before!) and remarkably doughy. Zack felt his member move underneath the table.

“Hey, it’s okay. You’re stressed out. I get it.” he said with a smile as he stroked the softness of her hand, “That’s what I’m here for.”

“Thanks.” Alice said appreciatively, “You’re the best boyfriend ever.”

Zack felt a twinge of guilt as the words left her lips. He wasn’t. He really, really wasn’t.

“Look... you’re... you’re stressed out your weight. I get it.” Zack shook off his feelings of guilt the best he could, “But... y’know, you shouldn’t worry about that. School comes first, right?”

“I... I guess...” Alice looked away defeated; it was like he didn’t get it at all...

“I mean, I know you’re freaking out, but...” he caressed her soft, chubby cheek and brought it back to the conversation, “It’s school. It’s tough, right? I mean, I’m just a manager at a hotel. Give me that over college any day.”

“I do.” Alice sniffled, but smiling, “You’re too pretty for college.”

“Exactly.” Zack laughed, “I wouldn’t have made it if Ms. Hammond hadn’t gave me a job. But you’re gonna be a big-time fashion lady. So you need to focus all of your energy on school first.”

Alice looked down, the smile slowlying fading from her face as she contemplated what Zack was suggesting...

“I mean, it’s not like you can’t lose weight later, right?” Zack offered weakly, “You should treat yourslf as much as you want if it means you can concentrate more on your school stuff.”

Was... was this working? It was kind’ve hard to tell with how Alice held herself. She looked off in thought. But what kind of thought? God, if she suspected what he was up to, it was over. She’d start crying, drop out of school, move back in with her mom...

Maybe he was in too deep? There was still time to—

“I guess.” Alice huffed finally, a small smile on her face, “As long as you promise you won’t make fun of me if I get fat again.”

“Promise!” Zack said almost too eagerly, “Totally, no way!”

Alice looked at him lovingly as she took his hand into hers. God he was such a jerk. But her couldn’t help but love what living in Abercrombie was doing to Alice’s body. A few inches here, a few pounds there, and before he knew it Alice was almost back at the size she had been when they met—and he loved it! He knew it was the wrong thing to do, total dick move boyfriend thing. But...

“So... does that mean you’re gonna stop drooling and finally get thirds?”

“Oh God... I didn’t want to look like a pig!” Alice admitted embarassedly, “Was I that obvious?”

“Not obvious.” Zack laughed, “Just... transparent. Completely and totally transparent.”

Alice snorted into her hands, covering her mouth as she laughed. It was good to see her laugh again. It helped ease the intense sense of guilt he was feeling, considering what he was doing. Just a little.

“Oh god... I think I will have some more macaroni pie...” Alice giggled as she worked her way out of the booth, “Just, you know, it was so good... promise you won’t think I’m a pig?”

“Promise.”

Alice smooched him on the cheek and sauntered back over to the self-service bar. Zack watched each cheek fight for shade underneath her skirt, big balls of butt-fluff bouncing up and down with her every step. Her thighs were a wide, womaly shape, and the way the backs of her legs seemed to bounce ever so slightly with her every step? Zack was at full mast as he watched his girlfriend go.

Zack sipped his coffee, and allowed it and his erection to drown away his feelings of shame...

Zack’s guilt over not being completely 100% upfront about Alice’s growth led him to pull back a little in ‘helping’ her let loose, but as he eased up Alice leaned in. Now that her reversion to her old weight was out in the open, and especially now that she had, as she saw it, Zack’s blessing to be her fat and happier-than-she-wanted-to-admit self, the blonde co-ed had taken the initiative of her own growth.

It wasn’t deliberate, and it didn’t involve any significant changes to what she had been doing before she opened up to Zack about her fretting over her weight. It was, rather, simply a matter of adjusting her standards to adapt to the Abercrombie way as her new sense of normal. The meal-sized snacks when she was studying with her classmates, the multiple courses at the buffets she and Zack went to, the girls’ afternoons with Tess that invariably became miniature restaurant crawls. Every one of those was a dramatic shift from what pre-Abercrombie Alice would have seen as acceptable, but the new Alice did not see the before-and-after picture. What she saw was the incremental changes that had happened here and there, bit by bit, over the course of a couple months.

Changes that came along with other upheavals like adapting to a new town and a new school and learning so many new names and faces and oh yeah, living with her boyfriend and taking their relationship to the next level. It wasn’t just Alice’s diet that had changed; everything had.

And she felt so wonderful all around, loving her new city, her new school and her boyfriend, making it easy to roll with the rising number on the scale. That was the only thing that might bother her. Not even her mounting gluttony was a concern, because wanting to eat more simply meant she got to enjoy even more of Abercrombie’s wonderful cuisine.

Which she was. At every opportunity. It wasn’t Alice’s genes or a glandular disorder that was causing her to inflate with fat; it was an appetite she couldn’t say no to.

“Do you want any ice cream?”

Alice and Zack were at home, unwinding with some stupid sitcoms.

“I’m good, but help yourself.” He didn’t really need to say it, Alice was going to indulge no matter what. But he made sure to sound as encouraging as possible here and there, just in case some doubts or self-criticism started popping up in her head.

Alice came waddling into the living room carrying a carton of grasshopper pie ice cream and a bottle of caramel syrup. When she opened the carton Zack saw that less than a quarter of it was gone. By the end of the evening it would be empty, Alice eating straight from the carton, occasionally pouring in healthy dollops of caramel, until all that was left was a puddle of melted ice cream and caramel that his girlfriend drank straight.

Then for good measure she drained the bottle of syrup, drinking from it like someone emptying a bottle of beer. And when she was done she said

“Is there still some pie left in the fridge?”

Zack watched this spectacle breathlessly. As Alice’s appetite had lost all restraint a new dimension of her eating had been discovered; beyond just quantity of food devoured, there was the unremitting gluttony she was displaying more and more.

As Alice had settled into her unrepentant piggishness, the idea of her being dismayed by how fat she was getting now laughable, she had less and less tried to hide her intention of filling her belly to the utmost. At buffets she was piling more food onto her plates and taking two at a time; at fast food places she ordered two or three combos at the largest size and a few sides for good measure; and at home she prepared family-sized meals and then worked to make sure there weren’t any leftovers.

Zack was amazed, but in a good way. Even the fattest people he had ever known – including Alice back in Daven’s Port – would still show restraint in addressing portion sizes, afraid of fitting the stereotype of the food-obsessed fatty people assumed they were. But here was Alice making no bones about her desire to stuff herself at every opportunity. Every meal time was another chance for her to pack her belly taut, the great dome of it swelling outward, hanging over the ground in defiance of gravity.

This wasn’t something Zack could cause, no matter how devious and underhand he was. This came from an influence in a different direction: Abercrombie itself. The city was not just fat friendly but fat enabling, and as Alice began to see herself as an Abercrombie woman this extended into the same kind of unapologetic gluttony that so much of the city’s population engaged in.

The results of this about face in indulgence was sitting right next to Zack on the sofa, pressing against him even as he sat far to one side. After a few weeks of shedding her inhibitions Alice had reached and then passed her old weight, sailing by on track to reach 400 pounds.

Alice was now visibly bigger than she had been when Zack first met her, her girth swelling out in every direction but especially behind her. Alice’s booty, the centerpiece of her body, was a pair of hypnotic boulders that needed two chairs for her to sit comfortably and blew apart anything less than a 5XL pair of spandex. Her butt extended behind her further than her breasts did in front, and those babies had grown into a pair of 50-GG sweater puppies. When Zack and Alice spooned he couldn’t feel her backside, and his arm would only go halfway past her belly (now blown up into a pussy-obscuring ball of flab in its own right).

Alice was quickly turning into a body double of her study buddies. The ‘younger sister of Tess’ analogy now applied to her, aided by the way their neighbor had taken Alice under her fat wing. Seth and Tess were still the couple’s main point of reference in their own apartment, and over a series of weekend get-togethers Zack had seen how the much larger pear had taken a shine to Alice. At the dinner table all four of them would eat to their heart’s content (Zack bowing out first, of course), but there was this unspoken conversation going on between the two women as Tess silently encouraged Alice to keep going, to have just a few more bites.

Over time ‘a few more bites’ had turned into another helping, and then another plate, and by this point Alice was eating almost as much as Seth, trying to match Tess bite for bite for as long as she could. Zack could only imagine what was going on when the two went out to eat alone. Was Tess actively encouraging her to eat more? Or was that just a wild fantasy that Zack wanted to be true?

Having a girlfriend who weighed twice as much as him was even more exciting than Zack had guessed, and the fact that she was letting herself be stuffed by her friends and neighbors put him over the moon. How much fatter was she going to get under Tess’ influence? What if she passed her friends in size and liked it, working hard to make sure she stayed bigger than them?

It was almost enough to push Zack to start ‘helping’ her again, but the fact that Alice was doing so well on her own so far held his hand. He didn’t want to do anything sneaky, going behind her back, and until they had another open conversation about her weight gain and her gluttony, he would have to hold back.

But it wasn’t a topic the two could avoid forever. Even as Alice was being propelled to quarter-ton status, the young couple was going to have to talk about...
