As unbelievable as it sounded, it was hard for a one-income home of two to support themselves in a nice apartment in the city.

Since Alice was going to school full-time, that meant that Zack was the one bringing home the bacon. Well, figuratively. They could definitely afford to bring home the metaphorical bacon, but the actual bacon was a little lacking. As was the bread. And the cheese. And the sandwich meat.

As nice as his raise and promotion to management position was, Zack wasn't making nearly enough money to support both he and Alice all by himself. This apartment complex was expensive! And Alice would have gotten a part-time job if it didn't mean risking her almost full-ride at ASU. She had to devote all of her spare time to her studies if she wanted to be able to exist like a normal person. And honestly, she'd never had a job before—her time in and out of prestigious academies looked great on paper, but didn't translate well into actually getting a job. Especially not one that would respect her demanding school schedule.

So that left three options—

1) They could find a cheaper apartment, which would necessitate more money for gas and bus-fare respectively. Plus, this place came stock with a washer and dryer, which was awesome and meant that they wouldn't have to lug their clothes down to a laundromat or something. Plus, y'know, they had just gotten settled in and... well, option one was out.

2) They could crawl home with their tails between their legs, which was definitely a no-go. Their mothers had had shitfits when they announced that they were moving across the country and out of the spread of their respective tentacles' reach, and they had worked really hard at getting them just sorta-kinda-almost okay with the idea of them moving in together. Running home now meant defeat!

So that only left...

3) Get a roommate.

It wasn't really hard for them to get a lot of people interested. This was the big city and there was a college campus nearby—there were lots of people about their own age in a similar predicament. They wanted to live near campus, and near all the fun stuff, but didn't have the money. And they had that spare bedroom for this exact reason (Alice wanted to turn it into a studio, but Zack was pretty firm in his stance that they needed to eat more than she needed to make clothes).

The real trouble was sifting through the potential candidates.

There were a lot of weirdos out there, and neither Zack nor Alice were keen on sharing their space with someone who wasn't going to pay their share on the rent. Or keep them up at night practicing his guitar. Or one of those party girls who would never be home alone because they'd always invite friends over.

But they had convened over the past few days and had finally decided on a small pool of applicants that they were going to accept. They'd worked everything out with the landlady, and she was just fine with them renting out their extra bedroom. As long as they didn't have any pets, this whole thing should go off without a hitch.

"You ready for this?" Zack asked Alice as she stood in the full-length mirror in their bedroom, "You ready to meet the person who's gonna be all up in our personal space for the forseeable future?"

"Oh stop, don't be such a baby." Alice kept her face straight as she did her eyeliner, "I had roommates back at Buttercombe all the time—it's not so bad."

"Yeah, but we just got moved out on our own." Zack leaned against the wall, "I guess I kinda wish we had a little more time to... y'know, ourselves first."

"It'll only be for a little while." Alice turned from the mirror, one eye successfully lined, "In my experience, the worst thing you have to worry about with a roommate is keeping them out of your food."

"Yeah, I guess..." Zack's head lulled against the wall with a soft thud, "You think it'll be weird?"

"Well... yeah, I mean, it's kinda gonna have to be for a little while." Alice resumed applying her makeup, "It always is. But it gets better."

There hadn't exactly been that many promising candidates. But over the past week or so, they'd managed to break it down to three potential roommates who, they decided, wouldn't be too terrible to live with. They were supposed to arrive at eleven, sharp.

And it was already 10:55...

"Al, babe? You, uh... you almost done there?" Zack snorted

"Shush! You almost made me mess up!" Alice snipped, "Al...mosssst..."

Maybe it wouldn't be so bad, Zack said to himself as he watched his girlfriend painstakingly apply her makeup.

Maybe they'd have a good sense of humor, so he could laugh about the silly faces his girlfriend made when she was getting ready.

"Alright, let's do this." Alice pumped her arms in a cutesy sort of way, "Let's go meet our roomie!"

"Whoo, threeway!"

The two opened their bedroom door and did their best to look as normal as possible. They put on a pot of coffee, sat down on the couch, and waited for their final interview to arrive. The minutes ticked by slowly.

Slowly.

Slowly.

Until finally, Alice's phone began to buzz.

"Hello?" she answered cordially, "Oh, yeah, hi! We're... okay, I'll buzz you up."

She ended the call and turned to Zack.

"That was our pick. They'll be up shortly."

Not long after, there was a knock at the door

This was it, moment of truth—who would Zack and Alice be sharing their apartment with?

Alice opened the door to reveal...

1331.content:
Alice opened the door to reveal a big bearded guy in a hockey jersey. The man was truly enormous at 6'8" and weighing a solid 450 lbs. He had black hair and green eyes. He was carrying three heavy bags.

"What's up dudes. The name's Kevin McRoyal. We're going to have so much fun. I brought over a wide selection of videogames and sports equipment."

It was obvuous that Kevin was a nerd bro., but Zack and Alice didn't mind since he would be helping with the rent.

"It's nice to meet you Kevin. I'm Zack and this is my girlfriend Alice."

"Awesome dude. I just paid the landlady."

"That's good. So what do you do for a living?" Alice asked.

"I'm a plus size male model. Recently plus size male fashion has become quite popular, especially in these parts."

Alice and Zack look at each other in amusement.

"That's really a thing?"

"Sure is dudette. Let me unpack first then we can really party."

"Kevin sure is a nice guy."

"You can say that again babe. For a big guy he surely has a variety of workout equipment."

"He even has all three current gen systems."

"Don't forget a boatload of comics and manga. How rich is this guy?"

"I hear you dudes talking. If you're impressed by this just wait until you meet my family. We McRoyals are the richest people in town."

After fifteen minutes Kevin finishes his unpacking. He then rejoins Alice and Zack in the living room.

14.content:
They continued to roughhouse in front of the mirror. Zack would shove his girlfriend out of the way, or Alice would sneak in front of him to get a better look at herself. Alice was still dripping from her time in the shower, and Zack was getting water all over him as they played like puppies in love. Soon their giggling ceased as Zack wrapped his arms around her, pulling her in by the wet waist as they embraced. Their lips touching, he pressed her sopping form against his, getting the front of his flannel pants and t-shirt damp. And then wet. Alice wrapped herself around him like a blonde, blue-eyed snake. Her hand travelling up the back of his head and holding it in place as they locked lips passionately. Whatever steam had cleared from the shower, Alice and Zack were renewing with their heavy passion...

KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK!

"Seriously?" Zack asked breathlessly, diving back into Alice's kisses, "It's eight in the morning..."

KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK

"So rude." Alice laughed as she watched her boyfriend pout, "You wanna get it?"

"What?" Zack's chubby member was noticeable through his pants, "Why should I?"

"Because I'm naked, dummy."

Zack rolled his eyes and dried off with the spare towel. Leaving Alice alone in the bathroom, he went through their bedroom and into the living room.

Of course there'd be someone knocking on the door. They had lived in Abercrombie for almost two weeks now and no one had shown up knocking before. So of course right when he and his girlfriend start flirting and kissing, getting all touchy, someone has to knock on the door. Of course. Of friggin' course.

With the time that it took for him to get to the door, Zack's mood was already sour. The mood hadn't been ruined, but it had been wounded. With any luck he could open the door, get this over with, and get right back to his passionate makeout session with the love of his life. That is, if she hadn't gotten dressed without him...

"Hello?" He asked as he whipped open the door, "Anything I can help you with?"
14.title: Morning Routine, Interrupted

Follow Alice through her day
141.content:
Zack’s eyes went wide as he tried to take in the “rude” person who had knocked on their door so early in the morning.

“Uh...Hi...ummm…I just came...to...uh…” stuttered the woman at the door, or rather not so much at it as simply overwhelming it.

The new resident had to crane his head up to look the six foot plus woman in the eye; she was not only tall but big, like BIG big. This woman had massive arms that, while flabby, clearly had some serious muscle-power buried beneath them. A substantial bust loomed high over Zack’s head, almost obscuring his view of anything higher on her body, so he decided to turn his gaze downward instead. Her middle meanwhile was dominated by a huge stomach that rolled over her waistband and covered her thighs; and what thighs they were. Like her legs they were fat but clearly burying massive muscle-power. Finally looking back up to the woman’s face he saw a surprisingly slender face and a only slightly thicker than average neck. She bore a sweet innocent smile and dimpled cheeks; long eyelashes only added to her “adorable” face.

Her “cute” face was mirrored in her fashion sense. She was dressed in a large pink tank top with dark pink horizontal stripes across it that covered her barrel-like belly perfectly; with a medium-length light-brown skirt that matched her long tied back hair. Her feet were in clean white sneakers with pink socks running up her legs; finally she carried a pink clutch purse over her left shoulder.

“So…ummm, I came to greet you, I am one of your neighbours…so hi!” at this the woman gave a rather nervous wave that shook her large upper arm fat generously. “Sooo are you living alone here or with anyone else…” she asked before suddenly her eyeswent wide with shock and she gave a loud squeak, “oh I don’t mean I am asking if you are single…please don’t take that the wrong way!”

“No I am here with someone else…” Zack replied slowly, “Alice…one of the neighbours has come to say hello” he called out as footsteps echoed back as a response.

Alice finally emerged from the bedroom, dressed presentably but not overly business-like. Her hair was still quite obviously damp and she had not had the chance to add socks yet.

“Hi!” Alice greeted as she looked down, still trying to fix her hair, “I am Alice…woah….” Now, Alice had seen some big women in her time, she HAD gone to Buttercombe Academy after all, but a sight like this was still something shocking to her.

“Hi! I’m Kennedy, Kennedy Simpson” the massive woman greeted in her high-pitched voice, greeting Alice with the same timid wave and blushing profusely. “I…sorry we brought you a welcome gift, enjoy!” Kennedy stated with a smile as she removed her right hand, which until now had been permanently behind her back, to reveal a jumbo-sized box of chocolates, rather fancy too.

“Oh thanks!” Zack stated as he received the gift, “I am Zack” he introduced.

“Oh! Probably not my place to ask, but; are you guys like, a couple?” Kennedy asked with a bigger smile, “Because you look soooo cute together with your matching hair!”

“Uh, yeah we are” both lovebirds replied at once, giggling slightly at the coincidence.

“Yay! I knew it! I have an intuition for these things!” Kennedy giggled back before a sudden beeping could be heard coming from Kennedy’s pink purse. Turning to the blaring item, Kennedy fumbled around in it for a second before retrieving a phone and turning the alarm off. “Sorry, gotta run, gym opens in five minutes and I need to work on my biceps…but if you have some free time, would you like to pop in for dinner tonight? We really would like to get to know our neighbours better” Kennedy added with another innocent smile.

“Yeah sure, we’re not doing anything tonight…are we?” Zack asked, turning to Alice to make sure he hadn’t forgotten anything.

“Nope, not that I can think of, we would love to come” Alice added, returning the smile.

“Great! See you around sixish? We are the third room down on the right, my girlfriend and I will make sure to bring out something really special” Kennedy added with a sweet wink before turning and heading off, giving the couple a long look at her super-sized rump.

Zack then closed the door and looked at Alice for a few seconds before bursting out, “Did you see the SIZE of her?!” With a frown on her face Alice responded by whacking him on the arm.

“Zack don’t be mean; you were chubby too if I remember correctly” Alice added with a teasing scowl.

“I was more talking about her height, nearly strained my neck talking to her” Zack corrected before pondering, “Come to think of it though, haven’t quite a few of the residents here been kinda…large?”

“I guess…” Alice replied, “But they might not be residents, just tourists; Kennedy might not be local either for all we know” this comforted Zack a little.

“I guess you’re right…now, where were we before we were interrupted…” he added with a sly wink, causing Alice to giggle.

“Weeeeell as I remember we were doing this…” Alice purred as she leaned in, wrapping her now-dry arms around her boyfriend and leaning in to continue their kiss. And this time they were NOT interrupted by the doorbell.
141.title: Meeting the (big) neighbors

1411.content:
It had been a perfectly normal day for Alice and Zack. Each had gone through their respective days without a hitch and had returned home for the day. Once their intimate greeting was over they considered their earlier invitation.

“It would be a good chance to get to know somebody around here” Alice stated, referring to how none of their other neighbors had actually bothered to greet them yet.

“Very true, and if we ever need someone to move furniture around…” Zack joked, once again referring to the sheer mass of the woman at their door earlier.

“Oh don’t be mean, she was ever so sweet” Alice scolded as she picked out a semi-formal dress from her closet while Zack was freshening up across in the bathroom.

“Don’t worry, I wouldn’t dare say it to her face….ok that was the last one I swear” Zack stated as Alice gave him a stink-eye so powerful Zack could sense it through the locked door. Moments later he emerged to see his girlfriend in a long dark purple dress and carrying a clutch purse.

“Bit much?” Alice asked as Zack looked like he had to pick his jaw up off the floor. He simply shook his head in response.

Deciding not to wait around, Alice and Zack set off a little before six. Of course it took no more than a few seconds to reach the door. Crossing their fingers around each others for good luck, the couple knocked simultaneously as heavy footfalls echoed from the other side.

“Oh! Hi guys!” Kennedy greeted from her lofty height, “You’re a little early, Marissa is not ready just yet…HONEY! The guests are here!” Kennedy called out over her shoulder, but Alice was not paying attention to Kennedy, well not fully anyway, she was looking at Kennedy’s dress. Following Alice’s eyes, the massive woman took note. “You like?” she asked with a blush, pressing the few creases in her dress out with her tubby hands.

“Yeah…it looks very…um….familiar” Alice tried to point out delicately. Kennedy looked up, and then she understood.

“Oh no!” she squeaked, “We’re wearing the same dress…oooo this is so embarrassing!” Kennedy was half correct; it was not quite the same dress. While Alice was in the low end of a medium, Kennedy’s dress had a tag branded with many X’s scrawled on it.

“It’s fine” Alice tried to laugh off, “I am sure our entire wardrobes are not identical, it probably won’t happen again.”

“Yeah, you’re probably right” Kennedy agreed before noticing she was still blocking the door with her huge mass, “How rude of me, come in come in.” Kennedy ducked back to allow Alice and Zack entrance, letting them take in their neighbours apartment for the first time.

It was very similar to theirs; in fact there were still a few half-empty moving boxes here and there in the far corners. A large TV had been set up on the right wall facing the couch, and an adjoined kitchen was part of the same room on the left. A pair of doors sat on the left and right of the back of the room, and a gigantic wall-to-wall window covered the furthest part, allowing the early-evening sun to pour in. As Zack and Alice finished their little observation, a second set of heavy footsteps echoed, this time from one of the back rooms. And as their couple watched, another full-figured woman emerged from the door on the right.

“Kennedy, can you help me with this dress? It won’t do up at the back…” the woman stopped, frozen in a staring contest with the pair. “I…didn’t hear you come in” she tried to smile off.

“Marissa! I called you to say they had arrived” Kennedy faux-huffed as she walked over to join the shorter woman.

“Sorry I had the hairdryer going” her partner muttered as they retreated back inside to help with the aforementioned dress, before re-emerging. “Sorry about that” the new neighbour explained with a smile from her rich red lips; “I am Marissa, Marissa Dupont.”

Dupont…that name felt familiar to Alice…

“Dupont…? I think I went to school with a Dupont” Alice swiftly pointed out, calling back her memories at Buttercombe Academy.

“Really? What did you say your full name was?” the familiar woman asked.

“Alice Carlyle” Alice replied, which made the woman’s eyes go wide.

“Wait! Alice!? Oh my god! You look so…so…so wow! You look good!” she replied, Alice still none the wiser. “I had a twin sister, Anna? Looked like me but bigger boobs.”

That was unlikely Alice thought, this woman’s chest was HUGE, but the name did strike a bell. “Anna Dupont! I was in the same classes as her! We shared notes a few times!” Alice would have done something like that; Anna was a very scholastic person, all about her grades. So Alice would have gone to her for help time and again; and now that she remembered Anna, she could certainly see a strong resemblance in Marissa…only…there was one big difference…

“I remember Anna! But…I am sorry to say I don’t recall you much” Alice nervously explained.

“It’s cool, we hung out in different social circles” Marissa shrugged off before adding, “Plus, I got SUPER fat.” That she was certainly right about. Marissa was, under normal circumstances, a whale of a woman. Her hips were absolutely massive, far beyond the capacity of ordinary seating arrangements; and from what Alice and Zack could see, there was quite a sizable backside behind them. Her belly was a large fat done that sat lazily on top of her thighs, covered up by her mauve dress; expect for the little diamond in the center that showed off her deep bellybutton. Above her pot-belly, and very much overshadowing it, were a massive pair of breasts; clearly held up by some incredible feat of bra-engineering. Lastly she had a very round face, complimented with a double chin and a hint of a third; all framed by her long blonde hair.

“You’re not that fat honey” Kennedy tried to argue as she emerged from the door, adding some finishing touches to her hair, now out of her topknot.

“Kennedy” Marissa replied sternly, “My ass has its own zip code, I am fat and I need to diet.” At this Marissa noticed the looks she was getting from the guests; “Sorry, Kennedy and I are a couple; this should make it clear…” and then in one shockingly swift move from someone so fat, Marissa whipped a chubby arm up and around Kennedy’s neck and brought her down for a passionate kiss on the lips, shocking the brunette.

Kennedy didn’t exactly fight off the kiss, but she sure was red in her beefy face when Marissa released her from the tongue wrestling contest.

“I…um…should check on dinner” Kennedy mumbled sheepishly before waddling away as fast as her mega-sized legs could in the tight dress.
1411.title: Dynamic Duo Dining

14111.content:
“Mmm, smells good” Zack complimented as Kennedy lifted the lid of a pot, producing a cloud of steam.

“Yeah she’s quite a cook” Marissa smiled as she leaned back over her shoulder at her girlfriend. “Not what I expected when I started dating a football player.”

“Oh! You play?” Zack asked, peering over Marissa’s shoulder, suddenly extremely keen.

“Yeah just a little” Kennedy replied with a smile as she began to serve up.

“Hmmph, modest” Marissa chuckled, causing her massive bosom to quake, “She is the Quarterback most of the time; all the other players are tiny in their skimpy outfits, she goes through them like a knife through butter.”

“I guess” Kennedy answered as she laid the plates out. It was a very meat-heavy meal, the entire circumference of the very large plates was filled to them brim with very heavy food. As Zack and Alice watched, Kennedy took out what looked like a condiment container and began to spread a grey powder over her food. Zack, out of politeness tried to reach for it, but Marissa stopped him.

“I wouldn’t take that if I were you, unless you want to end up like her” at this Marissa gave her girlfriends belly a generous pat, emitting a dull booming noise as she did. Zack recalled his hand; he didn’t feel like dousing his food in protein powder at the moment.

The group then tucked in, chatting as they ate. Compliments were initially thrown at Kennedy’s cooking “I just added some lemon zest, that’s all” before talk turned to schooling.

“So you both went to Buttercombe?” Zack asked, curious to hear stories of this infamous school from a second perspective.

“Yeah, but as I said, Alice and I hung out in different groups…all the parties all the time for me” Marissa recalled with a cheeky smile.

“Wait! I DO remember you!” Alice added suddenly, chocking down a forkful of steak. “You hung out with that tall Goth and the nerdy Asian girl!”

“I…uh…” Marissa stuttered, as her taller girlfriend leaned in, suddenly curious.

“I didn’t know you hung out with the school outcasts” she said in a sweet tone, “look at you being so cute and making friends.” It was Marissa’s turn to blush this time. The guest couple couldn’t help but laugh at the turned tables this time.

“Anyway” Marissa quickly interjected, eager to change the subject. “What are you two doing all the way here anyway?”

“I just got promoted to manager of the local Hammond Hotel” Zack explained with a hint of smugness; the opposing couple making little “ooo” motions with their lips at his fancy position.

“I have a scholarship at ASU” Alice added.

“Kennedy has one as well” Marissa interjected, pointing with her fork.

“Oh I only got it because they like me playing football for them” Kennedy shrugged off before turning to Alice, “What are you studying?”

“Fashion” Alice replied; at this both Kennedy and Marissa’s eyes grew wide.

“Oh my god!” Kennedy squealed, “Me too! I have missed out on some of the classes due to practice, no wonder I didn’t recognize you!”

“Oh wow! That’s amazing!” Alice replied. Kennedy was practically bobbing up and down in her pair of chairs at this.

“Oh oh oh! I can’t wait to show you all the little shops hidden away here! I used to visit them ever since I was little!” Kennedy practically swooned.

“Wait, little?” Zack interrupted. “So you were born here?”

“Yup!” Kennedy proudly replied, puffing her huge chest out, “Abercrombian born and bred!”

“Dam!” Alice muttered under her breath, there goes her bet.

"And Marissa, what do you do?" Zack asked, grinning internally at that little nugget of information.

"I...uh..." Marissa hesitently replied before a chubby hand was placed over her own.

"You have nothing to be ashamed of" Kennedy comforted, "She is at a local community college and works at a local cafe to help pay for this place." Kennedy stated proudly.

"It's nothing really" now it was Marissa's turn to be modest.

"Hush, you are supporting both of us and I love you for it" Kennedy added, booping Marissa on her nose. "You come home so tired every day, I wish I could take some of the load off for you."

"Well you come home tired too" Marissa replied, turning as best she could to face Kennedy in her pair of seats.

"That's only because I have to spend ages at the gym" Kennedy huffed back.

Zack and Alice chose to turn their attention back to their plates, this conversation looked like it was going to get very mushy and overly-sweet. After a few minutes of indefinable cooing noises Kennedy turned back to the guests.

"Sorry about that; I am going to get myself another protein shake, would anyone like seconds while I am up?" the beefy woman asked with her sweet innocent smile. The smaller couple simply looked at each other in mild horror. Seconds!? Just how much did these two eat?!

145.content:
"Telegram for the Carlyle-Tyler house!"

Zack stared blankly at the tiny little man in the red valet uniform. He looked like Abu from Aladdin. Right down to the short stature and tussled hair. He was this scrawny little guy, pale as could be, with a little crop of brown hair up top beneath a pillbox hat. It took literally every ounce of willpower he had not to bust out laughing once he realized what was going on.

"Are you serious?" His face faltered, showing a smile, "You're kidding me, right?"

"Who is it, sweetie?"

Alice came into the living room, drying her hair with a white towel. She had thrown on some of Zack's old pajamas. Damn.

"We have a telegram?"

It sounded more like a question that Zack was asking. But it was weird! Almost nobody knew them in Abercrombie. Who could have possibly known where they lived, outside of maybe their parents? And even then, it wasn't like either of them were going to spring for a telegram. Alice's mom was too chintzy, and much more preferred to do her nagging where her tone could be appreciated and feared. And Zack's mom ws old school, but not that old school.

"They still do those?" Alice asked with an optimistic glee as she bounced over to the front door, "What's it say? Or... is that the thing where we need to know morse code or...?"

"I-It's like a letter..." The little guy said skittishly, "It's a little old fashioned, yeah, but... hey, fella's gotta eat, right?"

Zack and Alice took the letter from the valet's hand. It was an austere looking thing—with artificially yellowed edges and printed on really nice, thick paper. It was sealed (sealed!) with wax, with an emblem made up of a stylized S and W. It pained Alice to open something so beautiful, so she urged Zack to open it gently...

Dearest Alice,

One, this letter's from Sam. Sam Wilsey—you do still remember me, right? We haven't seen each other for so long, I was afraid your blonde ass would forget about me! Two, sorry about the valet. I figured it might be a little weird, but hey, it's all about presentation, right?

Which brings me to my next point:

I'm writing you because I saw that you moved into town a couple weeks ago, and wanted to invite you over to my place. We're, like way overdue for a reunion. As you can probably tell by the valet, a lot has changed for me. So get your ass over to my house this weekend and we'll catch up! Bring your man if you want! Trust me, there's plenty of room to keep him occupied while we catch up.

Kidding!

Love ya,
Sam

PS: don't feel obligated to tip the valet. I already took care of that.
145.title: Telegram from a Friend Long Forgotten!

1451.content:
hat weekend, Zack and Alice headed out.

The ride to chateau Wilsey was a long one. She lived just outside the city limits of Abercrombie. But Abercrombie was a big place. It was a really scenic route, with lots of flatlands and fields. Plenty of wildlife all around. Even still, it took about an hour and a half to get from their apartment complex to "almost there." And all the while, the only thing on Zack's mind was...

"So who's this Sam girl anyway?"

Zack could help but find himself a little perturbed by the fact that he was only just now hearing about one of his girlfriend's closest friends. Granted, they hadn't talked much about her life at Buttercombe. She had been much more enthralled learning about Daven's Port, and he had been way too focused on falling in love with her. After two years of dating, Zack only really knew about Megan and Ronnie—two of Alice's oldest friends. But he hadn't heard much about Sam; or if he did, he couldn't remember it.

"She's an old friend." Alice said definitively, fiddling with her smartphone, "She was friends with me, Megan and Ronnie when I went to Buttercombe. We were in the same grade—I'm pretty sure that I've told you about her before."

"I mean yeah..." Zack chuckled nervously, "But like... you know, what's she like?"

Alice seemed to ponder this for a minute. Like she was asking herself this for the first time herself.

"I don't know... she swore a lot." Alice said nonchalantly, seemingly oblivious to Zack's suspicions, "Sam and I were roommates after Megan graduated, so I guess you could say that we were pretty close. I used to help her with her homework and she used to help me keep those prissy white girls off of me. Sam was pretty tough."

"Uh-huh..."

"Yeah she was this really deep writer. I remember she used to write all this great poetry." Alice said before she started laughing, "I remember one time I found her journal of poems and she—snort!—she got this horrified look on her face!"

Alice fell into a giggling fit.

"I swear to effing God if you tell anybody I'll effing kill you!" Alice recreated the scene, poorly, as she laughed, "I teased her so much for that. I don't know why she hid them. They were really good!"

Zack's supsicions were not abated. It seemed so odd that he had never heard of this Sam woman. Not that he expected Alice to tell her everything about her life (there were a few seedy details that he himself had tactfully left out!) but for them to be so close—close enough for her to send her a valet. It made Zack a little on edge.

The rest of the ride was mostly uneventful, until eventually their sputtering sedan came into view of a large mansion, out in the middle of the fields.

Despite the oddity of it all, the building was definitely organic. It didn't stand out like a sore thumb, despite the fact that it was literally a giant mansion in the middle of flatlands. They could see a big lake nearby, and there were lots of domestic plants nearby. A cobblestone driveway led them up to a gate, which sealed them off from the interior yard.

"Um... hi?" Zack pushed the button, "We're uh... we're here to see Sam?"

There was a pause.

"Come right in then."

A few seconds later, the gate doors opened, allowing the silver sedan to sputter on through. Zack and Alice were amazed by the tender love and care that the yard were given, the beautiful sights as flora crawled up beautiful sculptures and were carved into magnificent topiary. A few shirtless, sweaty folks were tending to the impressive garden as they passed by. They gave friendly enough waves as Zack and Alice passed.

"Wow." Zack whistled, his suspicions abated momentarily abated, "Buttercombe girls really are rich."

"Yeah but..." Alice's blonde brow furrowed in confusion, "Sam's not..."

Another look at the garden. The gardeners. The gate. The intercom.

"At least, she didn't used to be..."

***


Alice and Zack were thrust inside the stately Wilsey manor. Their coats were taken, and they were shown to the sitting room. One of many sitting rooms, presumably. And that's when they met her.
1451.title: Rendezvous with an Old Friend...

14513.content:
They were sitting across from one another, each a loveseat to themselves with a coffee table in between them. They had been discussing, idly, the strange choice in decorum for Alice's supposedly punk-rock former roommate. When suddenly, Zack noticed, their waters began to ripple. The sound of heavy footsteps, both knew the sound quite well, rattled the room. Growing closer and closer until the foyer doors opened to reveal one massively made over mate.

"Alice!" Came a husky, raspy voice, "You came!"

At once, this sea of white blubber entered the room. It took both doors opened, wide, for the master of the house to make her way through. Samantha Wilsey was this enormous woman, no older than Alice, but more than four... five times her size. Neither of them had ever seen a woman so large!

Of course, like most Buttercombe alum, Alice had expected her friend to have retained some of her pre-graduation weight. Most of her friends did. But to have nearly doubled in size since they had thrown off their caps... it was unheard of!

As Sam rushed over, gasping with effort, her entire body seemed to quake. Her great gut was this heavy, multiply-tiered bulge that swung pendulously with her every labored step. Her legs were, comparatively, stout and very under-equipped to handle such a load. Though very bolstered by the great rings of fat that encased them, built with two enormous cheeks to act as counterbalance to Sam's swollen stomach. The floorboards creaked and groaned, squeaking in agony as Sam made her way ponderously over to Alice.

She had dressed rather conservatively, much to eithers' surprise. It wouldn't have done her justice to call Sam's outfit a muumuu, but it was a long dress that had been designed with her size clearly in mind. It was, however, very tight. Alice and Zack could see every roll and fold coming at them as soon as she entered the room—the deep canyon of her belly button was very much on display even behind the fabric. Her triple chins tremored with her every step as she somehow made her way over to Alice and wrapped her in a big, fleshy hug.

"Ooh, Sammy..." Alice wheezed, "I... I missed you too..."

Zack, meanwhile, took this opportunity to drink in this woman. This whale. Alice had told him that most Buttercombe girls were big. But this... this was something else entirely...

"Oh I've missed you so much!" Sam squealed like a girl half her age and a fourth her size, "Can't believe you went and got so fucking skinny on me, girl! You're so fuggin' pretty I wanna squeeze you!"

"Y-Yeah!" Alice managed, suffocating beneath all that was Sam Wilsey's girth "You, uh... you too..."

The difference between the two women was astounding. Both he and Alice had been big before. But even put together, Zack doubted that they could have matched Sam Wilsey in size. Her short crop of black hair allowed for her inflated cheeks to puff out, her chins resting on the acreage of cleavage that her low-cut dress showcased. Her arms were as big around as Alice's thighs! And the way Alice sunk deeper and deeper into her friend's fat, the harder and harder she squeezed... Zack was honestly afraid that she might suffocate in there!

"Uh, hey!" Zack called out in an attempt to save his girlfriend from certain doom, "I'm, uh... I'm Zack. The boyfriend. Nice to meet you!"

"Nice to meet you too!" Sam released Alice (who broke away pink-faced and panting) before taking Zack's outstretched hand and giving it a good shake, "I'm Sam. Your girl's probably told you all about me."

Uh...

"Uh..."

"Seriously?" Sam cut her eyes at Alice, "You get yourself a man and you forget all about your little friends from high school, huh? Way to put misters before sisters, Alice."

Alice smiled sheepishly, trying to not-so-obviously scope out the size of her friend's impressively immense ass. She was huge! Sam had always been the bigger one between them (well, after Sophomore year, anyway...) but Alice had never suspected that she would have gotten this... this... huge!

"Phew... oh man... I gotta siddown..." Sam panted, her cheeks reddening along their crests, "All this catching up is exhausting. What do you say we—
14513.title: Super-Sized, Super Spoiled Sam

choices: Alice wants to please her newfound old friend
No way, Alice is stuffed!
145132.content:
Sam plopped down into a sofa with a well-worn groove, already sagging in the middle. She fanned herself with her hand. “Phew… siddown, you two,” she gestured to their loveseats across the coffee table. “What do you say we catch up, talk about the 'good old days'? I can tell you all kinds of embarrassing stories. Say, still remember the shit we had to bear from that stuck-up bitch, what was 'er name, Gail?”

“Grace, Grace Sawyer,” Alice involuntarily lowered her voice as if mere mention of her could call her old nemesis back.

“Yeah, but you showed her good, Alice! Right?”

“Alice? You?” Zack turned to his timid girlfriend with a look of utter surprise.

She shrank in her seat. “Uh, well...”

“You haven't told him anything? What were you doing all the time, girl?” Seeing her old friend redden, Sam cheerfully laughed, making all her chins wobble. But that laugh quickly turned to a bark. “Carmen! Where the hell are you? I told you to bring the snacks as soon as my guests arrive!”

A young, plump Hispanic woman scurried into the stately room with a large platter in each hand. “S-sorry, Missus, the cook was still getting them ready… But they're on the way now. They'll be here in a moment.”

“Well, good,” Sam glared at her for a bit, then turned back to Zack, all smiles again. “You oughtta hear this, Zack. How your little Alice got the biggest, meanest bitch of all Buttercombe expelled...”

***

“… and remember when we had our first taste of Buttercombe dinners?” Alice giggled.

“Yeah, that was the shit,” Sam nodded, plopped another canape into her mouth and turned to Zack who was getting a glazed-over look. “But we're talking and your man here's bored to death, huh? Hey, listen, Jack's got plenty of games here, console, arcade, God knows what other shit's there. Interested?” Not waiting for his reply, she shouted, “Carmen! Where're you? Move your lazy butt here and take Zack to the game room!”

“No, no, I don't want to impose...” Zack didn't get any further.

“Bullshit!” Sam laughed out loud when she saw his startled expression. Then she relented. “Look, I want you to enjoy your time here just like Alice does. So just run along and play. And Carmen'll take you some more snacks. Y'hear, girl?”

“Yes, Missus.” The Hispanic bobbed her head.

“And tell the cook to bring more snacks to us too! Or I'll tell Jack you're both starving me to death!” And Sam caressed her enormous gut as if she believed it.

“So your… uh, Jack, likes gaming?” Alice picked up courage to ask about the thing she was interested in the most – Sam's mysterious partner.

“Yeah, he's quite a bit into it. And wasted a fortune on various old arcades etcetera. I used to love that stuff, too, but it's sooo exhausting,” Sam languidly stretched on her sofa. “Much better to just watch TV, y'know? Which reminds me, what do you think about...”

***

Another hour has passed and Alice was getting a little frustrated. Doubly frustrated, she admitted to herself. With Sam, for avoiding all her indirect hints about Sam's mystery man. And with herself for partaking a bit too much in the feast that spread in front of her – in the best (or worst) Buttercombe traditions. She was again experiencing that familiar sated feeling and her little tummy was curving up.

She sighed, dusted off crumbs from her blouse and opted for direct attack. “Listen, how did you meet, uh...?”

“You mean my Jack? Jack Spencer? That's another long story. Pretty long and pretty twisted one, girl. Aaand… ” Sam snickered and half-turned her head to the window. Alice watched, fascinated, her chins rearranging. “And it's better be to leave it for next time since that's his beemer in the driveway. You'll stay for dinner, right?”
145132.title: Recalling Buttercombe Hospitality

choices: "Well, how's about we stretch that capacity?"
"You know, your boyfriend looks like someone with an appetite..."
1451322.content:
A throaty belch and a deep blush was Sam's answer. Alice was simply stuffed to the eyeballs. On her skinnier frame she looked about 8 months pregnant.

"Er, sorry Sam." Alice blushed "But I couldn't eat another bite. You'd have to roll me out of here if I stayed for dinner!"

Sam rolled her eyes at this and let out a very unladylike snort. "Don't gimme that shit princess, I've seen you pack away a ton more food then this." With this Sam belched loudly, just for the hell of it. She liked to get under Alice's skin like this.

Alice wrinkled her nose at the smell, then nervously replied. "Sam, that was years ago. I was younger and naive-" "Still naive." Sam grunted. Alice ignored the overstuffed woman and continued. "And I was much, well, bigger...." Alice blushed again. "I had more room to store all that food inside of me."

Sam thumped her engorged gut and shifted her weight...
1451322.title: No way, Alice is stuffed!

choices: Alice tries to avoid overeating by keeping up conversation with Jack
Alice catches a second breath and stuffs her face
14513221.content:
“Well, how's about we stretch that capacity? Or are you going to shame all Buttercombe alumni, eh?”

Alice scrounged her face sadly, looking for a way out. She badly wanted to stay, yes, and not just to oblige her old friend. She'd enjoyed the idle afternoon and there were so many more things to ask Sam! But she ought to watch her eating, she'd already scarfed down enough calories for two days. And besides... “I really couldn't fit a single mouthful,” she made a sad face.

“Oh, don't worry 'bout that, girl. That's what digestifs are for. We've got an excellent cure for full stomachs,” Sam half-turned as if willing to go for it herself, “Carmen! Bring me that Normandy calvados! And two glasses!”

“Yes, ma'm.”

“Do you drink calvados, Alice? Remember, if you say yes you'll get to meet my sweet Jack at dinner,” Sam winked at her.

That settled it. Curiosity made Alice accept the dinner – and a glass of calvados – and while she watched the Latino maid manoeuvre her behemoth of a friend out of her sofa, she quietly sipped it. She'd never drunk calvados and it was so good! Smooth and nicely sweet and yet a tad tart too, it tasted better than drinking apple cider… and though she knew it had a lot bigger kick too, Alice decided it was good.

When Sam was finally hoisted upright, she noticed Alice licking her empty glass. “Like it, huh?”

“Are you kidding? I love it,” Alice giggled and turned to the maid. “I could drink it all night. Refill, please? And you're right, I feel I could eat a little bit more.”

“Watch out, girl, it's strong stuff. D'you wanna get stoned before my man comes? By the way, believe it or not, Jack's distantly related to one of our schoolmates. Huh? Jack Spencer,” Sam emphasised his surname. “As in… Arisa?”

“You mean he's somehow related to Arisa Boonliang-Spencer?” Alice couldn't quite wrap her mind around it. She took another big gulp of calvados instead.

“Yeah, to that whale,” Sam ironically ignored her own bulging body that must have outgrown Arisa's and went on. “Un-frickin'-believable, right? And somehow is a good word. Jack explained it all to me, and not just once but all I got from it is, they don't have a family tree but a real jungle. Huff...” she ponderously moved towards the door. “And he should be here right about… now.”

As if on cue, door swung open and Alice could finally see Sam's partner. Jack Spencer was dark-haired and chocolate-skinned, as befitted his familial relationship with Arisa. Otherwise, though, he seemed her exact opposite – quite tall and quite slim, lithe might be a better word; with a moustache and a goatee like a cheap B-movie villain. Impeccably dressed in an expensive-looking dark striped suit and a tie, he looked like a slick broker ready to help you part with all your money.

Floorboards groaned when Sam affectionately leaned into his embrace (well, a demi-embrace at best). “Hi, lover!” she chirped like a girl a third her size. “How was your day?”

“Terrible. Boring, drab and tedious. I missed you,” he bent over for a long, thorough kiss. Only then did he notice the shy blonde figure trying to blend into the background. “Oh? We have a visitor?”

“Yeah, that's Alice. Y'know? I toldya 'bout her. Even showed you our photos together!”

“Oh, right? The schoolmate from Buttercombe? Is that you?” Jack's upper-class accent rolled the words as he looked Alice up and down, “I'd expected someone, eh… less mature looking,” he saved nicely.

“Well, duh! Those photos were four, five years old,” Sam shrugged, oblivious to the hidden context.

“And I, uh, I slimmed down, uh, a lot...” stammered Alice, all-too-aware of the new bulge around her waist.

“Oh, there was no need, you looked stunning back then. Just like you do today. Anyway, welcome to the Wilsey-Spencer household,” he untangled himself from Sam's folds and stepped forward to kiss Alice's hand like a Victorian era gentleman. She felt a blush forming on her cheeks while he went on, “I trust you'll stay for dinner? I can promise you a feast worthy of Buttercombe.”

“Uh, y-yeah...”

“Don't worry, Jack, I already talked her into it. Yeah, they'll have dinner with us,” Sam barged in. “So we should go eat right now, huh?”

“They?” Jack looked around the room as if expecting to find someone he overlooked in there.

“Oh, sure, Carmen, go fetch, err... Zack from the game room! See, Jack, her boyfriend got bored listening to girl talk so we sent him to play some games. You don't mind, do you?”

“Oh, that's OK. That's why they're here, eh?” he winked at the girls, making Alice wonder if Sam had learned this gesture from him. “Zack and Jack, huh? We should go along splendidly.”

By this time steps echoing in the vast hallway announced the missing guest and soon a sheepish-looking Zack entered the room. After another round of introductions everyone moved to the dining room, Sam leaning on her boyfriend. He helped her reach a sturdy-looking loveseat, apparently adapted to her size. She ponderously sat down again, spreading her thighs wide apart so her belly could freely flow downward. The plump maid quickly scurried to her mistress and placed a small stool underneath it.

Jack looked up to see his guests already seated and clapped his hands. “Bring the first course!”
14513221.title: Aiming for Buttercombe Capacity

choices: Tomorrow the chauffeur picks Alice up
At home, Zack wants to discuss Sam and her size
145132211.content:
“First a little apéritif, dear guests, my beloved,” Jack smoothly took over the host role, “to whet our appetites. Cheers! To old friends… and new,” he winked at Alice. “The first course is Mexican, just some small hors-d'oeuvres. I hope you'll enjoy.”

Perhaps his perspective was skewed by living with Sam but there was nothing small about tacos, fajitas and who knows what else on large platters that were brought to the table by two maids (one was Carmen, Sam called the other, even plumper one Teresa). They both returned to the kitchen twice before they filled the entire surface with food. This was to be first course? At first Alice thought they'd never be able to eat all that but when she had a look at Sam she realised how wrong she was.

Sam ate like a woman possessed, as if she hadn't eaten for days, no, weeks. At first she made a couple attempts at small talk but that soon gave way to piggish grunts and other gluttonous sounds as she was scarfing down everything in her reach and stuffing herself even further, paying no heed to her guests.

Alice felt somewhat embarrassed by that shameless display of gluttony. And a little alarmed, when she noticed Sam's appetite was rubbing off on her too. She put down her second taco, reminding herself she wanted to slow down. She'd already crammed her stomach full today, no need to stretch it even further. She knew she had to find a diversion so she turned to Jack. “So how did you two… get to know each other?”

“Oh, that's an epic tale,” he smiled a little, “and rather too long for this small dinner, I am afraid. But I can give you a short digest, at least. One day I was returning back to Abercrombie from a business trip and only when my plane landed, I realised I messed up. You see, I always call my chauffeur to pick me up at the airport but that one time I forgot. Luckily, as it turned out. Oh, by the way, have you tried our fajitas yet? They're to die for, Maria – that is, our cook – is a wonder. Here, let me get them for you.”

“Anyway, where was I? Oh yes, at the airport, with no way to get home. Oh, sure, if I called Mike, he'd jump into the limo but it would take him at least an hour to get there, even if he broke all kinds of speed limits. And I didn't want to wait that long. Burritos, Zack?”

“I didn't want to wait at all, I was feeling restless, so I went to the airport Hertz office. It must've been fate, eh, darling?” Sam just grunted. “I went there and behind the counter I saw a woman so striking, so… original that I just stood there staring...”

***


The large dining table was strewn with remnants of the last course. There had been half a dozen desserts to choose from and although Alice had tried to exercise her self-control, she still managed to taste all of them. But now she was well beyond full and couldn't swallow a single bite more. And from the looks she'd exchanged with Zack he felt similar. Jack, too, ate only a couple pieces but there was no need to worry about leftovers.

Their humongous hostess was so stuffed her stomach turned into a perfectly spherical shape, all its rolls and creases smoothed out. Sam's face was flushed, red and sweaty, she must have been far past the point of sating herself but her greedy gut wouldn't let her stop. She groaned and moaned and kept stuffing cheesecake into her mouth.

It was almost revolting and yet somehow entrancing, too. Alice placed both her hands on her stuffed tummy to prevent them from reaching for another morsel, started gently massaging that hard ball. “I'm glad I won't be the one driving home,” she noted to Zack sotto voce.

Zack let out a heavy sigh but their little exchange didn't escape Jack. “Oh, there's no need to overexert yourselves, either of you,” he rushed to assure them. “You can leave your car here, Mike will take you home in the limo. Huh?”

“We don't want to be a bother,” replied Alice immediately.

“Oh, no bother at all, trust me. You can pick your car tomorrow evening or some other day. That is, unless you need your car right in the morning?”

“No, no, I can take the bus to work,” Zack assured him. “I usually do anyway. And so does Alice.”

“I see. Well, in that case...” he let it hang in the air.

Alice had another look at Zack and his painful scowl. “Yes, we accept. You have our gratitude. And Zack's too busy at work tomorrow but I'll come to pick up our sedan.”

“Excellent! Tell Mike and he'll pick you up tomorrow in the city. Well, then,” Jack smiled warmly at both of them, “I'm glad that's sorted out.”

“I am afraid it is getting rather late and Zack has a morning shift so...” Alice shrugged, looking at her old friend, still stuffing her face.

This finally broke her trance. Sam took several deep breaths before they heard her deep voice again. “OK, girl, but remember, you can come anytime.” And her next sentence proved she'd been following their previous conversation, certainly to some degree: “And we'll continue our little chat tomorrow.”

“Sure.”

“Well, I'll take you to the car, no need to bother Sam with getting up right now, eh, dear?”

“You betcha, lover!”

“Thank you for coming and just like Sam said, you're always welcome here – that goes for you, too, Zack,” the smooth businessman slipped between them, hooked an arm through theirs and guided them towards the main entrance. “Mike! I have a small errand for you. Can you take our guests home?”

There was a small grunt but then the unseen chauffeur answered, “Sure, boss.” And in no time, a large limo stopped right in front of them.

“See you tomorrow, Alice,” Jack opened the door for her, “and you, too, hopefully, Zack.”

“See you.”

“Yeah, maybe. Bye. Oh, God!” Zack plopped down on the plush back seat and unzipped his pants. “I thought I was going to die. I couldn't eat another bite.”

“Me neither,” Alice couldn't bring herself to unzip her skirt, as much as she'd have liked to.

“So that's your bestie, huh? She's...” Zack became aware of chauffeur's presence, “an interesting girl.”

“Yeah, that she is. She's always been.” Alice wasn't inclined to discuss Sam's expansion either, certainly not here.

“They're both very nice but, ughh… I don't think I'll be coming here often.”

“Yeah, me neither, except I have to pick our car. Oh, this reminds me, Mr. uh, Mike? Jack told me you could pick me up tomorrow and drive me to the Spencer residence.”

“Sure, Miss, just tell me where and when.”

info.description:
—YOUNG & HUNGRY—


Zack Tyler and Alice Carlyle are two young lovebirds, ready to start a new life together.

What started out as a summer fling on the sunny shores of Daven's Port quickly became something much more as the titular twosome fell head over heels in love with each other. As soon as Alice finished her senior year at the prestigious Buttercombe Academy she quickly used her lofty credentials to enroll in Daven's Port Community College, so as to be more closely located to Zack as he toiled his way up the ladder of the Hammond Hotel racket.

Now that Alice has been accepted to a more prestigious college studying fashion and Zack is getting a promotion, the two have decided that it's time for them to take it a step further. They're moving halfway across the country to a new town called Abercrombie, where hopefully they can move towards bigger and better things!

Emphasis on the bigger.


****



—RULES—



ANYONE CAN GAIN—


This interactive is born from the acclaim and favor that two fan-favorite characters have received from their respective interactives. As they are both male and female, characters of both genders are free to gain weight within the confines of this story. That being said, this story does not have to be about mutual gaining. Male and female characters can gain together or exclusively, the choice is entirely up to you.


THE BIGGER THE BETTER—


Just like Zack and Alice, this is your chance to break molds set by their respective interactives! I encourage weird science, a little magic, and huge gains to enter these young lovers' lives! I only ask that whatever you write, it be well-written. I only ask that, as writers, we try to stay away from the clichés of instantaneous, hundreds-of-hamburgers-in-one-sitting gaining and give it your best work!


THIS IS OUR STORY—


These interactives wouldn't be nearly as fun without the readers and writers who put so much work into making them. I encourage everyone to please, be creative! Take the road less traveled, and take it in a direction that you want to see! Just because something might happen in one thread doesn't necessarily mean that the entire interactive will follow suit! If you have any questions about this interactive, comments or concerns, I implore you to e-mail me on my on-site address.


****


—OTHER INTERACTIVES—


I would like to thank literally everyone involved with making these interactives, and the two characters who hail from them, such enormous successes. I could never begin to imagine just how popular these stories would become, and how satisfying it has been to write for them. Without you, I wouldn't be here. These characters wouldn't be here. And more importantly, these stories wouldn't be here. Thank you, thank you so much. Everything I do, I do for you.



Buttercombe Academy for Growing Girls  [E]

a quality-controlled interactive about life in a pudgy prep school
by Bobo the Hobo (78)



Buttercombe Academy is the story of Alice's alma mater. Over the years it has become one of the longest and detailed interactives on Writing.com, and provides much of Alice's source material as a character. Inside are stories of students and staff (Alice included!) as they find themselves at the mercy of their own whims and willpowers in one of the most luxurious and pampering schools in America.

Since there are no boys allowed on campus, this interactive caters exclusively to fans of female weight gain.



 
Super-Sized: the Mel Carlyle Story  [E]
#2041198

follow Mel in her attempts to go from big, to bigger, to biggest!
by Bobo the Hobo (78)
}



Super-Sized is the story of Alice's sister Mel, following her graduation from Buttercombe Academy. It works as more of a direct spin-off to Buttercombe, and may not bear much weight on this particular story, but I and many others enjoy it just the same. Mel is a four-hundred pound active gainer, who aspires to be the world's fattest woman. There's no real "right" way to tell her story, thanks to its looser story-telling style. Mel can wind up anywhere, doing anything! As long as she's getting fat along the way!

Like Buttercombe Academy, Super-Sized focuses on female weight gain. However, it does allow for male weight gain to occur.



Daven's Port  [E]

Dakota moves to a new town, where she finds herself and her friends getting bigger...
by Bobo the Hobo (78)



Daven's Port is the story of Zack's hometown, and the adventures of his friend Dakota Johnson as she finds her place in it. Though younger than its sister interactive, Daven's Port has quickly developed a cult following thanks to the talented writing from many different authors, as well as its unique reading experience. Though the story isn't about Zack per se, he does play a large part in how it unfolds, and is one of the main character's very first friends in her new home town. But life in the city gets weird sometimes, especially when everyone's growth spurt just means that they're getting fat.

Daven's Port, like this interactive, caters to fans of both male and female gain.
